I wanted to watch this movie for a long time but couldn't find a copy. Then a friend invited me over to watch it on netflix. I was amazed. All the things I had ever heard about it were true! It was a pile of S%$T!! At first my friend and I were just laughing hysterically, the movie was so bad it was funny. This was because the acting was so bad we couldn't believe it, emotions were hard to register, facial expression looked absolutely ridiculous and the actors didn't even look like they knew what they were doing. It honestly looked like the director tried to find the worst actors ever. But thats OK, because this may be the worst script of all time, so no talent was wasted. Seriously, the story is a mess and the dialogue is horrible. It sounds stiff, forced and is completely unbelievable. The plot is also equally ridiculous,making little sense and full of obvious holes that weigh the film down even more. On top of all that the film is just idiotic in every way possible. The effects suck,the makeup is like something from a children's show with no budget and the premise is so silly it defies belief. Only watch this film if you truly want to see some of the most incompetent film making ever

There is nothing good I can say about this film... Really!

However, as is now well known - The film has become a major hit because it is just SO DAMN BAD!

The script is terrible, the acting is awful, the plot has more holes than swiss cheese!

That said... It has some scenes that are truly memorable... For god knows what reason - Bearing in mind I saw this film back in the early 1990's on VHS... I have never been able to forget that young lass running through the woods who gets "Melted" and eaten by the Goblins (Oh yes!!! They are Goblins - NOT TROLLS!!!! So why the HELL IS IT CALLED TROLL 2???)

Much as it is bad... Its a film that has to be seen to be believed! And now deserves it much heralded status as one of the WORST FILMS EVER!!!!

If only someone had not released Birdemic... It just may have stayed there too!

review_title: My grandma died because of this movie

review_detailed_main: This was easily the most grating movie I have ever had the displeasure to sit through. Its hardly worth the time it takes for me to write this review, but it has left such a horrid taste in my mouth that I fear if I don't spew it out, I may to turn into a troll....I mean a goblin. That's right, Troll 2 doesn't have a single troll in it. That's not the worst part. All of the actors (save for the obnoxious kid) seem to have been dosed with a near-lethal cocktail of anti-psychotics and sedatives. They also appeared to have been instructed to read the lines as if they had no comprehension of proper inflection and/or any type of readable/audible human emotion. I could look past a phony accent, but these people seemed to have been beamed down from some planet where language itself simply does not exist. The result is a bona fide suck-fest of a film that I, a man with a wide sense of humor, have trouble comprehending. Just what exactly was this movie? That question has muddled my mind for the past 24 hour period and I advise strongly against going down that dark and dreary road for it will surely end with your ears bleeding. This movie was nothing more than a dreadful reminder of why I don't carry a gun.

review_title: There's lots of good times to be had in Nilbog
review_detailed_main: If Grandpa Seth only warned the parents of little Joshua that vacationing in Nilbog is not the best destination instead of leaving that to poor Joshua, this foolish family would never have gotten into this foolish mess. Troll 2 does not operate by any understandable logic, it was conceived and filmed in some sort of alternate dimension where the rules of higher thought are twisted and distorted into the wonderful travesty that is Troll 2. Putting aside the sheer lunacy and jaw dropping idiocy that is the plot about vegetarian Goblins who turn humans into plants and vegetables to be eaten, it's the stilted dialogue delivery, the Z grade production value, the Goblin costumes that would be laughed off stage in a elementary school play - that gives Troll 2 it's amazingly stupid charm. As a child I vividly remember watching this on VHS, only to find myself beyond confused at the infamous popcorn scene and god knows what else, only to rediscover this special film years later, along with the rest of the bad movie loving world. Troll 2 may live up to its title as the worst or one of the worst films of all time, but it's never boring and you'll get a good laugh.

review_title: The best worst movie of all time
review_detailed_main:
This is the worst movie of all time. This movie is so bad, that I questioned what I'm still doing on this planet. This movie is so bad, that it actually good. I couldn't stop laughing for 2 hours at the terrible plot, acting, and everything else in this movie. First of all, the movie isn't even about trolls, its about goblins... The entire concept is just ridiculous and makes absolutely no sense at all. I feel like whoever came up with this idea had a stick shoved up his ass all the way to his brain or something. Something that made it so he couldn't think straight, because this movie was so bad, that it gave me cancer. I lost intelligence from watching this movie.

However, you should watch it. Why? It is so bad that it actually happens to be the funniest movie ever created. You will laugh more at how terrible this movie than you have ever laughed at any other comedy movie. I can't even describe how bad it is, you just have to see it.

review_title: The first movie of Troll was good and this is awful
review_detailed_main: There are some movies that are thought be most to be the worst movie ever. And a lot the time I do not agree. But this is one were I do. This is worst then the original Troll and that was awful. I do not mind that it had nothing to do with the original Troll. Or that there were no Trolls in this movie and it should have been called Goblins. But it was so badly acted. So badly written. It had such any awful ending. It was not scary at all. I have to say. What a pile pooh. This really is one of the worst horror movies ever. I question it when people say this is the worst movie ever especially when it is a horror movie. Or when it is science fiction. But this one is a real turkey. Not the movie that people say this turkey when nothing could be rather from the trues. A really turkey.

review_title: I'm at a loss for words
review_detailed_main:
The title of this review says it all. But, it's better than The Room, Fateful Findings and Cool as Ice combined. I highly recommend getting your local library to buy it, as I did. I'm sure they were thrilled to put in the order :-)

Enjoy.
This must be one of the Greatest movies i have ever seen.

review_title: The Best Horror Parody that was never meant to be Parody!
review_detailed_main: This film feels like there was an intention to make it both scary and funny, but to me, it just translated to full blown horror parody. And, now that I'm reading that this movie wasn't meant to be a parody at all, I love this movie so much more. This movie is reviewed way too low. It's got everything: it's legit scary at times (this movie has some cool body horror and a wacky, real terrifying at times, antagonist), it has hilarious characters (they react to things for way too long, their line readings are a hoot), and it legit just feels like a parody (I mean, the opening is essentially stolen from The Princess Bride!). If you view this as just a horror, you won't like it. The same can be said if you view it as just a comedy. But, through the lens of parody like Airplane or Naked Gun (but with actual horror elements), you'll love this! It will have you saying, "oh my gooood!!"

A film that has really nothing to do with trolls. A sequel that has really nothing to do with the original. It is bad. No given it does have some memeable moments in the film but it is not good. It has nothing to offer for people looking to watch a movie with any quality. It does have something for people willing to watch a bad movie and make fun of it with their friends as they finish a LARGE bottle of whisky. If sober and alone stay as far as way as possible because the film will just make you angry with how stupid it is. If you just want to catch the highlights of film watch the documentary based on the film.

review_title: This was a good old fashion horror movie.

review_detailed_main:
Very, very, very bad film; extraordinarily bad in fact that a rating of one out of ten feels to be very generous.

From start to finish there were many, many flaws to this film, one being the obvious pointer that it was goblins and not trolls, and the goblins just looked very bad in appearance, and in acting.

Other flaws of this poorly acted out films can be pointed towards the writing, scenery, and to it's effects, which were just very, very bad indeed. I am not sure if the actors were either professionally taught or just background extras out of high schools with no life experience, they were that poor in their presentation.

Lastly, the script was just poorly written with actors presented like robots, like were there even rehearsals or readings before they began filming or what? Didn't feel like it. Oh, and not forgetting the grandpa angle, poor.

This is probably one the poorest films even made, one flawed top to bottom, and that says something. We are not exaggerating either.

Troll 2 is simply one of the worst films (in my opinion) that has ever been made. But is it so terrible that its good? Depending on how you choose to view it, the movie can be an unbearable pain, or a hilarious comedy. Everything, every single aspect of the film is far below average. But this can also be ingredients to getting a good laugh.

This means though that you can expect sets, actors, lines, music, effects, costumes, and camera work that reeks of incompetence. I cannot, literally cannot imagine trying to make a serious film and having it turn out like that. Sure I could make a purposefully poor film that may be comparable with Troll 2, but without a lot of intent. I wonder if the creators of this film had some.....issues, that is the only logical explanation I can fathom.

If you choose to take Troll 2 seriously then this film will feel like torture, and by the ending your brain will have reduced itself to mush. I really enjoy watching poorly made films to laugh at them, so this movie was very enjoyable to me.

A horrendously inept film. The production values are atrocious, the dialogue is implausible, and the acting is something you have to see to believe. I cannot understand how so many bad choices were made in this film. The lighting, the costumes, the soundtrack to list but a few. The costume design for the goblins is laughable and I couldn't believe the performance given by the mother character which was woeful. The entire premise of the movie though is so absurd that this couldn't possibly be taken seriously as a horror movie I think. Even the special effects in Troll 2 are a disaster. It's really difficult to conjure up a film which fails so badly at all the elements needed for a good horror movie.

If you delight in torture in its purest form, you've found the right movie here. I was a fan of the first movie, watched in my early teen years, so I was eager to recapture a bit of the B Movie magic it had originally displayed. What I got was a maddening exercise in bad acting, horrible writing and cringe worthy cast interactions. At a mere guess I'd say the same misguided soul who produced this, also wrote and filmed it. To imagine work this bad being the result of a larger cast of movie makers is indeed frightening. Nearly 30 years after its release I have to hope that those involved in its production look back with an embarrassed laugh. Anything resembling pride should be buried deep down and never brought to light.

review_title: Disturbing and as bad as proclaimed
review_detailed_main:
Troll 2 has seemingly been advertised and recognized as a "so bad it's good". It is without a doubt one of the worse films yet there may be some things which make it slightly entertaining instead of completely boring.

The acting is subpar and amateurish. The plot is weird and makes little sense and the goblin creatures (not trolls) are quite creepy and disturbing looking.

The film isn't as funny as people claim. Had very little laughs but most of them were of unintentional.

There is some sort of unpredictability within the plot which isn't completely bad. Overall Troll 2 is beyond terrible yet should be watched to see how awful it is.

Watch it home alone, then it will suck.

Watch it in a movietheatre witg other drunkards and it's possible the funniest movie you'll se in a long time.
Both of them are in a collection on blu ray. I guess when a movie is so bad but gets that much publicity it can make it to blu ray.

review_title: One of the scariest movies I have ever seen (as in BAD)
review_detailed_main:
This film was to me a comedy as it has the worst productions values I have ever seen. I think it might have been shot and produced by an elementary student class.

I think when they had production meetings they must have been discussing how could they possibly make this the worst movie ever to have money spent on it. The acting is a joke. I did watch the entire movie just so that I could see how completely unbelievable they could make it. This film is however somewhat famous just because they have a following of people who like to poke fun at the most ridiculous film ever made.

Back in the early nineties I rented this abomination at a mom&pop video rental store. After about thirty minutes I stopped my VCR in utter disgust, rewound it, and never looked back. Fast forward almost twenty years and I stumble upon Troll 2 latenight on MGM HD channel. By the way, this channel is golden as far as showing terrible films in stunning 1080i no less. After sitting through this in its entirety I'm assured that I did the right thing those many years ago. Troll 2 is just THAT bad.

Directed by Italian hackmaster Claudio Fragasso, the real reason Zombie 3 sucks, here hiding behind the name Drago Floyd. The Waits family is participating in some bizarre hometown swap with some residents from the town of Nilbog, much to the chagrin of youngest son Joshua who delivers his lines with a facial grimace reserved for dire situations in a gas station bathroom when you have an upset stomach. Recently deceased Grandpa Seth assist Joshua from the beyond in keeping his family from being eaten from vegetarian goblins who instead of -I don't know eating plants!- have to get the humans to eat this disgusting green concoction that turns them into human trees to be consumed by the townsfolks, er trolls, I mean goblins. The goblins are controlled by their queen Creedence Leonore Gielgud who adds the ham to this cheese sandwich by using the same eyes widening schtick for every line she speaks. Joshua runs the gamut from urinating on dinner to assault with a bologna sandwich to save his family who are constantly hoodwinked

into consuming the food covered in green icing that no sane person would even think of eating. The fact that they never question anything in this bizarre town is what's so frustrating about this movie.

This film is definitely on par with Ed Wood's Plan 9 as far as worse acting performances ever. Joshua's mother Diana has the same clueless look on her face the whole friggin film and doesn't say one thing that's even remotely convincing. Michael Waits probably delivers one of the dumbest lines and probably most overlooked of this film as he explains to Joshua why the town is so empty in the middle of the day as a the "farmers are all asleep this time of night". Huh? One, it's mid afternoon. Two, what sort of farmer farms at night. Vampire farmers? Good god who wrote this! Which brings me to the worst of the worst. Holly Waits is the single most maddeningly awful character you will ever watch. It's downright vile how she spits her lines with this uber-bratty personality and her constant over emphasis on the wrong syllable. Her bizarre solo dance scene showcases that she's just as bad a dancer as an actress. There are some bad films that provide genuine enjoyment such as , for me at least, R.O.T.O.R., which is why the Bottom 100 is such as popular list. This film is not one of those as there is no hint of charm whatsoever. Avoid this movie at all cost.

I just came here for the comments section, as I am currently watching Troll 2 as I type this. I'm only 15 minutes in and the acting is so bad, I feel like there's supposed to be a punchline after every line that just doesn't come. Even with no punchline, it leaves me laughing. I usually can get over bad acting, but not this time. I'm so intrigued to see how "deep" these characters get that I'm actually going to continue watching. I just know there's going to be a huge payoff moment whenever they realize that Nilbog spelled backwards is Goblin. I can't wait!

review_title: Not the worst movie ever made (or second worst)

review_detailed_main:
Watching this movie is the best way to spend an hour and a half of your life. I tell anyone that hasn't seen it to view it as soon as possible, for it can only have a positive impact on your life in some way or at some point. I recently spent two hours walking around downtown San Francisco, a reportedly "cosmopolitan" city, but couldn't find Troll 2. I had to have a friend send me his copy. However I was able to find it in Video Ezy in New Lynn, New Zealand.

Embrace the film, the depth of the characters, the carefully written lines and of course the idea of a house switch with a family named the Presences'.

I was introduced to this gem by my friends and could not ever begin to repay them for how they have dramatically influenced my life.

Jennifer Aniston...ECK!!! Don't you know we hate friends here in Nilbog

Objectively awful and worthy of joyful mockery in every respect. But it's just not entertaining, and I'm more disappointed by that than anyone.

All of the memorable lines (of meme infamy) are before the thirty minute mark. And after that, it completely lost me; just bored to tears from then on.

We'd been on a bad movie kick recently; "Silent Night Deadly Night 2", "Miami Connection", "Samurai Cop", all fantastic. And I remember liking the documentary of this movie, so I was all primed and ready to go. This is like the mack daddy of trash movies, and I think I like the narrative of making "Troll 2" rather than the actual movie: that the cast really tried to make something legitimate, but circumstances conspired against them.

review_title: This movie is a strange specimen..
review_detailed_main:
Troll 2, in my opinion, isn't the worst movie ever made. That title would go to "Monster A- Go Go". This movie isn't exactly so bad its good either. Its sort of in between. That's not saying its a bad movie. A good movie wouldn't make a movie about goblins and call it Troll 2. The acting is beyond awful as well. Some of the actors in this movie, like the daughter, make Tommy Wiseau look like Bela Lugosi. And last, but not least, the trolls. Most of them look the same, which is like little kids in terrible plastic masks. I don't really understand what this movie was trying to accomplish. I couldn't tell if it was a horror, comedy, or both. In conclusion, stay away from this one.

I give it: 3/10

review_title: it must have melted my brain because I LOVED it!
If you looked up "awful" in the dictionary, you'd see a pic. of it!
review_detailed_main: Was recommended by more than one cynical friend to see this. Finally viewed it last Sat. night, and I'm still trying to recover 4 days later. Just had a few questions, other than, "Why was this movie even made in the first place"? Why did the dad have an unidentifiable southern accent, even though no one else in his family did? Why did the head witch (?) speak in a quasi-Russian accent, that she apparently found hard to stay in-character to enunciate? My favorite line in the flick was her mondo-bizarro, "My people come from...Stone-henge". Bloody 'orrible reference that was, mate! And why, when witchie-poo morphed into a vixen and seduced Johnny Stud in the RV, did she feed him popcorn? And why did it pop exponentially filling the Winnebago from hell? And what was the point? It didn't turn the guy into green, or any other color, slime. It didn't even harm him. Was she hoping for, "Death by Orvillle Redenbacher"? And the mom character, did she go to some kind of acting school which had a session entitled, "If you want to emote intensity...NEVER blink your eyes"? And I suppose, to close this missive, I could ask why the word "Troll" was NEVER mentioned in the film, but that would probably just hurt my feelings and give me a migraine. If you can see only one bad movie in your lifetime and you can't do Ed Wood films 'cuz they're in black and white, "Troll II" is it! Enjoy!

review_title: Now do you Believe in Hell?
review_detailed_main:
Some believe that when you sin and die, you go to Hell. Well there's no sin bad enough to justify this movie. Claudio Fragasso is the incarnate of Adolf Hitler and deserves to be tarred and feathered for the creation of this abomination. My only hope for the future now is that all peoples from all walks of life will band together and see fit to destroy this hellish cataclysm and smite it from the Earth, past, present, and future.

This movie is the number one cause of wrist-slitting and various other forms of suicidal mutilation. To say that watching this film causes leprosy is a gross understatement. Everyone who worked on this movie and didn't submit themselves to daily brutal whippings from a cat-o-nine-tails as penance out of regret should be locked in a prisoner of war camp for causing a second Holocaust by helping this movie get made.

Historically, the Mongols were able to conquer China just by showing the people there this movie. It bespeaks atrocity beyond linguistic and cultural barriers. Repent. Repent, for this movie is the clear sign of the End of Times. Claudio Fragasso is the Antichrist. Please, God, just let me die.

review_title: The best movie ever made....by humans
review_detailed_main: When I first stumbled upon Troll 2, the box itself looked ridiculous enough for me to watch the movie. But after watching, I discovered that what was on the cover of the box had nothing to do with the film. The little boy on the cover wasn't even the right boy from the movie. I also discovered that what was inside the box, the movie, was the best film EVER. If you ever want to see acting at its finest, acting that will make you re-examine your life, acting that will make you see the world for the first time, watch Grandpa Seth deliver words of advice from beyond the grave to little Joshua. It was delightful. No, it was brilliant. No, there is no word to describe its perfection, so I'm forced to make one up, and I will do so right now. This movie was scrumtrulecent. This movie was a blinding, brilliant light from heaven. Watching this movie is like staring into the face of god, and seeing him looking back and smiling, saying "you are my most wonderous creation." I am born anew in its genius. So, go do yourself a favor and buy, or rent, the greatest movie ever made...by humans.

I thought Joshua was pretty hot first time I saw this, but now he seems ugly to me. Plus he spend's to much time with that dead guy worrying about trolls. And his mom is so 80s. I did not like how the movie makes fun of freckles; thats just mean. Holly is a good person who does not put out! Its not her fault that her boyfriend turns gay! I feel bad making fun of midgets now, they eat people, so you should really try to be nice to them and not be like Arnold who thought he was cool by telling them off. Probably you should not eat food that is green, it might be moldy or turn you into plants.

I learned how popcorn makes guys go crazy for you, so it wasn't a total loss.

review_title: The Way We Do TROLL 2 In Texas
Not as bad as it's reputation suggests
review_detailed_main:
I only became aware of this a couple of years back so was aware of its reputation but when I finally got to see it I didn't think that this was that bad.

Acting is pretty poor (even by low budget horror movie standards) and the script seems laden with plot holes and inconsistencies. Plot holes and inconsistencies tend to be a standard feature in a lot of Italian horror/fantasy films and it's all part of their charm. Special effects are also pretty bad with some of the worst monster masks that I've ever seen. Despite this it doesn't fail to entertain and is better than a lot of low budget straight to DVD releases that you get nowadays.

review_title: Absolutely the worst film of all times!
review_detailed_main:
Someone mentioned that they would vote for a 0, well i would like to go beyond that and give this film a -0.

It is hard to understand what the people behind this film wanted to do, is this a comedy? horror? kids film? when looking at this movie from my perspective (Hell i knew this movie sucked and i wanted to see just how bad it was) this movie is the holy grail of awful movies.

Acting is non existent, actors have absolutely no emotions what so ever, father acts as if someone is holding a gun to his head or as if he had no mind at all.

Mother is supposed to be a sensitive woman, but comes across as more cold hearted than Hitler. Overall this is definitely the worst acting i have ever seen, i did not think i would find worse actors than Schwarzenegger in his debut as Hercules in "Hercules in New York" but this movie proved me wrong. I could understand Arnie, he had no idea about the language he was babbling........but these people......oh boy! My rating for the acting job = *FART* Special effects. Oh dear god! The goblins looked like they were made from feces, their faces looked fake and stupid. Special effects job seems to be done by some blind retarded teenager.

Music, it seems to be done by the same sound-engine found on the very first Pong console.....bleeping and stupid sounds without any relevance to what is going on.

The script? Jesus Christ! Who in their right mind wrote this? Or who in their right mind approved this to be aired?! I am 100% sure if i would throw some corns on my PC keyboard and let a chicken peck on it i would create something a million times better than this awful fiasco. The lines are so incredibly stupid, it boggles the mind! Once again you ask yourself is this supposed to be serious or just stupid? Watch this film if you want to laugh at something totally stupid and retarded. This is the best bad-movie of all times!

This movie sucks so much. This movie is horrible in every way you can imagine. Do not rent it, don't even read the back of the box your wasting your time. Plot - Makes no sense. There's random stuff like 3 leaf clover hickies and popcorn being used to kinda kill someone. Acting - the WORST I have ever seen in my 21 years on this earth. Its hard to pick the worst actor in the movie. I'm gonna go with the Mom. She really sucks more than everyone else, an accomplishment in itself. Directing - adds to the crapfest. If you want to laugh your ass off and make fun of a movie then i guess you can watch it but this is by far one of the worst movies ever created.

review_title: So painfully bad that it's actually amusing.
review_detailed_main: "Troll 2" is an experience.The acting is ridiculously bad,the dialogue is even worse,and the so called "goblins" are cheesy looking.The main character Joshua played by Michael Stephenson makes an amazing discovery as the small city of Nilbog is actually Goblin spelled backwards.Then we have Joshua's grandpa,who can somehow predict the future and guide our young hero through this tragedy.The film is filled with lots of laugh-out-loud moments:my favourite is when bad boy Joshua pisses on hospitality...oops...I mean food.Of course "Troll 2" doesn't have any trolls,just a bunch of funny looking goblins with laughable masks and costumes made by Laura Gemser.Give this amusing crap a look.4 out of 10.This film is truly one of its kind!

When a movie transcends its medium and moves directly into the realm of "art", we call it a classic. Citizen Kane, It's A Wonderful Life, Chinatown: there are numerous examples. INCLUDING Troll 2. Yes, I'm serious. It's easy to make a poor film or a boring film. Ninety percent of movies fall into these categories. To make a good or great movie requires ensemble talent and a sense of artistic direction. To make Troll 2, the producers would have had to know how to make a good film because they do absolutely everything wrong. EVERYTHING! This masterpiece rescued a rainy cottage day as I watched it unfold with astonishment. It fails so miserably, and so bizarrely, that it manages to rise above its form. Right from the start, the movie takes us further and further into the land of ludicrous, with side trips into insaneville and "what-the-f*&% is going on" city. To criticize the individual elements (ie. acting, plot etc) would only deter from the whole. Like a Beethoven symphony it must be viewed upon as a complete masterwork, the parts combining to make the one true artistic statement. Or, lack of there of, as case may be.

A must see for all movie fanatics.

review_title: I have to tighten my belt one notch to avoid the pain!!
Its so bad that its NOT funny

review_detailed_main:
Joshua is a boy visited by his late grandfather who warns him about goblins. They're turning people into plants and eating them. I think...

I stopped trying to follow this story when the sister starts dancing. It's one of several different WTF moments in this movie. I am fascinated by some aspects of this film and the audacity of the filmmaker. There is an unrelenting weirdness to this and that is very compelling. The biggest question may be if this is so bad that it actually turns good. I doubt that very much. It is bad and I don't think it's compelling enough to watch all the way through. It's a weird bad film.

Yes, this movie is the best bad movie ever made. This is probably the only bad movie that would be rendered less funny if produced for MST2K. Almost all of the reviews posted here are dead on(aside from those written by people who didn't enjoy the film...those who need to take a physical), but i felt compelled to write a review of my own because no one has yet mentioned my favorite line from the film:

"They're eating her. And then they're going to eat me. OH MY GOD!"

I do not feel, however, that any schmo with a camcorder could make a film of equal entertainment value. It takes more than just lethargy and poor planning to make a movie this bad...you truly have to lack any sort of talent whatsoever. Only one person could have made a film this bad; and, I'm afraid, he was born to do so.

review_title: When Did We Lose the Glory?

review_detailed_main:
I have to wonder why this was even given the title of Troll 2. There are some monsters in the movie, but they're called goblins. The word "troll" is never mentioned. It seems as if this movie was filmed in its entirety, then somehow was erroneously named as a sequel to a movie that had absolutely nothing to do with this one. This movie is more closely related to Children of the Corn than the first Troll movie.

Even though the movie was named incorrectly, I have to give it 6/10 stars. I'm a huge B movie fan and can totally understand the following this movie has. It has some of the worst writing and acting I've ever seen in a film, but it's difficult to completely hate it. This movie truly is a train wreck... a train wreck you can't help but watch and wonder why/how it happened.

I would just like to say that I recently saw Leprechaun in the Hood, which included Ice-T pulling weapons out of his afro, rapping so bad that it makes Vanilla Ice look like Dr. Dre, names like Post Master P and Stray bullet, and beyond anything else was made AFTER Leprechaun 4, In Space. But Troll 2 is still the worst movie ever made. Now please excuse me as I urinate on my food to make it safe for consumption.

review_title: This is absolutely the worst movie ever made.
review_detailed_main:
Forget Manos, this is the worst movie I have ever seen in my entire life. The only reason I rent it is to prove to others that it is the worst movie ever made. Sometimes when I get in a real masochistic mood, a friend who thinks he or she knows the worst movie ever made and I have a contest. I've won every time, although "Going Overboard" with Adam Sandler is a *very* close second place.

This movie has no redeeming qualities whatsoever. The acting is worse than a small high school play production. The costumes are awful. But the script is the worst part. I can't imagine what the hell they were thinking when the authors put lines in the script for the small kid such as, "They're monsters! Hideous beings!" or "You're a genius, big sister!" I actually feel embarrassed for the actors' families who have to deal with the fact that their son or daughter acted in this awful, terrible, awful movie.

I can't imagine what Troll 1 was like, but it can't be worse than this.

review_title: Troll2 is not the worst, but close.
review_detailed_main: This movie was the worst. Casting was probably done at the local 7-11. Not as bad as Plan 9 but awful in its own unique way. Not just bad actors, but no acting at all. Just a bunch of idiots reading off their scripts. The only reason it isn't in the same category of awfulness as Plan 9 From Outerspace is because the director managed to shoot around the same time every day. No running from light to dark and back to light in the same scene. No one can ever beat Ed Wood. He was the best of the worst. Claudio Fragasso certainly tries but he has big shoes to fill and he hasn't come close yet. He's only in the Sam Newfield category.

review_title: a classic of the unintentionally awful movie mold. a must-see for lovers of trash
My IQ dropped 32 points because I watched this movie.
review_detailed_main: If any movie can make you stupider for having seen it, this would be it. I don't understand how the acting was so bad. If you randomly chose a family reunion in Jersey to use as a movie cast, the average performance would still be better than this. It's as if the actors were given electric shock every time they delivered a line well or naturally, until eventually they could only express themselves only in pseudo-angry shouting and/or wooden monotone. Just remembering this movie makes me feel dirty, but it's a dirt I can't wash off.

review_title: I liked "Troll", but this one is bad.
review_detailed_main: How bad is it? It is very bad indeed...it probably even deserves its ranking in the bottom 100 movies here unlike some others on the list. This one has nothing at all to do with the first "Troll"; the only thing they share in common is their name. In fact, I think they refer to the creatures in this one as goblins rather than trolls. A couple of other things the two movies have in common is the family moving to a new place, though it was only supposed to be temporary here, and the old lady that lets her hair down and is mysteriously hot. Here it is very pointless and stupid, and the only good I can say of it is that the woman is hotter than the one from part one. Here we have people drinking really bad milk and becoming plants or something and the goblins chow down on this. Not as good as it sounds this movie is just so bad. Don't watch it, you are not missing anything here...the only reason I gave it a two instead of a one is that I did snicker a bit at how the boy prevented the monsters from wanting to eat him other than that though this movie is just bad.

review_title: : The biggest amount of junk you'll ever see...and that's a guarantee !!
Worst Movie Of All Time, and other awards this movie deserves

review_detailed_main: So bad it's good BUT it could have been great. A rewrite to make it make sense, help the plot to be fleshed out better, and to make the dialog sound like things people would actually say-- that would help immensely. So would getting some people who can actually act. The kid who played Joshua was actually pretty good, but the rest delivered their awkward lines even more awkwardly. Some parts of this were genuinely funny when they were trying to be funny, and unfortunately many parts were funny when they were not meant to be funny. So I gave it an 8. Why?! Well, when it was made it would have deserved a 3, but a 6 in the "so bad it's good category." But today, with the absolute sewage treatment plant fires that Hollywood makes these days, this movie gets a straight up 8. It is legit better in every category but special effects.

review_title: Not as bad or funny as people say.
review_detailed_main:
Troll 2 is basically just like other 80s horror movies like A Nightmare On Elm Street and Poltergeist only it has a truly entertaining campiness that makes those movies pale in comparison. The campiness comes from three things, the pi ss poor acting, the unconvincing dialog and the funny premise: A family goes on vacation to a small town called Nilbog(Goblin spelled backwards), where the locals, who look like humans at first, are actually vegetarian goblins that try to coax them into eating bizarre green food to make them into plants and then eat them.

Surprisingly, not everything in this movie is awful. The film's isolated rural landscape creates a sense of dread and tension. You can see that the protagonists of this movie are truly alone, beyond the comforting reaches of civilization where anything can happen. Also the masks worn by the goblin extras look genuinely scary. Some of the characters in the movie are well casted, despite their incompetent acting. This includes the father and the little boy of the family on vacation and the little boy's deceased grandfather, who warns him of what he and his family are getting into right from the start.

What Troll 2 does is take the boring old horror movie formula...

1:Someone notices something weird and sinister going on and no one believes him/her.

2:He/she proves the danger is real.

3:They find some way to supposedly defeat the evil. Stupid magicy good vs evil cr ap happens. They think the evil is defeated.

4:Fast forward a little and everyone thinks its happily ever after but then the evil force comes back and does something nasty. The film ends.

and adds some fun to it with shoddy dialog and acting and a very silly plot and you end up with something a lot more fun than the average depressing, predictable horror film. Also it is blessed with one of the most hilariously delivered lines in the history of cinema "You can't pi ss on hospitality! I won't allow it!" Anyway, in the end, yes, Troll 2 is still bad, so much so that it's almost good but it's not as hilarious as some crazy idiots make it out to be.

Troll 2 has been cited as one of the worst movies ever or the father of bad movies and such. After finally seeing it, I have to concur. This film is dreadful, but because it is dreadful it is somewhat hilarious. The cinematography and editing are incredibly slip shod and the costumes of the trolls(or shall I say goblins) are quite horrible. The story also meanders all over the place, the script is abysmal and the direction is wretched. Then there is the poor pacing and atrocious acting, and any hopes of any thrills or scares are replaced with scatterings of unintentional laughs and often for the wrong reasons. Overall, it is a dreadful film, but it does have some unintentional entertainment value unlike some of the other bad movies I've seen. 1/10 Bethany Cox

Here is a important lesson on how not to become a Troll. You must pee on your food before you eat it. If you do this before every meal this will prevent you from becoming a Troll. This household remedy was brought to you by the terrible movie Troll 2.

review_title: Why in the name of all that is at least passably decent isn't this movie no 1 worst film!?!?!?!
review_detailed_main:
I saw this movie at least 4 times when I was sixteen years old. Every single time I watched it I found something else to despise about it. It's not that it's overly gory- I've seen much worse violence in cartoons. No, it's that the movie itself is just so horribly made, with no attempt to place any cohesive structure to the many subplots going on, not to mention the ALL TIME WORST DUBBING JOB IN HISTORY.(Was this made in Italy? For crimeny all over, Lucio Fulci was supposedly a hack of a director, but at least his dubbing sounded halfway real, and he used different colors for his gore.) Speaking of plots, the storyline is supposedly a sequel to the original "Troll" movie, (which in itself wasn't half-bad; I found that movie to have a decent story which was explained surprisingly competently and presented with decent, high quality stomach-churning effects, unlike this film which uses nothing but bright green gunk for EVERYTHING; blood, cake frosting, saliva- you name it, they've got it being used for it) but manages, whether intentionally or not, to have no plot ties to that film whatsoever. The acting is annoying, the main character is the most worthless child actor ever in existence, and the ending is just so stupid that it achieves the effect the director wanted- it sickens and horrifies you, but not because it's actually all that horrifying or sickening; it is solely because it's such a horrible waste of time. Overall, and hopefully I'm not giving anything away, the only saving grace of the movie is the popcorn feast/seduction/whatever in the motor home. That actually made me laugh for a bit, and forget for a second how terrible the rest of the film was, and would continue to be.

To wrap this up, if you truly want to know what a terrible movie is, I would suggest that you first see "Glen or Glenda?" by Ed Wood, and then watch this film- trust me, "Glen or Glenda" is going to seem like "Citizen Kane" after this tripe. The only successful thing about this movie is its complete ineptitude in almost every single aspect.

-1 star, since they don't have that rating on the board. Truly satanic in its awfulness.

review_title: A bad movie you'll love to see over and over.
review_detailed_main: There are two things I ask for from a movie. A good time and and ability to stand up to repeated viewings. This movie does both. It's hilariously awful and a treat to view again and again. Especially if you have edibles at hand that resemble green goo.

review_title: May God have mercy on your soul
review_detailed_main:
And i thought no movie could be worse than Hobgoblins. Well let me tell you, Hobgoblins is to Troll 2 what Gone with the Wind is to Heaven's Gate.

Let me sum it up : Troll 2 has no trolls, it has Goblins. There are no actors, only people trying to act. And their attempts are beyond the pathetic. The kid on the box isn't even the same actor as in the movie !!

However, there are some scenes that are soooo bad, they actually make you laugh. One of these is Joshua, a 9 year old boy, the "hero" of the movie, who takes a leak on diner in order to avoid the family eating the Goblin prepared food, that would turn them all into green jelly (does this make any sense ??). Anyways, thats not the funny part cause u dont see him actually doing it....The funny scene is when his dad punishes him : get this, he actually tells him "I'm tightening my belt by one loop so i don't feel hunger pains, and your sister and mother will have to do the same". Is this a script or what ???? How dumb does one have to be in order to write such KRAP ??

I actually bought this movie in order to show it to all my m8. The first showing is to my brother this evening. I can't wait to see his reaction :)

review_title: I paid $15.95 for this movie... on purpose!
review_detailed_main:
I saw it long before I bought it. But who can put a price on entertainment value? I have but one comment...

"I am tightening my belt by one loop so I don't feel hunger pains, and your sister and mother will have to do the same."

This film is great right up there with citizen Kane and the God father !!! Watch it You will never be the same again 😜 the acting the writing the cinematography and locations , you will never see a film like this again . It changes You and gets in your head , the question is are you ready for it ?

Referred to as 'the worst film of all time'? The film needs to be seen at the right time, and probably three viewings, just to fully appreciate how 'so bad it's good' it is. It is bad, real bad...but in many ways it's good. There's no doubting Troll 2 has a charm about it, it's amusing in its silliness. And it's never boring. Troll 2 could never be accused of being dull. The acting is...well...You have the grandfather (Robert Ormsby) who not only looks like Orson Welles but, in what is Ormsby's only acting performance, is good enough to match the great man. The boy too is pretty good. Around them are cast 'actors' ranging from reasonable to outright ridiculous, as if they practised acting by watching re-runs of Scooby Doo. Some 'performances' seem to have been carved out of wood, the kind you'd find in an M Night Shyamalan film, but at a much lower price. The special effects... sometimes they're OK for a low budget movie, but mostly are moments of comedy genius, like the food which seems to have been created by 5-year-olds. The real stars of the show, though, are the trolls themselves, or goblins as they're known. Some of the masks are so hilariously bad you can't help but like them...and then there's one or two in particular...well you have to see it for yourself. And see it you should, there's nothing else like it.

review_title: could we maybe see some trolls
review_detailed_main: Your first clue that this movie stinks,could be the fact that although the movie is called "Troll" 2, its actually a movie about goblins.It takes place in a place called nilbog(how cute,goblin spelled backwards).Everything about this movie is disgustingly bad.the special effects suck, the acting is either nonexistent,or so badly overdone as to win the Shattner award.The plot and storyline seem to disappear at times, then suddenly reappear.There are also many,many continuity problems.But the worst of all, its just not very entertaining.mostly its just boring.I would only recommend this film to people wanting to audition at the William Shattner school of overacting,and insomniacs who don't respond to drugs.
Take a shot everytime they say Joshua. Also, Elliott is 100% gay.

In-crappy-credible. That's the word that comes to mind. How do movies like this get made? Was there no sane person on the set (never mind, they didn't have a set) who had the guts to tell Claudio Fragasso "sorry mate, this just ain't gonna work, just give it up already before anyone gets hurt"? Wow. That's all I can say. I truly cannot summarize how awful this movie is in words. But I'll try, anyway. I have to get this film out of my system before I go insane.

Take some rednecks and ex-porn stars, throw them into some anonymous town in the middle of nowhere, slap a huge "NILBOG" sign on a pole, hire lots of dwarfs and some sh!tty costumes, and get the most over-the-top, annoying, washed-up Z-movie actress you can find to play the main antagonist, add a delusional kid who is almost as convincing as the thespian from "Pod People", and at least twice as irritating, and you have a movie. That's the Claudio Fragasso way!

So we have a kid actor with whom we're supposed to sympathize, but he's so bad I just wanted to hit him most of the time and tell him not to be such an overreacting little prick. Seriously, Joshua looks like someone is repeatedly kicking him in the groin whenever he tries to emote.

Unbelievably, Joshua isn't the worst actor in the film - even though everyone in this movie either screams or mumbles his or her casual lines , and even though Joshua's mum looks like a crack addict psychopath during most of her scenes, the real Dung Beetle award for incompetent acting has to go to Deborah Reed. She plays Creedence Leonore Gielgud in a way that makes it hard not to think that the nice men in white coats were waiting for Deborah after major shooting of the film had finished. This woman has the scariest eyes I've ever seen, they're constantly moving up and down, bulging in and out of their sockets so fast even Rodney Dangerfield would be scared. Her eyes are enough to almost distract you from her horrendous overacting, but only almost. Hearing her deliver her "little flower" speech makes you pine for the subtlety and depth of Vin Diesel. But enough about her.

Can it get any worse? Actually it can, because suddenly a myriad of the aforementioned dwarfs - sorry, I meant goblins - appear. Think of an army of walking, oinking potatoes with bargain bin Halloween masks - those are the goblins. Sound scary yet? I thought so.

Kill me now. I thought the film couldn't get any dumber, but it did - suddenly Joshua realizes that "NILBOG" is actually "GOBLIN" spelled BACKWARDS!!! Yes, I'm stunned too. This truly is the most brilliant plot twist this side of M. Night Shyallaman. And so cleverly set up, too! I can assure you I did NOT see this coming, no siree. Gee whizz, what a shocker! All sarcasm aside, this is probably the part of the film where I completely lost it. The sheer look of shock on Joshua's face upon his revelation combined with the "scary" music (which was probably stolen from some Japanese TV show from the eighties, by the way) - this is unintentional comedy at its finest. And by "finest", I mean "most painful".

So, when all is said and done, what can we make of this movie? It's low budget, so badly acted you'll want to gouge your eyes out, unintentionally hilarious, blatantly homoerotic (Elliott having trouble choosing between his "boys" and his girlfriend, Elliott's "boys" sleeping half-naked next to each other) and it gave me the impression that Claudio Fragasso has a fetish for the colour green. In conclusion this film has very deservedly earned itself a position on the Bottom 100, and I'm still blown away by the fact that there are movies this irredeemably awful out there. My review has barely scratched on the surface of how awful this film is - it's worse than "Red Zone Cuba", worse than "The Beast of Yucca Flats", worse than "Time of the Apes"... and I wouldn't hesitate to say that it's *this* close to being as bad as "Manos: The Hands of Fate" (interestingly enough, both films feature a hilarious scene in which the main characters inexplicably burst out in a chorus of "Row your boat"). My Bottom 100 marathon couldn't have ended on a higher note of badness and I'm happy to say that I survived this ordeal (Watching "Bloodrayne", "Captain America" and this in a row) without any extensive brain damage... or did I? Anyway, to any devoted fan of bad movies, this is truly appetizing... and provocative. To quote Arnold, one of Elliot's "boys": "OH MY GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOD!"

review_title: The bad movie I compare all others to.
review_detailed_main:
Absolutely the worst. I compare all my films to this one.

Even really bad movies are better than Troll 2. Never do they use the word "troll". The evil witch in the movie looks like a drama school drop out.

That and she looks like shes 30 in really bad make up. And the grandfathers ghost!? WTF?? Turning in to plants is fun, and there is a few humorous moments with two high school boys that fall into the witches lair, but otherwise a real dog of a movie. MST3K where are you!!! Watch with friends so you can rip on it. Enjoy!

Usually, when we see a bad movie, it has at least one redeeming quality. Not with "Troll 2" however, a film that seems to have no shame with it's horrendously bad acting, plot, special effects and overall ambiance.

I kept thinking the whole way through that it had to be a joke. Maybe it was. I did laugh a few times.

Was this some kind of strange statement about vegetarians? Or meat? I didn't get it if so. We are treated to various bizarre sequences about meat and vegetables but it never really comes together at all.

The costumes are atrocious, designed by Laura 'Emmannuelle' Gemser. Porn star? Maybe. Costume designer? God no. Watch for the goblins, clearly little people or kids with masks. It was like they got the props from Party City, it's that bad.

The music, which has been a source of ridicule in reviews on here, was, at times terrible but it didn't stand out to me as overly bad. Perhaps it was overshadowed by worse elements.

All in all, "Troll 2" will have you scratching your head in amazement and questioning the sanity of all involved in the project. Did they actually think they were making a horror movie here? 2 out of 10, kids.

review_title: Ten Things Wrong With This STUPID Movie

review_detailed_main: Must admit this film ive watched multiple times. The first time i watched this. It was like WTF. Especially being a very young fan of the first movie Troll. So i was expecting much of the same from the first. So i think i was more dissapointed that it was not. However it continues to grow on me everytime i watch it.

review_title: funniest thing I have ever seen
review_detailed_main: the reason I give this a seven is cause how funny this movie is it's supposed to be all serious but it's just so funny how they act it fits in the category of "it's so bad it's good" it is just fun grab a few friends and watch this entertaining flick it's good fun cheesy action that you and your friends will enjoy has some of the worst acting in a movie ever made but it's funny how their trying to be serious and the special effects are just terrible but fun to laugh at this is one of my favorite movies cause it makes me laugh so damn hard it's funny so if you want to get a good laugh out of a movie and get a break from all the seriousness from movies out there I recommend you getting this flick "their going to eat me, OH MY GOOOOOOOOOD!"

If you have read any of the earlier reviews then you will no doubt be familiar with the importance of Baloney sandwiches to the story. I will simply say, and without a shadow sarcasm, that the aforementioned sandwich is by far the most talented offering in the movie, given that it actually looks like sandwich and, of equal importance acts like a sandwich. Truly bizarre. There are no words that can convey just how bad this film is. I have taken a better standard of movie (with my mobile phone facing the mirror) called Nasal Triming! The plot, such as it is, revolves around Goblins, a suspicious town called Nilgob, Urine, Ectoplasm, the spirit of a deceased relative and Baloney Sandwichs. Just to add some randomness, surprisingly none of these elements bare any understandable or logical connection. The scriptwriter is clearly insane and hopefully has found some form of medication that will allow him to exist on the plain of reality as the rest of us. The cast offer creative talent easily surpassed by toe nail clippings and the Director, i believe, is running at least 7 part times jobs. Dumb.

This really is one of the worst "films" i have ever put into my disc tray, why do i put films in inverted commas? Because it really is one of the worst movies ever made, for starters one of the main characters was a local dentist, as if that isn't bad enough the whole film is barely acted! It consists of this irritating little kid who goes around yelling about his grandfather and goblins in the town of the family's holiday home, there aren't even any trolls in the movie! The makers of this mess decided to name it this in the vain hope it would succeed. And then there's the SFX oh dear the SFX, lets just say i've never seen more green jelly, (or jell-O to you Americans) in my time.The goblins are just small men in Halloween masks. The music is ghastly, there are so many mistakes in this movie it's laughable. It's dire. Good day. Don't watch this, please.

If you thought all the torture scenes in the Saw movies and Hostel were bad. Well they weren't even close, if you really want to torture someone, tie them down and duct tape their eyes open and sit them in front of this movie. Me and a friend watched this yesterday and we are one of the elite few who have lived to tell about this movie after watching it. I have no idea how Dances with Wolves won best picture with this film being made during the same year......The Oscars are Rigged!

There will never be a greater movie.....unless.....

They make a Troll 3!

I have never ever seen such a worse piece of absolute drek than this movie. I'm very surprised MST didn't grab this one to laugh at. Horrible acting, horrible dialogue, horrible storyline. My family and I like to rent this one for a laugh every now and then. in the video store my brother works at, they have it filed under "Comedy", with very good reason!

review_title: A must-watch for comedy and "bad movie" fans
review_detailed_main: TV is entertainment. That's the purpose. The reason I gave Troll 2 five stars out of 10 is because it really is entertaining. It's unintentionally hilarious. It's very poorly done but it's almost worth watching just to get a good laugh out of it. I would recommend this as a must-see for those who love movies that are so bad they're good. Production wise, nothing is done right. The music is completely unfitting, the camera angles are weird, the writing could have been done by an elementary school child, and the acting, wow, don't get me started. But all this somehow comes together to make a brilliant comedy. I recommend it to anyone who is willing see this movie as it is: a movie so bad, it's hilarious. It is definitely worth watching.

review_title: The worst movie I have ever seen
Wow. That was so bad, it was good!
review_detailed_main: I just barely saw the movie 10 minutes ago. We watched it for Bad Movie Night. I was told that it was filmed by an Italian director and crew using an American cast. The Italian crew only had one person who spoke a little bit of English. I would have to say this honestly was the worst movie I've ever seen. And that's why I would watch it again. The movie is full of midgets/small children who are wearing plastic masks and burlap. There's lots of 'Double Dare'ish goo. It comes from everywhere: the actors' mouths, their headbands, everywhere. MST3K should do an episode of this. It's ripe... make that overripe. Anyway, I won't give a synopsis, but if you like worse than B movies, this is the movie for you.

review_title: A Movie So Bad, Its good,dont take it seriously!
review_detailed_main:
The remember the first day I saw Troll 2. I went to the market with my mate to buy a DVD and found it for £3.50(around$2).

In so many words troll 2 is an excellent film. Its funny and extremely amusing. The whole point of the film is if you take it seriously you wont enjoy it. You ask me its a cult!

I cant be bothered explaining the plot for their isnt much too it. As a filmaking stand-point its pretty damb alful but thats its beauty. That a film so bad can become so excellent by sheer badness.

The acting from young Joshua is very good for an actor of that age but the parents have no excuse!

Anyway Im not the type for going on and on so just buy it for gods sake, get a beer and some mates found and laugh your ass off!

FANTASTIC!

review_title: Fun little comedic film, but it's no cult classic
review_detailed_main: I've seen Troll 2 and it's in the OK section of a B film. I love B films, this one felt too mediocre to be called a so-bad it's good cult classic. There are some funny moments, interesting special effects but nothing else. Not a cult classic but definitely a mediocre fun little film Troll 2 6/10. MEDIOCRE

review_title: can you take a taste of this chunky milk? i want to BE SURE it's rancid.
review_detailed_main:
that is the epitome of this movie, why it has gained such popularity, and spreads like the plague. we've all done it. tasted obviously rancid food, looked at the person besides us and said "oh my god, this is terrible. i think it went bad. here, try some." and like the idiots that we are, we put our lips to disgustoid foulness and say "oh man, that's gross!" and if there are others in the room, we pass the yuck along. like a rotted food telephone line. this is true also with smells. like a stinky shoe or sock. "ugh, oh my god. you've GOT TO smell this!" either way, just admit you've done it. you've at some point been the idiot offerer, or idiot tastee. accept it. own it. this way, you'll be more aware of your desire to show this off to people you would normally want to impress.

this movie is like a diamond you found in your backyard that was covered with 500 year old dog s**t, and no matter how hard you wash it the smell just wont come off...but this doesn't stop you from showing it off to even the most distinguished of guests. it's beautiful and foul at the same time. radiant and smelly. a precious possession that makes you want to vomit.

i'm not sure if i'm what you would call a "movie buff", however i do delight in watching terrible movies with ridiculous one liners that become useful in family parties when everyone has had a little too much to drink. to use them unsuspectingly against the drunk chick your cousin brought or your aunt who's so blasted she doesn't realize her skirt is tucked into her panties.

i've seen my fair share of stupid movies, but none such as this where the actors are delivering lines that were obviously translated from Italian through babel fish. it only resembles English through language, not meaning or grammar.

i would definitely say that this is one of, if not THE worst movie of all time. i think peter jackson's BAD TASTE is up there too. if you can, watch these two movies back to back. your life will seem like it's of the Gods.

to this day i can't meet anyone named Joshua. i make them say "don't tell me they ate him, grandpaw!" to which i reply "that's EXACTLY what they did" with great intensity.

this movie will make you laugh until you sweat from laughing so hard. like your body is rejecting it and trying to expel it from your brain through your pores.

i highly recommend this film. after you watch it, you'll understand what the crap hype is really about. if there's ever a fire in your home, and you're running out of the house in great haste, and you have the ability to save one only one item, it will be this movie. not your dog, your ipod, your jewelry or your children.

yes, it's THAT ridiculous.

10 out of 10 is what it deserves for it's moldy addictive deliciousness.

Yes Troll 2 is indeed a movie to never forget. The pain, the agony I felt during this movie was laughter and disgust at the same time. Wow how could this be called a movie? Yet, it works in such a bad way that its unforgettable. MY GOD, who would be brainless enough to finance this. Yet who could resist the temptation to make at least one Horror B grade movie. After all, the Indiana Jones movies were simply made to be B movies but look at the result. Don't get me wrong Troll 2 in no way compares to the cinematic genius of the IJ trilogy. The worst acting in the movie, let me think. It's a tossup between the store owner and the sister. I do think the sister tops the cake. "WHOD WANNA EAT CHA LITTLE BROTHER?" LMAO! I hate this movie so much that I own a copy. I think I'm going to watch it.

review_title: Yet another over-rated "so bad it's......" only rediscovered because of internet boredom surfing and YoutTube
review_detailed_main:
I don't get the notoriety and the alleged "so bad it's good" fanfare of this film?

OK I love bad movies. Specifically I love unintentional comedies in the Action/Martial Arts genre.

Whether it is a proper Hollywood production with Swarzenegger (Commando), Van Damme (Street Fighter) Chuck Norris (The Delta Force) or some obscure undiscovered VHS gold starring ? (Deadly Prey) (Lady Terminator).

Without sounding a hypocrite I discovered a good laugh by scraping the barrel with Undefeatable (check out "best fight scene ever" on YouTube) and the pant wettingly funny Samurai Cop.

Most of the above films have one thing in common. Foreign film makers directing Western "actors" with hilarious consequences- odd plot quirks and really bad acting- and an abuse of film-making conventions.

Avid film buffs, media studies students and fans of late night movies with 4 tins of beer tend to lap up these type of films.

However there is a new sub branch fanbase of these types of films that casual fans of bad movie wince at. Anti-social YouTube reviewers (shudder), nerdy blog posters (Cinema Snob) and other friendless, weirdo basement dweller types who do video reviews that are as long as the film itself. Why? You might as well go and watch the film, download it, rent it or buy from the bargain bin at the DVD store. But what makes it worse is their odd choices of "bad movies" that just aren't funny- they're downright boring.

One of these films is Troll 2. I only made it to the 48 minute mark and after pausing the film for the 4th time I switched it off. The film isn't that badly made- its a very average straight to VHS low budget horror flick. Sure the make up effects are atrocious even by late 80s, horror standards but we're all familiar with people using them in their profile pictures on public chat forums- whatever humour has been lost. As for the acting and scripting there is little in Troll 2 you didn't get in any other straight to VHS horror- waiting to be exhumed and used in "viral" Gifs, Internet humour and (excuse the pun) trolling message boards with weird stills from the film.

A bit like when "The Room" came out with Tommy Wiseau. Whilst so many geek film critics thought that film was hilarious; I didn't. In my opinion that was just like the bad unsexy "erotic" made-for-TV thrillers of the early 90's

In summary don't waste your life watching Troll 2. If you thought the infamous "Oh myyyyyyyyyy godddddddd" scene was the most hilarious thing you've ever seen a) you've lived a sheltered life b) you don't know was real bad acting is c) that was the highlight of the film's "comedy" so no need to watch any more

One of the most unbelievable sequels ever made, supposedly shot entirely without the knowledge or consent of the creators of the first TROLL film! At first glance a sub-Z-grade continuity abomination, this fine fine example of direct-to-video hysteria is a nonstop explosion of genius disguised as ineptitude. Grade-schooler Joshua is visited by the protective ghost of his Grandpa Seth, who warns him that his family's vacation destination of Nilbog (.) may be worth avoiding. But there's no changing dad's mind, and soon the whole family is knee-deep in black magic and nefarious villagers, including the remarkably abnormal `Sheriff Gene Freak'. Joshua and his dead grandpa are the only ones aware of their mortal danger, which Joshua at one point attempts to curb by urinating all over the dinner table. Not bad for PG-13. Worth noting is the fact that `trolls' aren't mentioned once in the film, while the threat of goblins remains all too real. Directed by `Drago Floyd', who was actually Claudio Fragasso, a low-rent auteur from the initial home video exploitation tidal wave of the late 1980s. Fragasso most importantly directed Alice Cooper in MONSTER DOG, but also made a significant mark by writing TERMINATOR II in 1989. No, not TERMINATOR 2 with Arnold Schwarzennegar.the other one, starring, uh, nobody.

review_title: All I have to say is wow..
review_detailed_main: A horror movie?? that was the most freaking hilarious movie I have seen in my entire life. Thats all I have to say. The actors looked like they were picked off from the street. They did not show any emotion, they sounded like messed up robots or something. And the characters were so extremely dumb, it seemed like they were trying to ruin their acting carriers purposely. Honest to god, I hope that they were doing that on purpose,because it seriously should not be marked as a horror movie. And as a last note, holy crap those goblins would not last 10 seconds in the real world, with there terrible makeup and very "indimidative weapons" I'm just curious if this movies budget passed the 100$ mark. Seriously.

review_title: FAR from the worst film ever.
review_detailed_main:
I had seen this back in the 90s because I really liked the original Troll film. I still do. It's a cool fantasy film with neat effects and a decent story. I remember being SUPER disappointed when I watched this because it was nothing at all like the original. But I watched it, and I remember thinking that it was a lot like a Goosebumps episode, or Are you Afraid of the Dark. I didn't hate it, but I didn't ever think I would watch it again. Then I saw the documentary "The Best Worst Movie". I watched it and was thoroughly entertained. I really liked it, and remembered watching this film as a young dude in the 90s. I decided to revisit it and laugh at it a bit. I was surprised when I watched it. Was it great? Not even close. But I had the same feeling when I watched it the first time, that it's no worse than an episode of the 90s Goosebumps tv show. I have seen a lot... A LOT of bad horror films. I love horror and I appreciate even the bad ones. This is nowhere near the worst film ever made. The sound quality is great. The camera work is better than you'd think. The acting is a whole other issue, though. I thought the dad did a good job. And I liked the guy who ran the shop, and the queen goblin lady was over the top, but good. People give this film too much credit in the "worst film" category. It's not good, but it's far from the worst film ever made. But it's entertaining and entirely watchable. I would go to one of the screenings or parties or whatever that people throw for this movie and re-watch it in a heartbeat.

Not a great film. But nowhere near the worst film ever. Give it a go.

review_title: Edward Wood would have been proud
review_detailed_main:
You just can't make a movie this bad. It's impossible. There had to be some collaboration involved. I think the director got everyone involved and said we only have $200,000 to make this movie, so let's make it as bad a movie as we possibly can. Good acting will not be allowed, even for those of you who can actually act. As to the script, turn your manuscripts upside down and read then backwards. A total of $7.35 will go towards costumes and special effects. Not a penny more. The most expensive item in making the movie was the damn motor home. If we had it to do over we should have used pup-tents, and saved the extra money to buy beer for the crew. Unfortunately, as it is, there isn't enough money to buy beer.

All in all, it's a really horrible movie and I hope saying that hasn't violated the 'contain spoilers', clause, because horrible is the only thing good about it.

review_title: Yes this movie blew, yes whoever wrote probably did so to win a bet.
Brilliant - Greatest "Bad" Movie I've Ever Seen
review_detailed_main: My friends and I have a weekly movie group and we have seen EVERYTHING - and I mean everything - after working through the history of silent films, early talkies, through the 30's, 40's, etc. and then we started sampling from all around the world - obscure films from Brazil, Russia, Hungary, etc. The reason I bring this up is to give you an idea of the scope of stuff we watched - and then there came a point when we started finding really BAD films - bad ones that are so BAD that they entertain you in more ways than one.Now, these movies and this type of movie-watching aren't everyone's cup of tea. You either get it or you don't. You either see all the wonderful awfulness in Ed Wood's movies or you just see crap and get bored. Well, there are so MANY other Ed Woods out there - like Al Adamson, Arthur Marks, etc. But TROLL 2 rises to the top - directed by an Italian who sometimes uses the screen name Drake Floyd - they shot it in Utah using local "talent". Now let's talk about the "talent" - this is without a doubt - the worst acting I have ever seen captured on film - and it is a battle of suckiness between the teenage daughter and the evil villainess. They both reach levels of overacting and facial expressions that makes one fall to the floor. The film is a mess - a disturbed little boy who keeps seeing his dead grandfather while nobody else does - is worried that goblins are trying to kill him and his family - the family goes away on a vacation to Nilsbog (get it - goblins spelled backwards)where all the townsfolk act strange and Invasion Of The Body Snatchers-like - seems people are fed plant stuff that actually turns them into plants and then the goblins eat the people/plants - and they actually try to throw in some Stone Henge plot b.s. The goblins are just dwarfs wearing the worst paper mache masks you ever saw. The other stunning thing about this movie is that acting is awful across the board. We loved it - we howled with delight at every bad line of script, ever piece of eye bulging and scenery-chewing - so if you enjoy cinematic cheese - seek this baby out. You won't be sorry. Troll 2 RULES!

Definitely not the worst movie ever. People who think that should watch many many more movies. This film is entertaining and is obviously a comedy. Americans penchant for overreacting to its badness is irritating.

Entertaining b movie. End of story.

This movie was so bad that it would take me about 25 years to write about all the bad things about this movie. the first time i saw it i didn't think it was too bad, but after hearing a lot of junk about it and after watching it closely made me want to smash my VCR with a baseball bat. the acting was SOO BAD, the plot was really corny,the horror they tried to add to the movie was very ridiculous, and the choice of dialog was pretty bad also. I cant even believe i wasted precious time and my life to watch this garbage, especially 2 times. don't waste your money on this terrible film that shouldn't even be considered a film because you definitely will regret it.

1/10*(awful)

review_title: A Notorious Title! Few are worse then Troll 2.
dad stop the car, joshua's ready to be ea'en
review_detailed_main: this movie is truly incredible. although i'm sure that mr. drago floyd didn't mean for it to be incredible in the way that it is. it has the worst acting i've ever seen, it made me cry from laughter, i give it my highest recommendation. if you enjoyed this movie you should check out Clash of the Ninja, Hands of Death and Catman 1 and 2.

review_title: So bad on so many levels...
review_detailed_main:
We actually own this film on disk. It came in a set with "Troll". One quiet, dull afternoon my son and I decided to watch it. After about 5 or 10 minutes I had to ask if it was just me, or is this the MOST poorly written, poorly acted, poorly shot, poorly directed, poorly produced thing we'd ever seen? I hadn't seen the other Troll film, but my son said that it was entirely unrelated to this one. We kept watching anyway, just to see if it could get any worse. I don't want to spoil it, so I'll just mention that it slowly crept to the bottom of the barrel with pace and content and dug itself into the slime when it became clear that something was missing. All hope was lost, though, with the "special" effects. Short-bus "special".

That being said, we do get chances occasionally to pop it in at gatherings, or just loan it out to the unsuspecting. It never fails to impress. It gets one star just for the novelty mileage at parties. We've been pretty famous for having discovered this train wreck.

We'll be staying away from the deep-discount tables from whence this set arose.

31 Days of Spookoween: TWENTY TWO

Film #22: Troll 2 (1990)

Review: Many moments in Troll 2 are weird and ambiguous in a way that can only be unintentional. The actors are awful and obviously no where near professionals, the special effects are goofy, the writing is perplexing and alien, the story is strange and oddly anti vegetarian, the camera-work is clunky and awkward (the cameraman really needs to lay off tapping the zoom in/zoom out button every few seconds), and the end result is a messy, bubbling cauldron of so bad it's strange surrealism. Every detail is so off and some moments are so pointless and confusing that they defy explanation. It is obvious the creators of this film are borderline insane and have no idea how movies work, but that's the beauty of it. That's why it is so successfully awful and so bizarrely funny, because of the obliviousness of a distinctly foreign filmmaker attempting to make an American monster movie and failing with miserable hilarity. It's an experience, no doubt, and is the only film I can say truly deserves both a 1 and a 10 star rating.

review_title: Drew Carey or Clive Anderson: "Now do a film in the style of 'Second Grade School Play"
review_detailed_main:
My header pretty much sums up my feelings on this film. The director must have been tone deaf among other things, or he was actually trying to make the worse film possible. The delivery of dialogue is almost painful to listen to, the mother especially.

My friends think it's so bad that its funny, I just think this film is utterly vile, and for the most part unwatchable, I rarely have to get-up to get away from a film for purely its technical matters, such as dialogue, lighting and such, but this one is definitely one of them.

The special effects are an utter joke, but some of the more observant may recognize the same goblin costumes from other low budget fantasy films, one of which was based on the myth of Siegfried, but the title escapes me at the moment.

Watch at your own risk, some may laugh at the film's utter lack of merit, others may just cringe and squirm uncomfortably, unable to watch out of a sheer sense of embarrassment.

'kay, it's like this... Grandpa Seth comes back from the dead to tell his grandson Joshua Waites a bedtime story about goblins, which is really lucky because Josh and his family are going to spend a vacation in the deceptively-named town of Nilbog, in some other family's house. Along the way they sing mom's favorite song "Row Row Row Your Boat" and Josh gets out to pee but ends up talking to a homeless man instead, who is Grandpa Seth in disguise. His family have no problem with this. They are also followed by Holly's boyfriend Elliott and his two mates, who sleep in the same bed without their shirts on.

Grandpa Seth stops time so Joshua can pee on their food. Sadly that's all the food left for them and they didn't bring any, so dad and Josh have to go into town the next day to buy some. Joshua accidentally stumbles into a church where the goblins look like people and try to make him eat ice-cream. Elliott's mate is pursued by goblins but because they are NOT people-shaped they can't catch him so they throw a spear at him. He enters the house of Frankenfurter's understudy Creedence Leonore Gielgud, who turns him into a tree. The other friend gets sick off vitamin A enriched milk and stumbles into Creedence's house but he can't move the pot his friend is in so she drowns him in popcorn by eating a corn cob with him. Or something - I'm going by memory and I didn't concentrate hard enough while I was watching this.

Meanwhile the townsfolk (in people suits again) stand and stare at the Waites menacingly until they barricade themselves into the house. They try coaxing them out again by throwing sandwiches on the porch in a threatening manner.
