Joshua takes charge by performing a séance (he must have done a few of them) which involves lighting every candle they could find. The goblins chase them into Creedence's house where a rock from Stonehenge has somehow materialized. I think I've skipped bits. Do you care? Grandpa Seth returns from the dead one last time to give Joshua a triple-decker bologna sandwich which makes the goblins scream in agony when they watch him eat it. The Waites family kill Creedence and the goblins by concentrating on Stonehenge with their hands. Elliott becomes part of the family just for being there. There's a surprise twist at the end, because nobody expects something random to happen at the end of THIS movie. Academy Award nominations, sadly, did not follow.

review_title: Best Worst Movie I've Ever Seen
review_detailed_main:
Out of all the movies I have seen which have been dubbed "worst" movie of all time, Troll 2 (1990) is by far the most fun. While Plan 9 From Outer Space (1959) has its charm and The Beast of Yucca Flats (1961) has its mercifully short run time, Troll 2 has everything going for it if it wanted to be a parody of 1980's creature features. Everything about it is brimming with cheesiness and over the top goofiness, from the acting, the special effects and even the story itself.

Troll 2 begins with a family poised to swap houses with a family from a faraway town called Nilbog, so they can get in some vacation time. Joshua (Michael Stephenson) is still reeling from the recent death of his grandfather and sees his ghost constantly. Meanwhile Holly (Connie Young) the older sister, is trying to have some fun with her boyfriend (Jason Wright) but keeps getting interrupted by his interchangeable trio of friends. When the family travels to Nilbog, with the teenage boys following behind in a camper, Joshua picks up on some ominous signs in and around their new vacation home and discovers there are goblins trying to eat them.

The principle unintended laughter is directed towards the lackluster special effects by D. Christopher Salmon and Co. many times during the movie the goblins that appear on the screen look like little people frocked with dirty sheets and topped off with paper mache masks. Not to be outdone however, Actress Deborah Reed chews the scenery like a starving child on a cracker as the goblin queen. Every facial expression and emotion is carried through her off-kilter eyebrow movements and phony Eastern European accent and played to those in the cheap seats. There was more ham in her performance than a bologna sandwich.

Every other actor fails spectacularly to bring any life out of their characters though it didn't help that they were propped by a horrid script written by Claudio Fragasso and Rossella Drudi. The dialogue was ridiculously stilted and there were enough plot holes to strain spaghetti through the celluloid. Yet despite the filmmaker's blatant incompetence not once was I bored watching Troll 2.

In fact I would rather watch Troll 2 again then sit through the original and tangentially related prequel Troll (1986). That movie made the fatal mistake of being boring and forgetful while Troll 2 is an entertaining train wreck of biblical proportions from start to finish.

Those curious to see Troll 2 need not be worried by its unseemly reputation. There is no need for a Mystery Theater 3000 (1988-1999) dubbing since the hilarity is up-close and holds your attention. A must watch for film buffs and a fun filled Saturday Z-Movie night for the rest of us. Just make sure no one you invite to your Troll party is a vegetarian.

http://www.theyservepopcorninhell.blogspot.com

review_title: One of the BEST Bad Movies - 10/10 for pure fun factor and rewatchability
review_detailed_main:
Okay, guys. Trust this review. This isn't a 1/10 bad movie. It's a 10/10 good bad movie, along the lines of other great titles such as The Room and Samurai Cop (which I recommend). The hammy acting, the practical effects, unintentionally hilarious scenes and the many quotable lines make for such a fun time.

You may have heard about this movie and it's talked about for a reason. To sum up, I highly recommend.

The movie is all about a family leaving their house in the city to try leading a farmer life in a small town called Nilbog. That's where shenanigans ensue involving some nasty little monsters. This is the base set up, but the dynamic between the characters, hammy acting, like mentioned before, and the dialogue are what help give this movie a different flavor. It's supposed to be a horror movie, but being a GOOD BAD flick, you can expect to get a good laugh. ;-)

review_title: One of the Best Bad Movies
review_detailed_main: never has a movie made me laugh as much as this one did with its bad acting. watch this with friends for a chill movie night and make sure you bring the "popcorn". Honestly though I didn't even see the first one and i was able to watch this no problem so no excuses not to watch this beauty.

There, now I can say it, I survived "Troll 2", and I am definitely worse off for it. Obviously the word average should never be uttered in reference to this "cream of the crap." The problem is, despite the grade "F" acting, screenplay, and production values, the audience must be made up of viewers who can barely write their name in the mud with a stick. Anyone with a fraction of intelligence will not be amused by this inept veggie, goblin, borefest. Better bad movies that immediately come to mind would include "Mighty Peking Man", "Mega Piranha", "Abraham Lincoln Vs The Zombies", "Bloody Trail", Bait Shop", and the King of them all "Godmonster of Indian Flats." Other lesser contenders would surely include "Microwave Massacre", and "Shark Attack 3." MERK

review_title: the absolute worst movie of all time
review_detailed_main: I've seen this movie 3 times just because I'm compelled by how horrific it is. The story, the acting, where do I begin. I have to say I actually enjoy it for the "entertainment value", or NOT. My kids and I laugh our butts off, and the only other movie that can compare to it is "Waxworks 2". I grew up watching "B" movies in the 50's , but I would classify this one as a "D", and that's putting it kindly. So I would recommend it for sheer amazement and disbelief. If you like this one you might like "Tourist Trap", and I just read they are remaking "Motel Hotel". I guess I often wondered why none of the cast in Troll 2 were never seen again. You know you're in trouble when your effeminate sounding father announces you're going to your "timeshare" in "Nilbog" I think Troll was better, especially the little toadstool/lampshade guy.

review_title: An Unstoppable Powerhouse of a bad movie!
review_detailed_main:
the complete and utter worst. How did bad acting, writing, directing, and basically poor film-making create such an entertaining film? by pure accident of course! I know they tried. what this movie shows is that effort really doesn't count for squat when you have no talent. maybe I'm being a little harsh but then again, if you've already seen this movie you know I'm justified.

I do think that this movie could have been saved if it had some naked women in it.

I give this movie 3 stars and a thumbs up. Plus a smiley face.

Ok, u're sick, and stuck at home over the weekend. What's the best thing to do? Watch this movie! It is hilarious! The acting is by far the worst I've ever seen...The story itself is just dumb...and all the little things that are supposed to be serious, just make you want to roll on the floor laughing. (Do u find corn-on-the-cob erotic??) It's definitely worth the renting money.

where the hell are the trolls? what was that? was there a plot? why the popcorn? too many questions, not enough answers. if youve seen a worse movie i pity your soul this movie could very well be the funniest movie youll ever see if you watch it with the right people. if you dont youll be strangled by the ridiculous plot and the sub amateur acting.

This film has been a treasured part of my collection since I first managed to get a copy back in film school- I place it right next to Gymkata and Deathstalker 2 as one of our favorites.

I just got this and Troll 1 on DVD and after watching them back to back, am still (again) trying to figure out how the two films really relate to one another. One has bad makeup and effects, the other has even worse makeup and effects- I mean does putting a guy in a paper mask and a burlap bag really turn him into a troll (or is it a goblin in this film)?

Here is a big question: does the last teenage boy- the one who gets smothered in popcorn- actually die? I am not sure, but would love to find out.

Minor Trivia: Sage Stallone pointed out to me that Laura Gemser, the costume designer on Troll 2 is the same Laura Gemser who played the Black Emmanuelle in that series of films.

review_title: A movie with virtually no redeemable qualities

review_detailed_main: People who give it a low rating are just trolling.

please, let me be clear about this. This is one of the worst movies ever made in the history of cinema. However it's so bad it's fun to watch, if you are in the right mood. This is definitely a film you should have for a night with beers, and friends. If you can match those criteria's I promise you will have such a laugh.

It is in no way a serious movie. it has a terrible screenplay, terrible director and even worse actors, however all these elements makes the movie extremely entertaining to watch. The most important thing is not to take this movie serious, because then you will have wasted two hours of you life. Also you may need to, as a person, enjoy slasher humor, such as zombie-kills in "The walking dead" and other things of that nature. However if you can enjoy and laugh of the terrible acting, the corny lines, and the all the way through ridiculous plot, then i suggest you watch it

Rarely am I. Either the most brilliant intentional work of a genius, or the absolute worst piece of film ever conceived. I'm a big fan of camp and deliberate themes, but I simply cannot decipher if the cast is trying to make us laugh, pull one over our eyes, or torture us with their skills. I deserve a SAG (R) card if anyone who uttered a line in this film received theirs. It may very well become a bigger cult hit than Showgirls. Forget the poor special effects, choppy editing and cinematography, a Casio soundtrack, extras pulled from a local swap-o-rama, and make-up not suitable for a kindergarten class production of Snow White, it is the true jaw-dropping dialogue and the actors' delivery of such that is the diamond or dung of this picture. You have to see it to believe it. BYOB required.

I watched this film because I wanted so see a bad film, and this expentance "Troll 2" conforms.

It's such a bad movie, the actors are horrific, the story simply stupid, but it was so bad, I find it really funny.

If you want to watch a movie without tense this film is the right choice for you. But everyone, who wants a really good film with good actors, has to hide before "Troll 2".

The trolls in this film look really funny and in some scenes I remembered on "Body Snatchers".

I give 3 points, because it entertained me quite good. But it wasn't a horror movie for me, I never was scared in this film. It's more a comedy.

review_title: What else is there to say?
review_detailed_main:
This movie is one of the worst ever to be made. Yet, it has the ability to keep us all coming back for more. Troll 2 has earned its place among the list of horrible films (and it's deservedly so). It's not so much horror, as it is an unintentional comedy. My friends, this is the "Manos" for a new generation.

This movie is by no means, a good movie. But, its sheer awfulness is why people like it. I'm not sure what was the worst: the acting, the script, the so-called twist, or the direction.

I own this movie, and couldn't ask for more in a movie. Finally, a movie that entertains (in the most unlikely manner).

review_title: I Wish These "Trolls" Were A Myth...
review_detailed_main:
Awkward and clumsy film about an American family who uproot from their "city" life in order to live in the country. As to exactly why they do this is never really made that clear, (I doubt anyone cares anyway). Anywhow, after some painful drawn-out scenes, including a disturbing dialog exchange between Mom and Dad, the family eventually set off for their new home - a town called "Nilbog".

Like a teen-novel, we see things from the youngest kid's unheard and somewhat ignored point-of-view. His performance is as good as it was ever going to be, but nevertheless it is very trying and more than occasionally annoying. Being the only member of the family with the ability to see his grandfather's ghost, he is viewed as unbelievable and hysterical by his naive and idiotic family.

The film forces us to wade through the messy plot and inexcusable deus ex machinas as they are lumped on to one another. By the end, the whole plot has become unglued, the characters unwelcome, and worst of all the good and evil voices of the film are watered-down - nothing is suspenseful, frightening or even remotely original, (again like a poor teen-novel).

The worst crime this film commits is that it undermines it's own invention. The trolls of the title, I suppose, are the goblins in the film. They are never dangerous or threatening. In fact, their powers seem to weaken throughout the film (I suppose this was one lazy and easy way of giving the "good-guys" their strength). For example, towards the end of the film, there is a siege-type situation in the family are trapped in their own house, surrounded by the goblin/townspeople. Exactly why the townspeople (who vastly outnumber the family) don't just enter the house and kill them all is illogical, incredible and frustrating.

Regular viewers should ignore this film, while C or D grade enthusiasts will only give mixed responses at best.

Oh man, it just doesn't get any worse than this. Well, I still do contend that "Manos: Hands of Fate" IS worse than Troll 2, however, Troll 2 is defintly still up there as some of the worst crap ever made.

There are so many ways this movie is bad. Each actor is bad in their own unique way. Each plot point is stupid in its own unique way. And it never ends! It seems to go on forever. Anyone watching this movie should seriously consider playing video games during the course of this movie, its really the only way to get through it. I hated that kid, I can't believe it took him so long to realize nilbog was goblin spelt backwards (did I mention there are no trolls in this movie, only goblins) I hated the granpa too, but its the dad in the movie that really puts in the most ridicliously bad performance par excellance.

Anyone even remotely involved in the making of this movie should be shot on sight. The original negative should be destroyed. The lab where the film was processed should be burned to the ground. All video copies and theatrical prints should be used for landfill. We must rid the earth of this cancer once and for all.

review_title: BWA HA HA HA HA!!! he-he he-he GWAH HA HA HA HA HA HA!!!!

review_detailed_main: Holy something ... this is amazing! That someone can actually make a movie this bad is fantastic. Absolutly everything from the actors to the goblins is so terrible that you can´t make it on purpose. You have to be totally delusional to think you made a good movie when releasing it as a horror film to the audience. It´s known as the best worst movie ever, and I get why. Must see soon again!

review_title: "They're eating her...and then they are going to eat me"

review_detailed_main: Either you get it or you don't. This is a difficult movie to rate, so don't let the Six out of Ten stars fool you. This is one of the movies that I enjoy more than any other, no matter how many times I see it. My subjective self wants to give it a Ten on the basis of pure satisfaction in the movie watching experience. Objectively however, this movie does effuse some of the worst... let me scratch that. I can't say worst, because I genuinely love everything about this movie, so let me just say that it displays some of the most nonsensical writing, acting, music, effects, etc., etc., in film history. One individual from the documentary Best Worst Film sums it up perfectly, basically saying that what makes the movie so enjoyable is precisely that it is so bad, but that it is still so obviously pure. The movie was not made cynically, or just to turn a quick buck. The people involved actually believed in what they were making. This movie, for me, is along the same lines as Jaws: the Revenge, Escape from New York, or They Live. It goes so far past bad that it become good again. Truly good. And one of the most absolutely entertaining cinematic experiences you can possibly have.

review_title: So bad it'll become a part of you
review_detailed_main: I don't know how a movie ends up this bad. Maybe it had to do with language and cultural barriers. This is an Italian film made in the USA, so it's possible that had something to do with it. Luckily, the film is entertaining. There are bad movies that put you to sleep, then there are bad movies that rot your brain as you try to deal with their ineptitude by laughing. This film is the latter. If you're an aspiring filmmaker, watch this film - it will give you oodles of confidence. Unfortunately, it will make you considerably dumber. Just for the record - I have no ill-will towards anyone who made this movie. In fact, I bought the DVD and I wish it had tons of special edition content. I'm not being sarcastic - sadly, this movie will always be a part of who I am. There's no way to separate me from it. It will haunt me forever.

review_title: You can't fight it, Troll II has become a cult classic!
review_detailed_main:
Who knew back in the summer of 1989 that we were filming a cult classic? Who knew we were filming a movie that would become so beloved, so cherished that entire web sites would be dedicated to it? Look at this lively message board, it is a marvel to behold!

Entire generations of drunken college students have made Troll 2 a part of their educational experience. Young teenage boys run around their homes yelling at their bratty younger sisters, "Go away bad monsters!" Troll 2 has become part of Americana, and I could not be more proud.

The time has come for all the Troll 2 doubters to embrace the reality of its greatness. Troll 2 deserves to mentioned among the greatest "B" horror movies ever made in the Salt Lake City greater metropolitan area.

Long live the nilbogs, er -- goblins.

my friends and i used to rent this in high school to geek out to. i just watched it again tonight, and what a horribly majestic piece of crap. i love movies without a plot just as much as the next guy, but honestly...this movie should never have been called TROLL 2. maybe they could've called it GOBLIN, but not TROLL. no relevance whatsoever to the first TROLL movie (which was actually pretty good), and an amazing lack of any sort of acting quality (especially notice the dumb as a rock father, and "I CANT GET ANY LOUDER" mom). add in some of the finest random footage of a monkey in a jet pack, and the most erotic corn eating scene you'll ever see, and you've got yourself a craptacular offering.

is this out on DVD? if so, i'm probably going to buy it.

review_title: Nilbog, Vacation capitol of the world!
The Original Boogeyman Is Back? My, How He's Changed!
review_detailed_main:
If you're gonna make a movie called Troll II, what should it be about? Trolls, right? Well, this movie strayed from the ordinary (the movie features goblins, instead), but I applaud that; it's not every year a movie as unique as this comes out. Troll II contains some unforgettable scenes: the popular dinner table set piece, Grandpa Seth's lesson in fire-starting, the priests' sermon on meat, etc.

Also, entertaining characters such as the child hero Joshua, his deceased-but-back-to-save-the-day Grandpa Seth, Creedence the local witch, the sexy Holly, the air-head Elliot and his boys, the generous Sheriff Gene Freak, Grandpa Seth's friend who used to live in Hell (whom, by the way, taught him a very useful trick), and of course the goblins themselves.

The films' use of foreshadowing is, also, very effective (eg, On the way to Nilbog Diane exclaims, with sandwich in hand, "Speaking of hungry, WANT SOME ,JOSHUA?". Also, look for the big bowl of apples in the middle of the table during the dinner scene).

The above may sound silly, but it's different and in every respect of the word: FUN! While being a clever spoof, the film also provides chills of it's own; younger viewers beware.

So, if you're watching Troll II and find yourself saying "I can't...I can't move(!), why?", it's probably because you're having a good time.

review_title: I was in this awful movie.
review_detailed_main:
I actually played one of the trolls/goblins in this film, and I'm thrilled by the fact that it's become a celebrated bad movie. It's at least as awful as everyone says, if not worse. When we were making this thing I knew it was going to be awful, and it exceded my lowest expectations.

Incidentally, this movie has nothing whatsoever to do with "Troll". When we shot it the title was "Goblins", and at no point in the movie are we ever referred to as trolls. In fact, the make-up designer was quite offended by my comment that the masks resembled the creatures in "Troll". Obviously this is a ploy to get an audience for this piece of dreck.

If you enjoy bad movies on an "MST3K" level, this is a great one. It doesn't get worse than this. I'm so glad the IMDB ranks "Trol 2" so low. It deserves it.

I herd of this movie for quit sometime now, I know it was going to bad, I did know how bad it would be. This is the movie like getting your rube bits rip off! That how painful I found Troll 2 to be.

The plot is so full of hole, it's just one big hole. The actors and actress are Ethe way over the top, more wooden than a tree or just don't even try! This is sub-porn acting, no, no this is even blow sub-porn acting.

Let's look at worst of the bunch. The Actress playing the Troll queen or whatever stupid thing she called herself. The women is, as best as I can tell, a goth redneck up to her eyeballs on drugs! The effects for this movie is ten steps down from the ones used in the final fight the Power rangers movie. The trolls look like something some kid made in art class. There most encompassing things I ever seen in my life! Every one involved with should be lock up, and copy burned! -100/10

The rarest and most satisfying kind of bad movie, one that whoops and hollers and waves its hat around like Raquel Welch in Myra Breckinridge. Nothing shy or retiring about Troll 2 - Joe d'Amato makes no excuses whatsoever for his crummy little movie, he REVELS in its badness, putting every cent of his $58.23 budget right up there on the screen where you can see it.

I mean, you only THINK you've seen bad acting in a color movie - Troll 2 has entire rooms full of actors - okay, warm bodies - reading lines to each other like rehearsals for the church pageant. And it has Creedence the Druid. Creedence the Druid sets a standard for over-the-top-screamingly-godawful acting that may never be exceeded unless they make Manos 2: The Reckoning with Richard Simmons as Torgo.

And you only THINK that nothing could top the mutant sheep fetus in Godmonster of Indian Flats for flaky plot points. How about - vegetarian shape-shifting trolls, identifiable in human form by shamrock-shaped warts?

Crappy FX? How about lime jello and green food coloring used as...no, you won't believe it, nor the use of a double baloney sandwich as an offensive weapon.

Gotta see this one, folks. This isn't a bad movie because it's incredibly boring, or because MST got hold of it, or because all the major critics hated it. This is a bad movie because it's crazy as a backhouse rat whacked with a ball bat, running around in circles in the middle of the barnyard.

review_title: DO YOU LOVE WATCHING FILMS WITH SAND IN YOUR EYES ???? GREAT !!!!
review_detailed_main:
Then you'll love TROLL 2 (electric boogaloo)

this film is called the worst film ever made and yet hailed as one of the greatest bad films that people love ... so bad you love it ...so bad people praise it ... but whatever you think of it you know it is in fact BAD .... the stories behind the production are strange and confusing , ranging from how no one on set spoke the same language, leading to odd conflicts during shooting for the actors and director etc, to how marketing changed the name to troll 2 to cash in on the American title of "troll" a film that has NOTHING to do with this movie .... the history of this film is a roller coaster ride in and of itself ... BUT the film ....lets talk about it ...

the FX are about as good as a wal mart Halloween sell gets , "50% off ?!?!?! man I bet I could film a goblin movie with these masks !!!!" ... the gore was at times silly but at least they had fun with it I guess ....

the acting is stiff , now granted they were reading the direct written script and were not allowed to wonder from it lol... and wow ... it was bad ... mis translated and mis understood and mis fired and missed the point and anything else "mis" lol.. it was cheesy and over the top (so I loved it )

the over all quality was at least on par with other films of the era though so good job lol....

its a great film to make fun of OBVIOUSLY in internet trolls found their king and dug into it lol.... but its stupid ...terrible and awesome ..... I give it an 8 but not because it is good or deserves it ....but because like so many others out there .. it found a special place in my heart .... awwwww lol

What do you get when you mix bad acting, a horrible script, and a dozen goofy rubber goblin masks? Troll 2. The only rule you must keep in mind while watching is attempt at a movie is: DON'T ASK WHY. If you are confused, just remember that the actors probably were too.

The first thing you must accept is that the title of this movie is `Troll 2,' but there are no trolls mentioned anywhere, just goblins. The ONLY connection I can make from the first film is that people do turn into green pods. The next piece of garbage to swallow is the idea that the family is taking a vacation through an `exchange program' where they switch homes with someone in the country. The star, a young boy named Josh, has the weight on his shoulders of not only being the hero, but also being the best actor as well. His mother, who seems to only have one facial expression, forces Josh to sing her favorite song (Row, Row, Row Your Boat) during the car ride to Nilbog. The father is an idiot, and the teen sister delivers her lines as if she had just read them before filming the scene and then there's Grandpa Seth, the family ghost who tries to help them. Trailing the family van is the sister's boyfriend, Elliot, and his friends to look for `liberated Nilbog girls.' In one of her best lines, Holly warns Elliot `If my father knew you were here he'd cut off your little nuts and eat them!' Thank God none of these people had much of a film career afterwards.

The family arrives in the practically deserted and oh-so-clever titled town of Nilbog and meet with the family who they are exchanging homes with. Right away, Josh recognizes that something is wrong and his fears are confirmed when he receives a message from the goblins written on a baseball (???). The family sits down to eat food that looks like it has been covered in mold as Grandpa Seth appears to tell Josh that the food will turn them into goblins food and he will stop time for 30 seconds for Josh to do something. Torn, Josh stands on his chair crying `I must do it!' while unzipping his pants. The angry father carries Josh upstairs to deliver one of his great lines `You can't p**s on hospitality - I won't allow it!' and tightens his belt a loop while challenging his young son to a hunger strike.

Elliot's friends (who he sleeps naked with?) head out one by one looking for food, but don't realize that coffee is the devil's drink in Nilbog. Arnold believes that there must be `a logical explanation for all of this,' but the only explanation I can think of is that the script was the result of a drug-induced hallucination. Grandpa Seth can stop time, but just can't seem to find Josh's room in the house, the father falls asleep outside the general store while looking at a cookbook, and Josh overhears the townspeople complaining about the `smelly bladders' of humans. When the family is confronted by the townspeople with more Nilbog food, one of Grandpa Seth's solutions is - of course - to give his young grandson a molotov cocktail! And what about Elliot's friends? Forget about them, it is obvious that the director certainly has towards the end.

Of course, the best part of this movie is the end, which is fairly anti-climatic, but hilarious. Afterwards, the movie pretty much drops off without much explanation to an even more `shocking' ending. Amazingly enough, the director made this 93 minute fiasco seem like an eternity, but don't let any of this deter you. If you love watching bad flicks, don't hesitate to run out to your video store now searching for it. The entertainment you receive from the interesting love scene with corn is worth the rental fee alone. In my opinion this one belongs right up there next to `Manos.'

review_title: There must be some logical explanation for this...
review_detailed_main:
Oh my GOD this movie is bad. The first time I saw it, I simply sat there with my mouth agape at the incomprehensible dialogue, the pathetic acting, the grade-school costuming. However, I may advise you that it does get better with multiple viewings, as you start to see more of the subtle nuances of the badness. For instance, in most other movies I can single out one or a few actors who are not good. In this movie, the best actors are the extras. From the hideous mugging of Joshua, to the bizarre lines of Sheriff Gene Freak, no one comes out unscathed. Especially bad are the mom, who shouts all her lines in a grating monotone, and her daughter, who dances for no reason and has a love/hate relationship with her quasi-homosexual boyfriend. As in, she loves him in one scene, and hates him...in the same scene. But then, I haven't gotten into the goblins.

Yes, Troll 2 has no trolls at all. These are goblins ("spiteful, and impudent", the 'wise' Grandpa Seth explains), also known as squat burlap-sack-clad midgets with Wal-Mart $2.95 Halloween masks and work gloves. Of course they don human disguises for most of the movie, because this is easier to film. They are led by Deborah Reed as Creedence, who rivals Jon Voight of Anaconda and John Steiner of Sinbad of the Seven Seas for my hilarious overacting award. They are vegetarians who listen to intricate sermons on the evils of meat-by-products, while still loving to eat people, just so long as they're "purified" by dry-ice concoctions or green-toothpasted food. Which, by the way, none of the family finds strange in the slightest. Green corn-on-the-cob? Sure, eat it every day. No problem.

I won't spoil the magnificent ending for you here (though many have already) except to say it nullifies the entire struggle against the goblins up to that point. Which I suppose is indicative of this entire movie. It's pointless to the nth degree, but I love it. If you like bad movies, you will too. Heed the advice of Grandpa Seth. They can. They CAN!!!

This movie is awful. It is laughably bad. I liked the first one, but this is terrible. sure there are a few good scenes(Oh my God,Corn Porn) But most of the movie is awful. It has a terrible plot. It is so painful that it is not even so bad its good. There are so bad it good movies, Like Plan 9, but this has worse acting than that. at least plan 9 is entertaining, but this is not. Troll 2 is the 4th worst movie I Have ever seen. don't waste your money. don't waste your time. It may be entertaining sometimes if you pretend your on MST3K. 1 out of 10. Terrible movie. should have been on MST3K. If you want to see a good bad movie, watch Plan 9.

Note I'm an avid fan of MST3K and have developed a fondness for bad movies and subjegate my self to the torture of watching these miserable movies.

I read about this movie and I wanted to see it so bad since I read the review/summary. Well I tried all the video stores in the city. Nothing. Looks like I'd never get to see this film ever. :( But at the store where I work we had a bin of lousy movies on sale for $5. I scan Find one other crappy movie I've been dying to have to make fun of in my free time. What do I see underneath the basket?? But a copy of this VHS movie!!! Sweet lord I'm gonna get to watch this film!! I pay for it (along with two other lousy movies (Making Contact and The Brain). I can't wait to get done with my shift.

I finally get home and watch this. I have not laughed this hard at a bad movie in such a long time!! Man Mike and the bots would have a feild day with this film. The effects are lousy, plot is lame, acting is wooden and I noticed some of the actors looking right into the camera more than once. The kid looks like is is constipated through the entire film. I've seen movies so bad you wouldn't believe your eyes. I've seen Manos The Hands of Fate!! The costumes are obviously 'little people' inside with potato sacks for clothing, gardening gloves over their hands and masks that look like they were made by pre schoolers!

This film is so ripe for Mike and the bots. I can see some of the sketches. For the final one Crow is, as always, dressed like a charachter from the film. This time he is a Goblin. Mike is dressed seductivly like the witch trying to seduce Tom with the ear of corn. (If you saw this film you'd get the gag). Oh the possibilities.... I found my jokes flying out ripping this film to shreds.

I HIGHLY recommend this for any MST3K at home parties for fans. If you simply love bad movies like I do, then find it and rent it if you can. For everyone else, avoid like the plauge.

review_title: it IS the worst movie ever made
review_detailed_main:
Ahhh what a treat to write this review so many years after i saw Troll 2!

For the last 20 years+ whenever i have seen a bad movie i would always finish with "at least it's not as bad as Troll 2"...

I remember the night i watched this movie, around 1989, and i had rented it from the local supermarket (VHS video tape) and was to watch it as the 2nd film of the evening (2nd films of the night don't have to be that good)...i watched about 10 minutes of it and the rest in fast forward, it was dreadful..

So to spare anyone else having to sit through this rubbish, bearing in mind the local supermarket had closed by now and i didn't have another film to watch, i pulled the film from it's reels, took the strip of film and the case outside, poured lighter fluid on it and set fire to it...i ended up having to pay the supermarket 5 times the rental but it was worth it because i managed to talk the manager into not re-ordering Troll 2 again (i was a regular there)...

I have never destroyed another film after watching it, none have been that bad, and i've seen some real bad movies...

You know when you hear someone review a bad movie and they say but it's worth watching anyway because it's so cheesy? Well if you watch this movie, even if you are normally a passive person, you may sit there afterwards and think "hey it wasn't so bad" but for the rest of the day you will have this underlying anger at the 2 hours you wasted and fact that you were warned...

Phew been waiting to tell someone that for 20 years!

It's so bad, so very bad...

I can most defently appreciate a good movie when I see one, and this wasn't one. But the reason it is so good is down to how on earth this film was ever made, let alone getting a dvd release! The acting is truley appalling, along with the direction, editing, art direction and camera. But there is some shots in their that made me laugh, which helps its cause. I love terrible films, and this is a terrible film. Which does feature the most fantastic skateboarding scene since back to the future. The story is unbelievable! And the goblin's costumes are pathetic! Its great! The film features so many great lines. "Want some, Joshua!" I cant be bothered writing a detailed review, but if you enjoy a bad movie and your not a moron that always has their head up their own a**e, you'll enjoy this a lot.

Pure cinematic genius. The absolute greatest movie ever made. If I'm not mistaken, it won several Oscars, including best spearthrowing in a film, best use of a bologna sandwich, etc. The other reviews do a good job of summerizing the movie, but you would really need to see the movie to truly understand how bad it is. The acting is the absolute worst. The plot is so stupid, you wonder if there was a script, or if they just got out a camera and started filming. The dinner scene, the scene where the kid realizes Nilbog is goblin backwards(which happens after his dad tells him that people in small towns go to bed early in the afternoon, then proceeds to fall asleep on a bench while reading a vegetable cookbook), the scene where the guy runs (literaly) into town to buy milk but ends up eating a green hamburger and turning into a puddle of goo, they are all brilliant. If you see only one movie in your entire life, make it TROLL 2.

review_title: Joshua, sing that song I like so much

review_detailed_main:
This movie is awesomely bad in a good way. Don't take this movie seriously. Just sit back and enjoy the absurdity, quotable dialog ("Nilbog that goblin spelled backwards!") and delightful characters.

If you are a bad movie lover, this movie is for you.

Those who yearned for a sequel to the Sonny Bono/Julia Louis-Dreyfus film "Troll," needn't yearn any longer. It's hard to believe, but this movie makes "Troll" look like "Schindler's List." This trying experience includes watching people turn into plants, watching a young boy pee on his family's dinner table under direct orders from his dead grandfather, and wanting to smack the main character for taking the entire length of the movie to figure out that "Nilbog" is "Goblin" backwards. It is an extraordinarily badly acted movie with excruciatingly terrible special effects and a plot that would make Ed Wood cringe. I'm perplexed by the fact that this movie was never used on "Mystery Science Theater 3000." The one good thing about this movie is that it is so terrible that it's hilarious. Too bad it's not supposed to be a comedy.

review_title: Here's a zero star movie if ever there was one
No language invented by man can sufficiently render the true nightmare that is Troll 2.

review_detailed_main: Right on kid! That'll teach em! And maybe if it doesn't, you could invite grandpa back from the dead so he can shoot railguns and howitzers and other tricks he learned from his friend in hell, at the big bad goblins. ohhhhh, Troll 2 is the mother of all B flicks. Intended audience?...uhhhh either "Rainman" or those two dudes from "Of Mice and Men." The cover itself, makes absolutely no sense in relation to the movie. "The original boogeyman is back?" Where?!?! I just see Warwick Davis and pals hobbiling around in Jo Ann Fabric baby pajamas with Walmart masks over their faces. We also have the opening scene, which features absolutely heartripping suspense as Gunter the Nazi Postchild, gets jiggy with some random babe in the woods named Hildegard. She gives him some Vegan concoction, spiked with acid, which transforms her appearance into something closely resembling an Ewok. Suddenly, Gunter finds himself consumed by tiny fury munchkins, all angrily bent on destroying him and conquering the world or something. Really Really bad. Every scene in this movie, sucks. All the actors, suck. It's really funny. If you can find this gem at your local video store, save it for the next party. Troll 2 is the standard for which all movies will rate themselves better than.

review_title: "D.U.D, oh my God, thats Dud spelled backwards"
review_detailed_main:
We can't imagine what circumstances lead to this movie being made. Did somebody lose a bet? Honestly, where did they find these actors, we have a few theories. Theory 1 - These "actors" happened to send their "Win a Starring Roll in Troll 2" cards back first. Theory 2 - The Casting Director stumbled through K-mart in a drunken stupor slurring "Who wants to be in a movie" Theory 3 - when the budget got tight, the Director was forced to employ his babysitter, his paperboy, his hairdresser and his cousin in starring roles. Theory 4 - these people didn't even realize they were being taped.

There is so much wrong with this filth its hard to know where to begin. Lets start with the ridiculous plot. The family exchange program was just ludicrous. How hurting was this family for a vacation that they would agree to such a ridiculous idea. The food issue was also a bogus idea. The family didn't eat for three days and didn't even seem to notice. They also didn't seem to care that all the food was bright green including the butter on the corn and rolls. While we're on the subject of food, we should mention a scene that should've been left on the cutting room floor. I'm speaking of the scene in which the witch seduces the teenage boy with none other than corn on the cob. The scene proceeds to have minimum wage stage hand throwing handfuls of popcorn from behind the camera.

Now the sister in the movie's acting deserves a paragraph all by itself. It had to be the worst display of acting ever, a few choice words to describe her performance would be - horrible, lurid, loathsome, appalling, nausiating, awful. I think she would've faired better in a high school play that was thrown together in a week. We also found it utterly annoying how Joshua and his sister referred to each other as "Big Sister" and "Little Brother". Who talks like this? It's almost as if the screenwriter forgot to proof-read or the actors were just told to make up their lines as they went along. Maybe the writers just worked on the script during the 4 days that this movie was being filmed.

Finally the costumes looked like something you would pick-up the day before Halloween at Family Dollar when all the other costumes were gone. To wrap things up there were a lot of things just unnecessary with this film. The gruesome use and abuse of green food-coloring and sweat plagued this film. The ridiculous scenes involving a bologna sandwich and Joshua urinating on the food were just plain stupid. Without giving away the ending we can honestly say it reeks. After watching this "movie" we had to take long showers to cleanse ourselves from the memories of Troll 2.

This film is genius. Troll 2 has some of the greatest lines in film history. I can't remember how many times I bursted out laughing. Connie McFarland is the greatest actress ever. (of course I'm not serious)Nothing will ever come close to the line "my father will cut off your little nuts and eat them". There is so much I could say about this film and what a masterpiece it is. If you haven't seen this movie you can't go without seeing it. Just be aware, the sequel to this film is downright horrible. Don't even bother renting The Crawlers. Joe D'Amato is a god. One more thing, What happened to all the hot, liberated chicks ?

review_title: Michael... Who are the Goblins? ... THE GOBLINS?
review_detailed_main: So unbelievably bad its great! The acting was painful. I had to watch more to see how this thing can turn out. I could have made a better movie with what they had. I think the cast was having a great time since no one knew what was going on which you could tell when this was made. It had many random scenes which made no sense, like the dance sequence which has nothing to do with anything. The corn seduction, which again has nothing to do with anything. All of these things made this movie so awesome to watch. You cannot help yourself to watch till the end. The most annoying thing was the magic Grandpa Seth who is like a fairy for little Joshua. Again another thing that doesn't make sense. "Joshua, sing me that song I love" Oh My God! This is some classic stuff. This movie tickles you in everyway possible, which you don't see much of anymore. This should be in the comedy section since it was made with the intention of being serious but turned out to be a huge comedy. Priceless! 1 out of 10 since its an awful movie, but 10 out of 10 for extreme goofyness.

review_title: Hands down one of the greatest movies ever made!!
review_detailed_main:
What can one say about Troll 2. The acting, the writing, the make-up. All fabulous! The director can truly hold his head high with this masterpiece. It is rare that every aspect of a movie can be brilliant, but Troll 2 is the exception. It is one of cinemas finest movies, and everyone who even remotely enjoys cinema must see this film.

This film is worth Oscars in every department, especially the performance of the actors themselves. The very fact that not one Oscar has been awarded is a travesty. Truly an immersive, visual masterpiece.

10/10 -Simply put one of the greatest films ever produced. A must see for all.

I am a huge movie enthusiast, and have been to film festivals all over the world. The cast and production quality of Troll 2 is unbelievable! It had me sucked in from the very beginning with a plot that was psychologically and esthetically unbeatable. You need not watch any troll movies before it because it was fantastically made as a sequel without having to watch a prequel! Good for the kids too! I showed it to all of my kids and younger cousins and the rest of the night, all they wanted to do was to help clean the house because they were so happy! I have watched it three times in a row because i am picky but i could not find any plot holes or anything at all wrong with this cinematic masterpiece. Michael Stephenson does an incredible job also with outstanding performances from Darren Ewing. By far the best movie I have ever seen...unbeatable.

review_title: This is the greatest worst movie of all time!

review_detailed_main:
Please allow me to explain my rating of two.If it were a one,I wouldn't advise wasting any time of your life on the movie.But with a rating of two, and maybe with the proper setting to see the movie,I'd give it a look.The proper setting is key! Allow me to explain.

The recipe for this film is to invite some friends. Then lay out some munchies and "drinks",a little cheba cheba,and be prepared to pun the night away!Honestly,this film cannot be matched in it's genre.It is the benchmark.Sober or intoxicated,folks will not be able to resist making comments about this masterpiece.

Remember to have an open mind and give this film one look.Who knows? Maybe you'll even watch it again someday ,because it's "so bad,it's good ".

review_title: Tips and Tricks for 1st time viewers of Troll 2
Maybe we're not understanding the message and symbolism...
Fun story overall, but HORRIBLE ACTORS
review_detailed_main: I actually liked this movie. A lot. The only thing I HATED about this movie, were the actors. Holy cow. They were truly the worst actors I have ever experienced on screen. ESPECIALLY the mother. WOW. I was shocked that any of these people got hired for this movie. But I guess no one else would do it. Anyway. The plot is funny. The goblins are cool to look at if you ask me. I liked the story and the idea for this movie. The overall experience is that I liked it. It's definitely NOT the worst movie ever. The only thing I hated was the actors. Worth checking out for sure.

I saw this movie after hearing nothing but abysmal reviews about it. After watching it, I can honestly say this is without a doubt the worst movie ever concocted. This movie made me physically sick; not many movies can do that. The budget for the movie was probably found in the producer's sofa cushions, and the actors would have played better if they were dead. The storyline is impossible to follow, which is probably a good thing; if this movie made any sense it would probably be worse, if such a thing is possible. If this movie is not the #1 movie on the bottom 100, make it your duty to get it back down there. DO NOT watch this movie, it will give you nightmares and STDs.

review_title: Oh, bad. Bad bad bad. Worse than bad. Worse than worst.
review_detailed_main: Absolutely the most amateurish film I've ever seen - I could do better with a videocamera and no script. Ugh. I didn't even find it bad enough to be able to enjoy it for camp (like Ed Wood) - it's JUST BAD. The worst film I've ever seen.

review_title: It stinks. Oh boy, it really and truly stinks.
review_detailed_main: Incredibly awful movie. I can't actually think of one that is as bad. You really should see this just to give you an absolute scale to judge other films by.

review_title: Quite possibly the Stupidest film I have ever seen! (Revised)
Bad movie, but absolutely hilarious to make fun of
review_detailed_main: Troll 2 is probably the worst, and best bad-funny, movie I have ever seen. The acting is terrible, the plot is even worse, and yet you can't help to crack up at it! The whole movie is about this family that goes on a vacation in nilbog, goblin spelled backwards, but finds out that the people living in the city are all (plot twist!) goblins! To me, the funniest thing is that the name of the movie is Troll 2, and yet the word "Troll" isn't uttered out of anyone's mouth or mentioned in the plot throughout the WHOLE MOVIE!! They're goblins, not trolls! But to finish up, this movie is overall horrible, but I would still HIGHLY recommend it to anyone, considering that it is so bad it's the most hilarious movie I've watched in a long, long time.

Terence Malick. Stanley Kubrick. Stephen Speilberg. Great directors all, and yet none have come close to the genius that is Troll 2. The man by the name of Joe D'Amato, of Anal Perversions of Lolita fame, created this masterpiece that deserves a place alongside the great films of our time.

The story involves a house exchange program in which a family from the country switches places with a family from the city. Although this occurs often without incident it seems this time something went wrong. It's a good thing that dead Grandpa Seth is around to help out when the sh*t hits the fan with that sage advice for which he's known. Joshua, our hero, tries to warn his family of the threat of attack by the goblins of Nilbog but the family pays no mind. When good old dead Grandpa Seth gives 9 year old Joshua a molotov cocktail to play around with the truth about the goblins becomes apparent. Needless to say that this film achieves a level of genius so far unmatched in the film industry. Joe D'Amato was working on a level in which few of us could hope to understand. But for those of us who believe in the true beauty of film, Troll 2 holds a special place in our heart. And as Grandpa Seth said, "No I'm not in hell but I knew someone who was there once." Genius!

"Troll 2" is one of the legendary bad movies that I finally got the excuse to watch when it was covered on the "How Did This Get Made" podcast. The first "Troll" film I absolutely hated but this is firmly in the "so bad it's good" category.

Michael Waits (George Hardy) takes his family on a home swap holiday, so they can experience a rural farming community for the summer. Michael's son Joshua (Michael Stephenson) is contacted by the ghost of his late grandfather (Robert Ormsby) and warned that Goblins have poisoned the food, with the intention of changing the family into a plant like matter which they then consume. Joshua manages to destroy all the food and temporarily save his family, but his sister's boyfriend Elliot (Jason Wright) and his friends - who have decided to follow the family on the holiday - are not so lucky.

Despite their connections being tenuous at best, it's hard not to compare this film with its predecessor, in which case this is a hundred times better. It's certainly a low budget film, and that's evident in the questionable acting and ropey effects - but it leans into this for camp effect and it's fun and both intentionally, though more often unintentionally funny. I have to give some special praise to Deborah Reed, who plays Creedence, the witch who rules over the goblins. She's magnificently over the top and magnetic when she was on screen. I'm not going to lie, I was into her well before her "glow up" scene.

The music is a little strange, it's all synthesiser turns, and I wonder if the band Goblin from the Argento/Romero soundtracks were an inspiration. It doesn't fit subtly with the on-screen actions.

I'm not normally one that goes in for ironic appreciation of anything, but I genuinely enjoyed watching "Troll 2" even though it's a failure on every technical level you can imagine.

review_title: If you're into bad movies, this ones for you!
review_detailed_main: Troll 2 has to be in the top 3 of all time when it comes to classically terrible movies, truly a must watch for the whole family.

review_title: A whole new plateau of nauseating movies.

review_detailed_main: Troll 2 is one of the worst movies I've seen in a long time. Believe me I've seen some pretty bad movies. Whats bad about it? Pretty much everything. The acting was probably the worst thing about the whole movie. No one in the movie had any clue how to act. Another terrible thing about this movie is the goblin costumes, ( Thats right, goblins there are no trolls in this movie.) Anyway they look like midgets dressed up in costumes made by second-graders. Not to mention the movies special effects were probably made on of a budget of like $50.00. The music dosen't even match up with whats going on. So if you are considering renting this movie then RECONSIDER. This movie dosen't even deserve to be on the shelves of blockbuster.

Ok...I didn't know this was credited as a the worst film ever when I got it on a double bill with the first film (Which was poor but watchable) As I type I'm just over 15 m in and what can I say...

Awful acting and dialogue, direction fits the acting...

And as I type this the freeze wobble/piss on table scene has just played...

Will I last the full film...

Doubt I'll be arsed to report if I do.

review_title: This is the best movie ever!!!!
review_detailed_main: I love this movie, I bought it on the weekend and since then i have been in love. This movie is probably the best combination of terrible special affects, music that has no relevance to what is happening, Italian directing and the worst acting in anything ever made. I still can't believe that there are 7 movies lower on the bottom 100 list, that's why I rated it 1. Now if everyone who loves this movie like i do rates it 1 we can make it the worst movie of all time... yay. Woah this is sad. If anyone does not love this movie I hate you and I hope you eat some strange green oatmeal! But anyway I wonder if this movie was made as a joke, I mean no one would think that this was a good movie. So anyway vote 1 Troll 2!!!!!!!!@

review_title: Yes, it really is THAT Bad!

review_detailed_main: Troll 2 is by far the worst movie I have ever seen, but it is so much fun to watch! It's like the people who made the movie realized how bad the movie was so they decided to turn it into the joke. But I'm happy they did that. If this had been serious, it would have been just plain terrible. but the way they made it, it was terrible but so memorable too. There is not a moment in this movie to make anyone think it is good, and it could be the best bad movie ever. I know it's cliché, but it fits for this trash. The acting, writing, plot, effects, and everything you can think of are horrible. Just thinking about it makes me laugh. Although it is so utterly, tragically, terrible, I suggest this to anybody who wants to have fun while watching a movie.

review_title: Secure in the fact that I'm not alone
review_detailed_main: I've always thought of this movie as "the worst movie I have ever seen!" Now I have some reasurance. From the pitiful acting to the horrible effects, this film has(or dosen't have) it all!!! The plot is insanely bad, and the movie simply fails in every respect. Still, movies like this one are a huge reason why I love film. God bless these people who can't make a movie to save their souls. If you like this film for it's bad taste, check out "Bats".

review_title: Ride the tiger something something stripes are clean
review_detailed_main: Sometimes when I watch Troll 2 it's better to not watch, because it's Troll 2. This is an amazing, fascinating movie entirely by accident. Never have so many failures been confined to one space and be called a movie until Troll 2. There is no way to make this movie on purpose unless you are crazy.

When I was watching the troll 2 documentary (best worst movie), one of the fans of the movie claimed that it appeared as though it was made by aliens. I couldn't agree more. This is probably most evident in the dialog. The characters say things that make little to no sense. The also say things that make sense but are completely strange. This is has a very good comedic effect.

Besides the poorly written dialog, the movie is pretty trashy and boring. There are a couple stand out appearances that are funny because of the actor or because of the acting. I'm referring to the shopkeeper and the daughter in the movie.

The film is quite incoherent. The editing and flow is really terrible. This doesn't really carry a comedic effect like the other flaws, its just bad. The camera-work isn't too bad. Not sure why this gets complaints. I guess people just like to complain about every possible thing there is to complain about in a bad movie.

If you are a kid under 10 years of age, you might like this movie. Otherwise, stay away from it at all costs. It's the stupidest movie I've ever seen. Everything's stupid, the story, script, acting, everything! While watching the movie you'll either turn the TV off and think "how can a movie be so sadly stupid", or keep on watching from curiosity, to see if things can get more stupid than this (they can't). :)

review_title: I HAVE this movie on DVD!!!!

review_detailed_main:
This was a pretty funny movie. I remember watching this once when I was bored and the first time I saw it, it seemed extremely low-budget. I remember a girl was supposed to be "turning into a vegetable" or something and it just looked like they layed her naked and put green slime all over her and some midgets came out wearing masks and started to "eat" her, or in this case, scooping the slime off her. Who knows? Maybe they were cleaning her. ;-) The deal with all the food causing people to turn into vegetables was just silly. And a lot of the acting seemed wooden, like it was as if they hadn't rehearsed what-so-ever and showed no emotion in their parts.

I'd watch it again if I was feeling depressed. :-)

review_title: Not A Movie Or A Sequel

review_detailed_main: Throughout this whole movie my hand never strayed to my crotch not even once.Plus the characterization seemed a little thin.You know Troll backwards is Llort...so whats with nilbog?This movie has a message but it tries too hard.Don't take yourself so seriously every movie cant be an Oscar contender.This movie reeks of being released too quickly just so it could get so-called "oscar buzz".I enjoyed "Rain Man" I cried during "Mask" but come on the handicapped tear jerker has gone too far.I mean a whole family of retards is bad enough but then they move to a whole town full of tards?This movie just yells love me...love me please!I'm a masterpiece!The big budget seemed well spent and the effects still hold up well today.As a footnote last year I was traveling on business and I passed a town called retsnomdedrat,But I didn't stop because I figured the place was probably full of retarded vegetarian trolls.You live you learn.

Yes I really did watch this! I've seen only a few scenes of the first Trolls movie, but really this does not qualify as a sequel in any way. Heck there are no trolls, they're all goblins spelled backwards! Wow everybody was right about how ridiculously bad this movie is! The plot makes Twilight look like Godfather (Yes I really did say that) The choice dialogue is bonkers The character actions are mind boggling! Most of the actors are either over the top or not trying at all Music is repetitive all throughout Lamest confrontation ever Biggest "What the heck!" ending ever!

This movie makes me want to study the writers and analyze what they could have been thinking when designing the script. Every scene has at least 5 things wrong with it from horrendous acting, repeating words twice in the same sentence/paragraph, the timing, the "action", the character choices, just everything!! I don't even know how many stars to give this thing, because it's somehow the best worst movie I've ever seen in my life; somehow topping The Room! As a storyteller, it's painful, but this movie forces me to drop that instinct and laugh the whole way through!

So the way most people describe this movie the first time they see it is this: "It's got to get better, right?" He/she then sits through 2 hours of agony in which the question is answered with a resounding "NO." Not only does this movie not get any better as it goes on, but it somehow manages to become worse. I applaud the director and actors for the lamentable job that they accomplished and wonder deep in my heart, if there could be a worse movie.

Let's get real folks, about what a truly BAD movie is - a BAD film has lasting entertainment value, if only because we can laugh at it and make ourselves feel good in the process - hey, even I can do better than that! TROLL 2 is like HOBGOBLINS - hopelessly inept, bandaged up by blind elephant doctors hoping to salvage a useless mess. I doubt anyone ever intended to make it THAT bad.

Ed Wood, however, is the Elvis of bad: he is the perfect storm of ambition, vision, ineptitude and outright dementia. From GLEN OR GLENDA to BRIDE OF THE MONSTER to NIGHT OF THE GHOULS and of course, PLAN 9 - how could anyone literally think what they were doing was good enough to commit to film? Paper place saucers? Cardboard cockpits? Wood is FIRESIGN THEATER all rolled into one - mostly because he truly thought he was making good films, albeit a few "short cuts." TROLL 2 is easily one of the most ineptly salvaged movies ever; but then, so is MONSTER A GO-GO.

I remember this movie from when I was much younger...And I was ecstatic to see this movie released on DVD. Everything about this movie is so bad, I absolutely love it. The costumes (for the goblins, there are no trolls in the movie) look like used up potato sacks thrown on midgets. The script is horrible, and I've seen better acting in Kindergarten plays (In fact, the best actor in this movie is the boy). Watch it if you can honestly sit back and enjoy a movie for what it is really trying to be, EXTREMELY BAD.

review_title: At least they didn't call it Gremlins 3
review_detailed_main:
Why? I mean, how did this happen? Nevermind, I'n not even going to attempt to comprehend what I just saw, but I really do need to talk about it...

At first, it seemed like a kids movie, and hell, maybe it is, more like something from The Disney Channel in the early 90's, but after the first few minutes of a kid having a conversation with his dead grandfather, it becomes obvious that there is something very, very "off" about all of this. Off how, you ask? Kind of peculiar? A bit bizarre? A mind-blowingly awkward sin against common sense? Yeah, that's the one. Troll 2 isn't just another bad movie with bad acting, and zero atmosphere, there's something else going on here. Anyway, Kid is being told a bedtime story, about goblins, by dead-Grandpa, come to think of it, that's what Troll 2 is all about... yeah!! Goblins!! Dead-Grandpa disappears when other family members show up, possibly because kid's acting is the only one he can stand, really, the other family members are really something special. Speaking of Goblins, they've tricked kid's family into temporarily trading houses with another family from a town called Nilbog. Well, nuts to that, kid says. Unfortunately, the family is quite keen on the idea, so it's off to Nilbog to hopefully, not be eaten by Goblins... yeah, Goblins!!

And what about Troll 1, you ask? Well, what about it? I haven't seen it, I don't watch much mainstream. This practical joke on celluloid has nothing to do with it, whatever it is, they just picked a money-making title at random. In all my years of searching,Troll 2 is only the third worst movie I've come across. If you care, or don't believe me, or are just insane, check out Zombie '90 (#2) and The Chooper (#1) for experiences still not as strange as this one, but worse, nonetheless. Ultimately, I walked away from this one with a smile. Bewildered to hell and back, but smiling, because when the complete and utter shock wore off, I came to realize, I not only witnessed something too strange for words, but also, something too hilarious for words (almost). If you're looking for a new level, as well as a new type of badness, then this garbage from another dimension might be for you. How would one rate Troll 2? How am I supposed to know? I don't even know what the hell I just watched, so let's just let this one be.

There are rumors of a sequel entitled Troll 2: Part II... I repeat, Troll 2: Part II. and in case you were wondering, Nilbog is Goblin spelled backwards. No, really!

review_title: Second worst movie ive ever seen
review_detailed_main:
First worst movie ive ever seen is Never Ending Story 3 (that's right... you didnt even know there was a third one... and that's a good thing)

Troll 2 almost dethrones NES3 as worst movie ever made, but at least you can laugh at what a cinematic abomination this is. Save this for a night when you literally have run out of all, and I mean ALL, other movie options, have absolutely no expectations and possibly marijuana. This isnt bottom of the barrel; this is a rollie polie underneath the barrel

review_title: Quite probably the worst theatrically released film ever!!!
review_detailed_main:
I don't even know what this was, it was that bad. It was weird, horribly acted, badly directed, even worse written and the trolls were pathetic looking. I'll start with the plot. It's about a stupid family going to the stupid town of "Nilbog" and meeting trolls and witches there. Not only that, but the little boy sees his dead grandpa's ghost. Sounds good?...Read on.

I'll start my negatives on the acting. This has some of the worst acting I've ever experienced. Every line said has no emotion whatsoever, and it's as though they got these people off the street. The best actor was the little boy who is one of the worst child actors I've ever experienced.

Now onto the effects. They were some of the worst I've ever seen. I guess this was on a $5 dollar budget or something. The trolls were all midgets in fat little suits with really lame looking troll costume heads. In a particularly brainless scene, a girl turned into a witch comes onto a boy and they have an ear of corn in each other's mouth and popcorn starts coming at them(???) They were about as scary as something from an Ed Wood movie!

The direction was all over the place. The camera-work was awful and shaky and I just hated it! The writing was just as bad as the acting, and this was one of the weirdest, stupidest things ever. I guess there were trolls, and witches and the witches turns people into trees or something(?)

It was awful, don't see it unless you want to make fun of it, which is why I own this film. It is really hilarious, and would have been better off being released as a comedy. The worst line has to be, "Grampa Seth is still with us in our hearts, but we must banish him from our minds."

PG-13 for lame green blood. 93 mins. 0/100.

review_title: oh no! nilbog is spelled goblin backwards
review_detailed_main:
troll 2+dumb actors+a dumb plot+the fackiest trolls you have ever seen= the dumbiest funniest stupidest movie yet.the witch in the movie was hilarious...and basically this movie takes place in hick town...because everybody's name is buckweat bertha and farmer john.joshua did the worst performance ever ever EVER. although this was an ultra-low-budget movie and was dumb....now everyone out there who is going to watch this and can't wait for the credits..your wrong the credits are 50 seconds long...the funniest part was when the mom was getting eaten by the trolls..*-for the movie-**** for the comedy because it was sooooooooooooooo dumb

amazing quotes--do you want some....joshua ahhhhhhhhh!!

oh no nilbog is spelled goblin backwards

review_title: If you like bad, you like Troll 2
review_detailed_main:
Troll 2 offers everything one expects from a movie with its reputation: bad acting, bad dialogue, bad effects and best of all loads of entertainment. Thank you Claudio Fragasso.

Also, I have read a number of reviews touting this movie as the "Holy Grail of Bad Films". While I can't disagree with that, I have to say as a lover of low-budget debacles, many of the greats don't get adequate exposure. In no particular order, I offer a few other treats to fans of this movie. 1) Eyes of the Werewolf 2) Demons at the Door, 3)Necrofiles(*Warning:adult content and very distasteful) and my personal favorite: 4) Ricky-Oh: Story of Ricky. Just giving a little something back to those who have given me so much.

review_title: We Saw More Green Than They Did

review_detailed_main: I will admit that Troll 2 was so insanely great in it's horriblness, but I cannot advocate it as the worst movie ever. I challenge you all, if you can find it, to sit through the move The Stuff without popping a kidney... Check old video stores, anywhere, it's not as must see as Troll 2, but it's worse... much much much worse.

review_title: Oh no! There eating him now there going to eat me!
review_detailed_main: Ahhhhh my eyes are burning and everything hurts why did i watch this?
Passable camera work and costumes, but atrociously bad script and acting. And ah yes, the evil vegetarians. Oof.

After hearing about this film I went to my local cinema to indulge my curiosity. I had heard nothing but bad things, but after five minutes of watching this film I was worried that I may have walked into the wrong screening, because this is possibly one of the best films I have ever seen. In comparison to the film street fighter, this film is something of such greatness, that it could only have been crafted by God or some other omnipotent being. The acting was some of the best work I have seen since The Godfather and the screenplay was scary, witty and brilliantly written.

I have seen the 'conventional' greats like Shawshank redemption and Creep, but no film can stand up to this thing of beauty.

review_title: "Grab the pot and drag me out!"
A family has vacation in a town full of vegetarian goblins.
God himself could not make a movie worse than this....
review_detailed_main: I must say, I never post reviews or go on message boards, but after viewing Troll 2 tonight at 1 am, I feel it is my duty to write a comment. I read numerous posts on the boards preceding my viewing of Troll 2, thinking they might prepare me for what I was about to see. How very wrong I was. You really have to see this movie. I can't even go into the plot because it is so ridiculous and there are plenty of other comments which cover the "plot". I'm a huge fan of "bad" movies and this might just be the worst I've seen. And by worst I mean best. For you see, Troll 2 is playing again in 30 Min's on TMC West as I write this, and I plan on watching it. 4 am on a Thursday and I'm gonna watch it again. Oh God, what are you trying to do, turn me into a homo?
This movie has some weird stuff, some funny stuff, and some downright disturbing stuff. The acting is truly terrible.

review_title: Worth a watch if you want a good laugh
review_detailed_main: I was wondering what all the fuss was about. This movie is okay. The effects are okay. The problem is the way the lines are said, and the reactions, or should I say, over-reactions. Looking at the director's info, I think it doesn't help that he's not a native english speaker. His dialogue might have worked in Italian, but translated to english, it sounds unnatural. And then his expectations of the actors, they're really over-actors for this one. Bizarre moments. Unexpected hilarity. I like the part where the deceased Grandpa says 'I'll distract them with this' holding a fire extinguisher. I'm pretty sure the fact that he was dead and is now alive will be pretty distracting, hahaha. The witch troll lady was a bit much, I found it really hard to watch her scenes, so I fast forwarded whenever she was on there. This movie doesn't surpass The Room for quotable hilarity, but it's still a fun watch.

Troll 2 is rubbish. Unbealiviable. It's so horrible and poorly done you must see it to believe it. There are many reasons why to hate this movie (or better yet, don't see this crap!) 1) It has NOTHING to do with Trolls. Only Goblins, there isn't even any mention of Trolls in this movie. Possibly it was in production of 'Goblins' but it was so awful they couldn't even distribute it with it's own name 2) NOTHING to do with the First Troll, which I found quite amusing. Like I said, there was probably not enough money from "Drake Floyd's" pocket that he couldn't make it unless he made this a crappy sequel 3) AWFUL acting. It's worse than a middle-school play. The acting is so laughable you won't believe it, I saw that most of the actors weren't really actors at all and those that were real actors were uncredited for being A PRODUCTION Assistant FOR THIS CRAP! 4) DREADFULLY Hideous cinematography. It's constantly shaking and it gets SO annoying AND STOOPID, (a word to describe the entire film) 5) It's so gay, literally. The Grandpa's burning in hell and the older sisters' 'boyfriend' has homosexual friends that are into 'group bi-sex' 6) The music is...oh dear, it gives you the worst mood in the worst way Avoid this movie. If it's on TV, watch it only if you're BORED and I mean BORED. Overall it sucks and I can see why John Carl wasn't credited in this film; HE DIDN'T WANT HIS CAREER RUINED

review_title: So bad you've got to watch it
review_detailed_main: This movie is so bad in every aspect of film making. However, its one redeeming feature is that it is so bad that you've got to watch it for a bit of a laugh.

You can worship La Dolce Vita, Citizen Kane, The Seventh Seal and all the great films of the 20th Century, but can they really measure up to this? Troll 2 is the ultimate cinematic experience in it's complete disregard for anything that has gone before. The film pays absolutely no regard for cinematic convention, eschewing the tried and tested structural values of film-making for a pseudo absurdist approach that leaves the viewer disorientated and confused.

It is in this state that one can draw all the cathartic and didactic meaning from this film: one the one hand, that nothing makes sense, so why bother living at all, on the other, wasting your time watching films of this nature will instill a feeling of 'Carpe Diem' and make one live their life to the full. The genius of Troll 2 is that literally every single line of dialogue has infinite meaning and none at all simultaneously. Your sanity, reason for existence and destiny are all questioned when watching this film, merely by assessing your own state while viewing.

But this film is not just brilliant in a metaphorical and symbolic way, the events themselves allow us to question our own frail time on this mortal coil we call life. Take Grampa Seth's transportation through the mirror, a metaphor for the fear of death and it's importance in holding us back from what we want to do. Or Holly's dance sequence, highlighting the frailty of 'woman'. The 'trolls' themselves, goblins who look exactly like us - suggesting that perhaps vegetarian goblins lurk within all our souls. Perhaps the most important moment is the sweetcorn sex scene - the ultimate metaphysical erotic battle between vegetable and human in one scintillating image.

The script of Troll 2 reads not unlike playwrights such as Shakespeare, or the poetry of Milton. It's multifaceted, almost impenetrable mask of mystique is T S Eliot's legacy on film, combined with the homo-erotic subplots associated with the Elisabethans in the form of Eliot and his friends experiences. The camper van itself is a symbol of youth and dubious sexuality, combined with milk based imagery later on we see the microcosmic journey through existence that is at the essence of humanity.

Troll 2, in short, is the sum of our hopes and fears, what is to be human, depicted perfectly on screen. The final scene illustrates this best of all - for what sums up the fragility of existence more than the words, 'Do you want some, Joshua?'

Hmm. I was a big fan of the first Troll movie, which has some nauseously surreal moments of comedy, but this sequel is by far and away the worst movie I have ever seen (and that includes Coyote Ugly.) Acting, direction, special (and I use that word in its broadest possible sense) effects are so abysmal as to leave one with a feeling of having been battered about the head with a baseball bat. True, there are moments that are so bad that I laughed out loud, but this movie left me feeling violated. I would have much preferred that they had not included this on the recent DVD release of Troll/Troll 2.

review_title: "Nilbog! It's 'goblin' spelled backwards! This is their keen-dumb!"
Grandpa Seth's death was very difficult for your father...

review_detailed_main: This movie is beyond bad. It is legendarily bad. I highly recommend watching it after an obsessed friend of mine (who actually owns a t-shirt with a picture of one of the movie's goblins he calls googly eyes, because it has weird eyes) made me watch it drunk. I'm not sure what this movie would be like sober, but I bet it wouldn't be pretty. It might make you doubt life in a way that suicidal thoughts would be induced into your head. I'm going to save you all the wonderful quotes from this movie, which you have probably already read from previous reviews. I'll just tell you this, because I think it truly summarizes how equally terrible and hilarious this movie is: There is actually a scene where you can see one of the tech crew, or someone else who's not supposed to be there running off the scene in the background (I rewound and watched it this part three times with friends because it was too unbelievable for words).

The idea of this film was interesting, but the directing, make-up, and acting look like the producer had a neighborhood halloween party and just filmed it. This movie was terrible!! I can't believe the theaters even allowed distribution! The story seems actually pretty good , but they just filmed this thing so low budget that it looks like a backwoods hick directed it. I think this movie simply suffered from "get another producer!!". John Carl Buechler who directed "Troll" should have been paid "whatever" to come back for this one. Claudio Fragasso needs to stick to writing "which isn't that great either" OR just offer ideas. This movie is so overacted and cheesy my grandpa could have done better.
