I've seen mental patients who presented more believable characters than this film. This looks like kids running around in hallween costumes. Utterly DUMB.

review_title: They scraped this s*** out of the Nil-BOG
Pretty Much the Worst Movie Ever Made
review_detailed_main: I was watching it to see how bad it was because about a million people said it is really bad. So the beginning sucked, the middle sucked, the ending sucked. A combination of the worst movie. Yeah, Nilbog is goblin backwards, who cares? We would have known it was creature-infested anyways. And the acting, did they pay the actors enough? The acting just made it horrible. Everybody was like "oh, there is a monster. lets run away. oh yah, we have no line significance. ahh. we are all going to die, and our scriptwriter didn't do a very good job with the story." Plus, look at the goblins, they have a horrible look, they have brown suits on that you can tell someone is in. So did they spend a lot of time making special effects or anything? The worst movie ever. I can't believe I wasted 1 hr 30 min on this movie. Don't even waste yours.

Having read the postings on "Troll 2," I put it on my Netflix queue figuring it's gonna be bad, but won't be a match for "Plan 9 from Outer Space," my fave piece of golden garbage. I was wrong.

"Troll 2" is not just bad, it's a total embarrassment to everyone involved. It's a fail of such epic proportions I actually wished I had a time machine so I could go back to when this was made and run onto the set swinging a baseball bat yelling, "Stop doing this! Go home!"

Words fail me, but let me just describe one scene. A woman dressed like Elvira shows up at an RV in the woods. The guy inside sees her approaching ... on TV. She's carrying an ear of corn. He steps out of the RV and she starts vamping it up, showing her garter belt, licking her lips, etc. The camera zooms in on her ample cleavage. She tucks the corn into her belt and they go inside. She shoves him down on a sofa and crouches over him, waving the corn. "Aren't you hungry?" she asks. "I like popcorn," he says. She then puts the corn in her mouth and presses it against his mouth and says with a leer, "Then let's ... heat it up!" Immediately, buckets of popcorn are flying around the room.

Everything about this movie screams cheap, stupid and amateur. Not a single line of dialogue rises above idiotic, the characters act by bugging their eyes out and the little trolls or goblins or whatever the hell they are can barely move inside their Teletubby costumes. It's capped with an ending of such jaw-dropping bad taste that you will fall on the floor laughing, especially when you hear the kid's final line and the reply it gets.

Don't miss it.

review_title: A movie so bad you cant put it down
review_detailed_main:
When i first watch this movie I couldn't stop laughing and I proceeded to watch it at least once each year and recommend it to all my friends it is truly the best worst movie of all time. Every Halloween I force a new group of people to enjoy the spectacularly bad movie of Troll 2 sometimes it's family sometimes it's friends sometimes it's random people at a party

but I will never stop recommending this movie and watching it every Halloween until the day I die people Will watch this movie it will spread and it will be amazing for everybody I know.

As a bad movie fanatic this is a must watch and must recommend.

review_title: The most entertainingly bad movie after "The room".
review_detailed_main: When a family unknowingly goes on vacation to a little village inhabited by vegetarian goblins led by a plant loving witch, they will be hunted down by the vicious little creatures so they can be turned into green moss and eaten. When you combine a plot like that with some of the worst acting and dialogue ever put to film, you get a movie sequel that is so bad it's laughable. Furthermore, this ''sequel'' has absolutely no connection to the original movie, which makes it a mystery to figure out the reason why it was even named "Troll 2".

review_title: Absolutely horrible... But not quite good
review_detailed_main: This movie ranks up with the worst movie I've ever seen, but barely crosses over into entertaining none the less. I unfortunately have seen this about 5 times. It never gets better, but some of the over acting is actually enjoyable. I hope I never see this movie again, but I likely will 🤔

I had steered clear from this abomination for so long to only let my guard down and allow the temptation to take hold. I see some people adore it for its sheer badness, but I didn't find it particularly amusing (save for a couple of scenes and dialogues) in that aspect. It bored me, and while technically it was rather standard with some bottom of the barrel choices in wonky make-up FX (no really cheap Halloween masks) and clumsy special effects. I was expecting something more along the lines z-grade trash. Trash it is, especially the material (bonkers plot and terribly inane script) and overbearingly inept performances (leading the way is main the kid with the screwed-up face and the hammy rejected stage-actresses Deborah Reed, and the mother is quite ding-bat too), but for me it wasn't so bad it's funny like it's mentioned it's just tiresomely bad and goes for 91 minutes too long.

Some no all of the plot details are ridiculous, but some more so than others like very needy boys hanging out with pal (who's the boyfriend of Connie Young's character) and the welcoming town's folk with their fascination for food. Green food and drinks and no one bothers to question it.

The thing that was running through my head (other than can see this get any more stupid yes) was this trying to be a comedy (I hope so) or serious horror. Well it's horrifyingly stupid. If I start thinking too much about it, I might have just started sweating out green sludge! What was the deal naming the film 'Troll 2', where it's goblins that appear I guess that's one of life's many mysterious. At least the ending (while tacky) is unexpected.

review_title: What else could go wong in this weally weatched weel? (What else could go wrong in this really wretched reel?)
review_detailed_main: Troll 2 is the story of a group of possibly gay sex-crazed teens, a witch who has trouble saying her R's, her latex goblins, and a little boy who rules his family with an iron fist. As a fan of bad movies, I have got to say, this is the best one I have ever seen. The characters are so bizzare. There's the Dad who can't open his mouth without saying something odd. The short-shorts wearing boyfriends friends (I don't even want to get into that). There's the dead Nazi grandpa. There's also a whole whorde (23) of strange townfolk. It's really to bad this is out of print, it's so bad it's good. It even takes the place of Plan 9. On a scale of -1 to -10, I give Troll 2 a -11.

review_title: A lot of crappiness about this movie made it funny.
review_detailed_main:
OK, so obviously this is a super low budget crappy movie on which, it seems, the makers didn't spend much effort on. The movie is bad in that there are some really bad actors, there are super cheesy lines, and there are continuity and plot problems. The costumes and masks for the monsters are very poorly made and have fixed expressions, the events do not make sense in a 3rd of the movie, and the actors who try to sound scary or menacing look laughable. This is like something made by high school students who got their hands on good equipment and watched a bunch of decent horror movies.

It is very easy to see the bad things about this movie because they are obvious but after having watched this film twice I see how there are actually very unusual good aspects in here. I think this film was purposefully made to appear like its a stupid cartoony kid tale but a horror movie in disguise. There are intentional and un-intentional dark humor jokes and there are some parts which are darn creepy. Also strangely there is a pretty decent soundtrack.

I really can't tell if some of the jokes were intentional or not but seeing a kid who screams because he sees green goo and tree branches coming out of his body is funny and scary. Add to that a person who turns into some sort of green pie full of green paste who is eaten by the monsters. These things are funny. Or how about the creepy lady who comes to the unsuspecting family's house to offer them some cake when she makes a comment about Joshua's sister "appetizing! HAHAHA" and the mom goes "WHAT!?" A lot of that cheese is funny, trust me.

On the horror side the creepy parts somewhat merge with the humor aspect of the movie. As ridiculous as it sounds but seeing someone be transformed into green good and then devoured by ugly monsters is darn creepy even if its a bad movie like Troll 2. The final scary/creepy kick comes in the very end of the movie so its worth watching till the end.

Not all actors are bad in this film. I think the actor who plays the kid is a very good actor , he looked very genuine. The dad and the grandpa were also really good and interesting characters portrayed by decent actors.

To me this is definitely a cult-classic, if you are interested in dark humor, bad movies, or like bad 80s horror movies you definitely must watch Troll 2.

review_title: The Most Beautiful Piece of Film Ever
A terrible movie that is very fun to watch!
review_detailed_main:
A movie that's so gloriously bad, it's become a cult classic. Released in 1990, this film has absolutely nothing to do with trolls, which is hilarious in itself It's all about vegetarian goblins trying to turn people into plants so they can eat them. I know, right? What even is that premise?

The acting is so over-the-top it's like everyone involved was auditioning for a high school play. The dialogue is cringe-worthy and unintentionally funny, making it hard to look away. There's one scene where the characters are just sitting around discussing "how to be a good vegetarian," and it's pure gold. Plus, the goblin costumes are something else, imagine a mix between a rubber Halloween mask and a rejected character from a '90s video game. What's really impressive is how Troll 2 has maintained its charm over the years. It's a perfect pick for a movie night with friends, especially if you love shouting at the screen and laughing at ridiculous plot holes. As a so bad it's good gem, it deserves all the love it's gotten. Just don't expect anything remotely resembling an actual horror film, and you'll have a blast!

review_title: Good Bad at its best , 10 out minus 10
review_detailed_main:
There is almost no point writing a review for this film.

If you're coming into it with the knowledge that this is considered to be the best good bad movie of all time then you will not be disappointed. It really deserves the title. And if you didn't know then there's only one thing....

I can only stress that you should watch this with at least a party of two, and with someone who also gets the nuances of bad casting, acting, directing, script, prosthetics, special effects and everything else necessary to make a movie. You'll want to share, talk, and laugh quite a bit through this film, you'd be mentally challenged if you didn't.

I'll be seeking out the documentary made by the child star Michael Paul Stephenson too.

And I'll be sure to watch again and looking forward to it.

review_title: It is truly the Best Worst Movie, Ever
The Most Entertaining Film Ever Made
review_detailed_main: They can...THEY CAN! Easily the most entertaining (and rewatchable) film ever made, if not quite the best. It's got more quotable lines than any other film I've ever seen, Duck Soup included. An acquired taste, how much you like it will depend on how familiar you are with the stereotypical movies it resembles...barely resembles. Those who haven't seen too many horror movies usually just think it's badly made, with bad acting, bad effects, etc., and completely miss the surrealist heights it hits. Imagine taking your run-of-the-mill late nite cheapo horror flick and stripping it of any logic or pretense of plausibility, cast a bunch of the MOST unprofessional actors you can find, and rewrite the dialogue at the end of a bad acid trip. No wannabe cult hit, it was apparently made with the best intentions, and we all know what the devil does with those! The director's called it "an unpretentious childrens' story," overlooking the obscenely cruel ending, which jars the relatively light-hearted mood of the first 92 minutes of the film. Not to be missed.

I was kind of disappointed. It was better then I was expecting. The production was horrible, and the budget must have been tiny, but they made it work. I honestly think it could be remade into a great movie.

Watching clips of this movie are hilarious, but watching the movie start to finish wasn't that bad.

Got a camcorder and a few friends? Chances are, you could do something better than this. Skip this one and find something to do with an hour and a half of your life that you will never get back otherwise. That is, unless you like watching bad movies and picking on them a la Mystery Science Theater 3000. In that case, there's plenty of fodder for ridicule.

review_title: Will always love it for all the wrong reasons.
review_detailed_main:
As a horror film, it fails in almost every aspect. As an accidental comedy, it works like a charm.

Troll 2 has some of the worst acting ever seen in a film, some of the worst effects, some of the worst dialogue, some of the worst music, some of the worst cinematography...

...but it's still one hell of a fun time for all its flaws.

Here's just a few highlights:

-The iconic "OH MY GOOOOOOODDD" scene. -The corn on the cob seduction scene. -The dinner table urination scene. -The amount of times Grandpa Seth appears as a ghost just to say Joshua, at one point even mistaking Joshua's sister for Joshua himself somehow.

Classic stuff.

review_title: Definitely one of the most stupidly entertaining movies I've ever seen...
review_detailed_main: Now honestly the only reason I've ever even heard of this movie is because I know someone who was in it (for obvious reasons they shall remain anonymous...) so therefore, some friends of mine and I are part of one of the only "cult" following to the movie... Now I've never seen the original Troll movie, but I'm told it has absolutely nothing it all to do with Troll 2. Absolutely horrible acting, terrible costumes, awful script... makes for a definite "Class-A bad film", which is why you should go out and rent this movie when you and a bunch of your friends are together late on a Saturday night with nothing better to do, because I personally guarantee you, you will laugh your heads off...

Finally sat down and watched this movie in anticipation of the upcoming documentary. Horrendous. Appalling. Awful. They need to invent a word to describe this movie. Absolutely nothing works. I agree with everything everyone has said about what makes this such an awful movie. But I was surprised because it really disappointed me. I didn't laugh. Maybe once or twice. I rolled my eyes more than I laughed. I felt so confused and underwhelmed, I was beginning to feel physically ill.

Terrible movie, one of the worst of all time. I can see why others find this to be entertaining because of how bad it is. I respect that. I have a similar relationship with other movies. Just not this one. Terrible.

It is a horrible movie and Connie Young only makes it worse...

...but it's like a train wreck where you can't look away.

I mean, you get stuck to your seat wishing Young had another line so she can shout it like she's talking to someone across the train-station whilst looking directly into the camera.

You can't wait to see the God-awful trolls again, which, honestly, I think were made to look that way because the director just wanted to humiliate midgets.

From start to finish you want to kill everyone involved...

...but you finish it because it falls into the so bad it's entertaining loophole.

But, well, it just hurts to watch it.

review_title: Easily the Best Worst Movie ever made.
review_detailed_main: This movie changed my life. I saw this movie years and years ago, and loved it from the first minute on. I will simply say it: this could be the worst movie ever made. That being said, for every reason that it wins the title of Worst, its the same reason I love it. The acting, the story, the effects...its everything that Hollywood wishes it could manufacture with movies like Snakes on a Plane or any other of the camp horror flicks. Recently there was a screening of the movie in NYC with stars of the film making a rare appearance in the spotlight. I attended (along with a sellout crowd) and can attest that there is something special there and the time is right for this amazingly awful movie to take its place in pop culture history.
There's a lack of trolls, otherwise its amazing. Welcome to Nilbog y'all!

review_title: Troll muthafucin 2 is tha greatest movie evner made.
review_detailed_main:
Troll 2 is the first movie in the GOBLIN franchise and second in the troll franchise.

It's my favourite movie and should be everyone's favourite because of the acting, the greatly written story, the awsome characters like GRANDPA SETH in tha house, and JOSHUA who is my big brother.

The Gore is great and touching.

The cinematography is great and i cry every time i Watch it.

I greatly resonnement this movie to everyone not depending on age. Thank you to the people who made this movie you Are all GOD'S.

'Troll 2' also known as the best worst movie ever is an outrageously odd and fantastically bad fantasy horror film by Italian filmmaker Claudio Fragasso. Ridiculously inept and insanely entertaining in a nonsensical manner. The movie lacks any sort of actual horror or tension and instead transcends into a genre of its own a sort of dark comedy fantasy hybrid filled with awful effects, bad sets, laughably bad acting and terrible dialogue. This has got to be seen to be believed.

The Plot = A family's vacation to the small town of nilbog turns into a nightmare when they realize the town's inhabited by plant eating goblins.

The movie is a mind bogglingly strange experience to say the least with its goofy premise and confusing tone which gives you something unique and unlike anything you've ever experienced and even amongst all that chaos and confusion it manages to be a somewhat enjoyable b-movie experience. The weird nature of the production is what makes it so engrossing and watchable.

The cast performances are not just bad, their surreal ranging from overacting to wooden, everything feels off across the board and yet at the same time oddly fascinating. The standouts include Michael Stephenson as the whiny and insufferable child hero of the flick. George Hardy gives a somewhat serious and stiff performance as the father. Margo Prey gives delightfully strange and delirious performance as the mother. Connie Young gives a very staged and off-kilter performance as the teenage daughter. Robert Ormsby seems to be the only sensible character as the ghostly grandfather (yes, this movie has a ghost in it for some reason). Then finally Deborah Reed goes in the totally opposite direction as the witch with her strange, outlandish, and memorable performance.

Overall 'Troll 2' is a rather oddball flick that goes above and beyond in presenting a mind-blowing experience. But honestly, I can't give this a high rating despite the enjoyment factor.

review_title: What an absolute piece of crap !!!
review_detailed_main: This little, well, "gem" of horror flics absolutely deserves its bottom place here in imdb.com! There is nothing really cool about it: the actors are bad, not in a "trashy" way, but simply bad to the bone. The plot is absolutely boring, there is by no means anything like atmosphere or thrills! It's just plain boring, most parts are only ridicolous, especially the goblins! And be warned: I can get MUCH entertainment out of crappy shit like BLOOD FEAST or LA NOCHE DEL TERROR CIEGO ... but I still dislike this muddy piece of celluloid!!!

review_title: A masterpiece of the "so-bad it's terrible" cinema
review_detailed_main: Why does some people like "trash" movies? Generally, these films have a kind of adorable goofiness that makes them cult objects. Be "Plan 9 from Outer Space" or "The Room", you will find that movies like those are very entertaining despite their numerous flaws. Well, this isn't the case here. "Troll 2" has everything that makes a movie a "trash" exemplar - badly written plot and dialogue, nonsensical motivations, poor acting and bad editing. But if there's one thing that movie is completely devoid of, it is charm. Even when a character seems to be more or less funny, he will make something very distressing - like screaming for an entire fucking minute - and then you will hate him for that. The screenplay is based around pure convenience, there's no buildup or psychological construction (who need that shit, anyway?). Some scenes are cringeworthy, but not in a "funny" manner, just very bad ones, while others doesn't advance the plot in any way - but I think i'm being foolish here, as there's fucking nothing to advance. Well, let's talk about the acting now. Oh, fuck it, there's no acting here, just a bunch of people overreacting or not reacting at all about any stuff. Have you ever seen any mexican telenovela? Did you find the acting on it bad? Here it's worse, that's all you need to know. Not even the soundtrack is worthy a listen. Following what seems to be a trend among some "trash" classics, the songs doesn't have anything to do with the sequences they accompain. The veredict is that you will laugh here and there while watching this piece of crap, but most of the time you will wonder why this shit lasts so much if the duration is only something like 100 painful minutes.

Notorious for only featuring goblins and no actual trolls, 'Troll 2' is not really a sequel to the fun 80s horror comedy starring Noah Hathaway. It does have a surprising amount in common with the first film though as both concern mischievous shape -shifting creatures who enjoy turning humans into plants. Here though, their agenda is far more horrific since they only want to turn humans into plants to eat them since they are vegetarians (!) and yet, 'Troll 2' is never scary, frightening or unsettling in the least. A lot of the blame comes down to the wooden acting, with Connie Young turning in a particularly poor performance with very rehearsed line delivery as the protagonist's older sister. The dialogue in general is bland though and the costumes and makeup for the goblins are cheap-looking. There is admittedly something interesting about the plot regarding being a vegetarian and the possible benefits of eating meat, but this all gets a little mixed up amid such absurdities as the young boy's dead grandfather being able to pause time in order that he can urinate on the food that his family is about to eat (yes, that happens). The mythology at hand is quite hard to nut out too with grandfather coming back in visions, then in real life and then, who knows? More could be said, but in short, it is easy to see why this has become a cult hit among those who like to laugh at its sheer awfulness.

review_title: I'D RATHER HAVE MY DAD BEAT ME THAN WATCH THIS!!!!
review_detailed_main: F THIS MOVIE, I HATE IT, I LEARNED ABOUT IT IN ENGLISH 202 IN COLLEGE. THE SCARY LADY AT THE FRONT OF THE ROOM SAID IT WAS BADDDDDD. WASTE OF AN HOUR AND A HALF I'D RATHER HAVE MY DAD HIT ME THAN TO WATCH THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE AGAIN!!!

What can i say abut this cinematic masterpiece that hasn't been said before? The film is about a town of vegetarian Goblins who hate meat. So what threat are they to humans then? I hear you cry! Why, they turn you into a vegetable before they devour you.....obviously (dont you feel stupid for asking now?) I'd also like to clarify that Troll 2 has nothing whatsoever to do with 'Troll 1' or indeed a troll or collective trolls. It features some of the most memorable scenes ever to be shot on celluloid and that my friends is a fact! How clever they are to call the town that the family are moving to 'Nilbog' and then show a shot of a sign for the town in the cars side mirror, clearly showing the word 'Goblin' This film deserves an Oscar! Also many people are saying that this is the worst film ever made! What utter rubbish, i'd sit through this film a hundred times rather than watch 'Batman & Robin' again for even five minutes. So there! (its clearly the second worst film ever made!)

review_title: Who needs logic when you've got "Magic" or "Goodness"!

review_detailed_main: This movie is so excessively bad that it's almost a comedy. First of all, the movie is called "Troll 2", yet it's about goblins. Next, on the cover of the video release is a kid that isn't in the movie and a monster never seen in the film. The troll/goblin costume is even funny. The costume consists of a burlap sac, a halloween mask, and some gloves you can buy at K Mart. Two scenes make absolutely no sense, one in which time stops and the main character pees on the food so his family won't eat it, and the other when a RV fills up with popcorn for no reason. The scene with the troll/goblin queen is hilarious. Rent one day with friends and start ripping away.

review_title: This movie is flat-out ridiculous!!!! Bring a change of shorts when you watch it
review_detailed_main: This film, if you can call it that, is one of the most entertaining movies I've ever scene. Not because of its complex plot, great cinematography, famous cast, or incredible acting.....for it has none of these attributes. It is a classic film because it has the complete opposite of all these. The plot makes no sense at all and strays from its course continually, the cinematography blows hard and contains numerous errors throughout, the cast.......hahhahaha.....and the the acting....HAHAAHHAHAHHAHHHAHAH............oh..oh...I gotta catch my breath...........AAAAAAAHAHAHAHHAAHAHAAH. Wooooooo!!!! Do yourselves a favor, get some beer and some friends and go rent this movie. You'll all have a hilarious night losing it to this terribly great piece of filth.

review_title: Not as bad as I was lead to believe.
review_detailed_main:
I think the big problem with this film is that it's not the horror movie it's advertised as being. Not that Leprechaun is all that horrifying, but it was intended to scare people. Troll kind of is too, but It feels more like a bad episode of Goosebumps than a full fledged horror film.

Having nothing to do with the original Troll movie, both films seem to tread a thin line between if being Fantasy and Horror, and just doing a really bad job of it.

I also feel like the movie was made at the wrong time. Troll 2 was made to piggy back slasher films when it seems more like a child friendly fantasy vibe.

Overall, I did not feel like I wasted my time watching it, but it's not really all that worth watching.

review_title: Not so much a film as it is an experience

review_detailed_main:
Let me get this straight. Goblins are semi-vegans eating only rotted milk and plants, are horrified by bacon and eggs AND go around eating people?

Does not compute.

Stop Dave.

I can feel it.

I can feel my mind slipping away.

Okay.This is gonna be just another "this movie SUCKS ASS" comment but I just have to write it down otherwise my soul will die.

This is by FAR the worst movie I ever saw in my entire life.I saw many bad movies and terrible movies but this is just something unbelievable.I use to watch movies without any pre-judgements and I give a chance to each movie I watch.In this case it was hard because I've read all this comments here but nevermind.So I watched it.Dear God.I did.

Troll 2 is so bad.So bad that I think people who created it wanted to do such a piece of crap.Plot,acting,music,effects,wannabe spooky moments...everything just everything is bad.No,I think bad is not enough.I don't think there is a word in this universe that can describe what Troll 2 is.

Joshua the main hero is so annoying that I hoped something will happen to him.Something gruesome.The actress of Joshua's mother is beyond terrible but no one is so bad as the main villain Creedence Leonore Gielgud.That character is written and played extremely bad.

I am really sad that someone gave to this movie 10 because I think this is king of bad movies and it should be at 1st place in top 100 bottom.

review_title: So bad, it is really BAD!
review_detailed_main:
No really, it is not even entertaining, and to think it is, you must have something wrong with you. Maybe the ones that say, So bad, it's good, are people in the nutty house. Every time I did try to sit through the movie, the actors make me cringe, not laugh at all. To me comedy does not mean stupid. Comedy to me is actually funny. People have comedy meaning twisted. That is why most comedy movies today are not really funny but more crude, and this is towards the latter in this movie but without the bad words. I have not one good thing to say about this movie at all. I wish I did drink to watch this movie, to take the depression of watching it away. I have to watch a really awesome movie to take this away afterwards.

It is that bad. I am surprised to see even a few rate it high. Only thing classic of this movie is how bad it is. If you even read the trivia of this movie on this site. It says all extras were turned into leads of the movie. That is why all of it really sucks. They couldn't even get good actors for this movie. No matter how many people say this is entertaining or funny must live in a funny farm. Good luck convincing others that this is funny.

The whole feel of this is that of a college project. Some youths going together to do a scary movie for fun. Almost a parody on scary movies. And had it stayed in that college to be viewed at frat parties, it would have been a great movie, and the creators could have been proud. But this should not have been released to the general public. The script is non-descript, but the acting is completely without feeling. It is like the actors are reading their lines from the script, without taking into consideration what is happening around them. The only exception is Deborah Reed, whose acting is borderline comical and I think the borderline comical part of this film is the only entertaining part of it. Any good parts? Well the photography. So do not waster your time on this. Or watch it for the turkey value.

This movie is SOOOOOOOOO BAD. I could take this opportunity to adequately critique this movie, but instead I shall use it to warn you. I don't care that it's only 47th on the list of the worst movies ever. I dare anyone to watch this film all the way through and honestly say it isn't the worst. I've only none one person who has watched it from beginning to end without breaking and he was physically ill afterwords. Crap! I have to fulfill a minimum of ten lines, and I've haven't reached it yet. All I can do is recommend you go out and watch the following films: Luck Number Slevin, Stranger than Fiction, Kung POw: Enter the Fist, Amelie, Casablanca, Alien, American Beauty, and Princess Monoke.

I stumbled onto this movie when watching reviews for "The Room". Some people were saying that The Room was not the worst movie ever made, and that it was Troll 2. Well I can say that even this movie, is still not the worst movie ever made. This is a true popcorn film. This is a movie that you invite your friends and family over to force them to watch it, until they die laughing. Bad acting , bad story and even bad edits can not stop this movie from being truly entertaining. That is what movies are for, to entertain. I can definitely recommend watching this film when you are bored or just doing some house cleaning (what I was doing at the time).

review_title: Literally the greatest movie ever made
review_detailed_main: I cannot explain how perfect this movie is. The acting is brilliant, the directing cannot be beaten, and the cinematography... WOW! You have not lived until you have watched this movie. I was just looking through the Academy Awards history, and it seems to me that this masterful film got snubbed by the so called "academy." As I watched, the performances of each actor in this film drew me in more and more. It has everything, great acting, fast-paced action, thrilling dialogue, and frightening scares. All the people I watched it with were laughing the whole time and I really just do not understand why, I mean, it isn't a comedy. The perfect movie. I would take it over The Godfather and The Shawshank Redmeption put together.

This film is extreamly awesome. It's fun, and people are just randomly giving it 1's on imdb.com so its said to be one of the worst movies ever made. This movie shouldn't even be the bottem 100 films.

I love this movie

The acting- the only let down. Acting was horrible in this movie

Director and writing- what great imagination. The characters were sooo funny and fun. The witch kept reminding me of my grade 6 teacher.

Costumes- children wearing masks and pillows to look like goblins. So funny and so great. I love this and there so cute also.

See this film. If you take this film seriously, then yes it will be bad. But if you take it as being great fun, it will be so much fun. Take a break from super-awesome written-amazing acting-cool wizards-your avarge cool looking goblin movie like lord of the rings (which is some of my fav movies) and watch this for pure fun. :)

Wow so bad. it made me laugh a bunch of times but not enough for this to be an overall enjoyable experience. i now know what is considered by many to be the worst movie of all time. i've seen worse :) (1 viewing)

Troll 2 is one of those films that is truly so awful, that it has to be seen to be believed. I had heard about this movie for years, but never watched it until I caught it on Showtime recently. Basically, this family goes to the town of Nilbog (Goblin, backwards) and are stalked by Trolls who want to eat them. In order to consume humans, the Trolls force people to eat a substance that turns them into a green, slime-like substance that the Trolls can digest. Sounds interesting, right? Well, I'm not entirely sure how a movie this atrocious can get made. The acting is worse than any elementary school play that I have ever seen, the Troll masks are literally rubber Halloween masks from Wal-Mart, and the dialog is so corny that Orville Reddenbacher would be proud. It's a good movie to have a drinking game with (everytime someone says I wish Grandpa Seth were here, drink. Every time someone looks directly into the camera, chug). Seriously, you have to watch this at least once to see just how bad it is. This movie gets a definite 1/10.

I can't believe the world has conceived such an abomination. I can't understand how no one in the production realized this was a terrible idea. I don't know what to say about this hideous thing. It's so terrible that I got sick just looking at it. Don't see it. I do not recommend this movie to anyone.

review_title: I wish they would have ate m
review_detailed_main: Having one of the most iconic bad acting scenes in cinema history couldnt help this turd. I was really hoping watching this for the first time it had more to offer. The acting is horrible as to be expected which I enjoyed. But as far being a great funny b movie it fell flat. By the end I was checking how much time was left and sighing. Yes this is one of the worst movies ever made but not enjoyably bad. Word of advice just watch the iconic scene on youtube but leave the rest for the trolls. Not good bad by any means.

review_title: The worst movie I've ever seen in my life...and I loved it!
review_detailed_main:
I got this on DVD as a Birthday present for my sister as we'd heard of one of the worst movies ever made and since we have a habit of enjoying our time making fun of the movies we watch (even if they're good), we figured this would guarantee us a real good time...and holy freakiolies, did we ever enjoy making fun of this one.

There is so much bad acting, terrible directing, even worse writing and unnecessary randomness that taking this movie seriously is completely out of the question. I can't really say much of the plot 'cause there doesn't seem to be one except for a family going to a creepy half- abandoned country village filled with creepy hillbillies who eat people who turn into green goop after eating their food. The rest is just a bunch of random hilarity and a subplot in which the dumb blonde teenaged daughter is completely clueless over the fact that her boyfriend is stuck in the closet...or is that intentional?

Not important. Anyway, the movie is awful and I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for something to actually enjoy unless you're a fan of the robots of Mystery Science Theatre 3000 and enjoy making fun of bad movies as much as they do.

review_title: Awful to watch, but that's what makes it good
Joe D'Amato and Claudio Fragasso give us one of the best movies ever made!!
review_detailed_main:
What can I say about Troll II that has not already been said. All my fellow Nilbogians on here who also have a great love for this movie understand. Its just the average "Scream and I Know What You Did Last Summer" junkies who hate this masterpiece. From Italian masters Joe D'Amato [Buio Omega, Anthropophagous] and Claudio Fragasso [Hell of the Living Dead, Rats, Zombie 3] comes a movie that is so bad in terms of acting, FX, and everything else you can possibly imagine, that is is GOOD! Troll II is a classic! From Grampa Seth telling little Joshua the story of Peter, all the way to the edge of your seat finale with Joshua and his poor mommy, this movie ROCKS! Being a die-hard fan of Italian gore [Fulci, Lenzi, Soavi, D'Amato, etc..] I had to check out this flick. I heard so much bad stuff about it, and i wanted to find out myself how bad it was. I finally managed to find a copy [actually I own 3 VHS copies now] and watched it in awe. Horrible Acting, K-Mart FX, Green food, Cheesy dialog, Banjo Music [UGH!]. I was hooked! They need to bring this bad boy out in the US on DVD. I will buy it! Where else can you hear lines like "They are eating her, and then they are going to eat me, OH MY GOD!!!" CLASSIC!

If you like cheesy movies, then this movie is one of the best. You cant help but being hooked to this movie. Does it suck? Yes. But in the best ways possible! Troll II is a classic!

Troll 2 has been called many things but a good movie is not one of them. It's widely considered one of the best "so bad it's good" movies out there. And this is for good reason. It's terrible in every single possible way you can imagine. The acting in terrible. The costumes for the creatures are terrible. The special effects are terrible. And the dialogue is terrible. But out of this piece of putrid garbage grows a beautiful flower that must be seen to be believed.

The story itself has a rather strange pedigree as well. As it's named and distributed as the sequel to a low budget Italian - American movie called "Troll". That too is a bad movie but it has one thing that this movie doesn't, and that's a troll. Yes you heard it here, Troll 2, a movie marketed as the sequel to a movie about a troll has exactly zero trolls in it. Instead we have goblins. Or at least that's what they're supposed to be. They're nothing more than little people in cheap novelty masks and burlap sacks.

All of that could be forgiven if it wasn't for the godawful acting and dialogue. This was written by an Italian man with no grasp of English syntax. As such when the actors told him that these lines don't actually work and maybe they should change them to something a little more correct, he refused and said the lines must be delivered exactly as written. Years later the director, who still claims this is an unfairly criticized masterpiece, has said this isn't true even if everybody involved in the production says it is.

And then there's the acting. This ranges from just pain old bad underacting, to bad normal acting, to bad overacting to chewing the damn scenery and giving an over the top performance that is so full of ham I'm surprised the actress didn't turn into a pig. I'm not kidding. The actress playing the witch gives such a crazy performance it is worth the price of the DVD just to see it. And of course everybody's favorite line from the guy who realizes his fate.

The plot of the movie is that you have a family of four, or five if you want to count the ghost of the Grandfather and yes he has a major role in this, to dio a house swap with a family from a small farming community. I've never heard of this. You swap homes with another family, live in their home and do their job I guess and they do yours? After all they're going to a farm so I would imagine there's chores and stuff to be done. But anyway this is in the town of Nilbog. The smart ones will immediately see the twist that Nilbog is goblin spelled backwards. Except for the young boy, who's the only one who can see his dead Grandfather, nobody else in the family realizes this. Well the goblins lure people to their village using this method to eat them. But they're not meat eaters. They're vegans. So how do they eat people? By having these people eat their Nilbog food which turns them into green plant mush which the goblins then eat. Yeah, that is seriously the plot and the twist. A twist so lame that even M Night Shyamalan would call it lame.

There is seriously nothing good about this movie. But it's so entertainingly inept and wrong in every sense of the word that it becomes that holy grail of Grade-Z movies that are "so bad it's good". So if you can get past the bad... everything in this give it a watch. You'll thank yourself later.

review_title: Superb, Edge of the seat terror!
review_detailed_main:
Troll 2 is just an aMEZIN film.

I love how the guy who plays the dad acts in this film, it's up there with De Niro in Raging Bull, he clearly thought this was his big break, and for me, it was. The Mother is just Genius. how she says "JOSHWA" and Not Joshua, that's putting your own personal stamp on a character right there. The boy, Joshua, is just brilliant, every scene he is in he steals, and i am certain that the trailers for "THERE WILL BE BLOOD" that say "CITIZEN KANE SURPASSED" were stolen from the trailer for this movie for Joshua's performance. (Although, clearly the guy who gets turned into a plant spent months getting his part perfect, i mean the delivery of the line "OH MY GOD, THEY'RE EATING HER, AND THEN THEY'RE GONNA EAT ME!" just shows that this guy has the ability to get such raw emotion through the screen and into your heart. the terror i experienced on his behalf makes the exorcist look like an episode of the muppets.

however, the best part, and the element of the movie that still, 18years on remains unsurpassed for me, is the Goblin masks. i think that the Jim Henson workshop have been embarrassed by this little film, who, with an Italian director who can't speak English, and hardly any budget, have managed to make goblins that have defined what one should look like. specifically i mean the one that the sister turns into when they are in the car. clearly the muppets stole the idea of "BEAKER" from this goblin.

Jim Henson needs to take a long look at himself as i believe he has been truly outdone here by master craftsmen.

the icing on the cake is Grandpaw Seth, whose every line reduced me to tears.

i scoff now at the Oscars, which seems to be all political.

Lets look at who won the Best Picture award in 1990..."DRIVING MISS DAISY" Troll 2 not even nominated.

Best Actor? Michael Stephenson for "JOSHWA"?? no. Daniel Day Lewis for "MY LEFT FOOT"

Best Director? Claudio Fragasso?? No, Oliver Stone.

Its all a conspiracy!! why was this film overlooked?
I've never seen such art, such is Oscar worthy acting. I am swooped up in emotions that are unspeakable. This movie touched my soul.

I give this movie a 9 out of ten not because the plot was filled with twists, turns, subtlety and delicate brilliance, or because the acting made me escape from the real world, or because the special effects are breathtaking. The actors had to have been volunteers, the plot was more predictable than a bowel movement (and as fragrant) and the special effects were special ed. This movie is the worst movie ever made, but it is hilarious. It's not supposed to be in theory seeing as its a horror/fairy tale/kid flick, but who knows. For the $20 the producer spent on production (the rest of the budget either does not exist or was spent on cocaine) maybe he wanted to make a cheesy, corner, funny turd movie. I was entertained for the entire movie. The teenage girl in it is wicked hot, and the druid (or whoever she is) is hot when she turns into her young druid Celtic powerful mode. And the corn scene is my favorite scene in all movies ever. This is a must see movie.

i watched this with my friends and..wow.. it hurt my skull to register some of the dialog and vision's that unfolded throughout this film. In a way its genius...in another... its too hard to even think what wen through the writers mind and also, why some one would even produce this horribly made movie. in the end, watch it if u can find it. I just bought it and i KNOW ill be remembering every line ,just like Caddyshack or something. Its very memorable. IF you have seen this movie u very well know what i'm talking about.

!!!!!!!!!!!SPOILER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

ITS FUCccKING STUPIDLY GOOD!

If you enjoy watching terrible movies, then look no further. I used to watch Mystery Science Theater 3000 with my dad as a teen, and Troll 2 was worse than any of those movies.

You definitely need to give this movie your full attention while watching,so you are able to appreciate all of it's fine elements: the terrible costumes, poor acting, incredible background music, just to name a few.

My husband and I were laughing the whole way through. So order some pizza, get some beer, and invite some friends over to watch with you. A guaranteed good time.

And I will never be able to eat an ear of corn ever again without laughing and thinking of this movie.

I can't believe I just sat through this film. Worst directing I have seen in a long time, maybe even ever. this film deserves a -1. How in the world are films like these ever distributed. What is wrong with Hollywood? the plot was god awful and the acting was comedic. I can't believe someone paid to have this film made. What about the Costumes? W W.T.F is wrong with these guys. this was a MGM release? HUH? Now I have no other solution than to run to the hardware store, buy the sharpest tolls that they carry and immediately proceed to poke out my eyes in hopes of never having to watch it again. somebody please help me, I'm BLIND, I'm NLIND, I'm BLIND.

review_title: Really is the Best Worst Movie
review_detailed_main: This movie is terrible in nearly every respect, but honestly I have seen MUCH worse than this. It truly is the the best worst movie, as suggested by the recent documentary about the people involved in the making of this movie and where they are now. Come on folks, one star this movie and get it back down to the bottom of the list again! And if you do watch it, watch the documentary first. It puts it all in perspective and makes the whole thing so much more enjoyable. Wow it says I need ten lines of text! I'm not sure that this movies needs that much of a review, so I'm just going to keep typing until I fill out ten lines. Oh there! Done!

review_title: the nature is rebelled, this is the message of the film?

review_detailed_main:
I don't know if this has ever been on Mystery Science Theater 3000 but it should. Actually, it might be too stupid. This is one of the worst movies in history, which might be a good reason to go see it. Watch it alone and it's depressing and a waste of time. Watch it with FRIENDS and it's funny. I'm sure there's a drinking game in this movie somewhere. I know everyone has said this, but why does a movie called "Troll" feature goblins? The actors are so bad it's funny. You don't feel empathy for any character because they're so idiotic and unbelievable. I love the way problems are solved in this movie too...like the way the kid gets his family to not eat the evil goblin food.

You just have to see it to believe it.

Well sort of - to be fair, this has become a ... I don't even know how to put it. "Best Worst movie"? At least that is what a documentary claims about this. And if you watch it with a couple of friends you will have a great time. Not what the filmmakers intended (if they had, they'd be wicked geniuses), but nonetheless fun and craziness.

Having said that, hearing from members of the crew and cast involved makes you realize, that actual human beings were involved in the making of this. Most of them aware how bad this is. Which may have lead to a large fan base for this. Have you seen the movie "The Room" and subsequently the movie "Disaster Artist"? I reckon something similar is the case here. I would even argue that The roon is a touch worse than this, if you'd compare them.

I will be watching the best worst movie documentary too at some point (with quarantine going on, sooner rather than later) and I'm pretty sure I'll enjoy it - I already have some favorite parts of this ... well "favorite"

review_title: It's so badly made it's legendary!
review_detailed_main: I managed to buy this DVD for £4 in England knowing it was going to be bad. The thing is that it's so badly made and the acting is appalling that it becomes hilarious. I desperately wanted to turn the film off but every few seconds there was something even more stupid to laugh at. Dont go near Troll 2 if you want a decent film to watch! However, if you feel brave enough, watch this film (only once) and prepared to be shocked. Troll 2 stands on my DVD shelf shunned by it's DVD brethren.

I was so confused by the disjointedness of this "film" that I had to look at the description to see if the one part I remembered was actually part of this film, which I had the unfortunate displeasure of viewing on cable. I had to drink large quantities of alcohol to sit through this, although I laughed at the goo girl. This has to be one of the worst movies of all time. I mean, it's worse than Phat Girlz. It's worse than from Justin to Kelly. I hate those movies, but at least they didn't look bad, cinematically speaking. But this...I mean, it was released? Did patrons actually pay to see it in theaters? Is this when people started to bring guns to movies and shoot at the screen? If so, I certainly understand why. Skip it. Even if it's free. Trust me, you'll be pist about the time you spent watching it. And it'll give you a killer headache as you try to figure out why this exists, and where these talentless people find a budget and a studio to release their garbage.

Gosh dang it troll 2! You're a terrible movie but I'm so entertained from the outrageously funny scenes. If you like terrible movies that keep you entertained like The Room, then watch this. I'm having a hard time on thinking which is the better terrible movie that is so bad that it's fun to watch. Please watch it and suffer/have fun like I did.

"TROLL 2" (1990, Fragasso) amounts to nothing at all. I hate this film for two reasons: 1) I saw it, 2) it was 'on trend' to wax about it when I was at college (which just bewildered me).

So many people have nothing further to say than some films "are so bad they're good". I hate that phrase and it's often used to describe this film. Sorry, it's rubbish, there's nothing good about it.

this is a movie that goes over everyone's head. its a actually a deep film with a subtext about suburban families consumerism destroying them and transforming them into hideous goblins.

i think its bad rap stems from the facts that its a sequel. and sequels are alw2ays compared to their origins.

However, if you get over the hump of popular opinions, you may discover that this film is classic horror at its finest. Never before have film makers captured so realistically the plights of a young man and the effects modern corporations and their agendas to control the masses. The sheer terror they create by hiding this all under the facade of a cheesy B-movie makes this a brilliant piece of cinema art.

I can't recommend this film enough to Horror connoisseurs.

review_title: The WORST movie I've seen to date!

review_detailed_main: I was recently diagnosed with AIDS. I was depressed, scared and lonely, then a friend turned me on to the homeopathic remedy known as "Troll 2". You simply watch this film one time, and it is such a wonderful film that the AIDS just goes right away! "Troll 2" is the best movie ever made, if you don't believe me you need to see it. If you see it and still don't agree you might be insane! But its OK because this movie also cures insanity. This movie is better than Jesus, in fact "Troll 2" is God. Yes, you heard me right, "Troll 2" is God. Pray to the film, pray to "Troll 2" and you will live a long and eventful existence.

Classic drive-in junk, TROLL @ has a family vacationing in a rural town called Nilbog -- "Goblin" spelled backwards. There they run into a bunch of forest goblins who eat people. This is the kind of movie you try not to watch while it's running, for fear your hair and teeth may fall out. It was an Italian flick shot in Utah with an English-speaking cast. And it looks it. Watch for the pretty blonde about halfway in who falls prey to the goblins. She's worth the wait. This is not a sequel to TROLL, by the way, regardless of the title. It was called GOBLINS everywhere but here. The family in peril is annoying as hell, although the teenaged daughter is curvy and reasonably cute in a 1990s way. Avoid at all costs!

The actors repeatedly stared at the cameras, and were terrible. Of course it works only because it is obvious that cast and crew were all deadly serious about this bucket of spew.

From script writer, to costumes, to actors, obviously the director and of course who ever green lighted this for release, all have displayed judgment clearly below that of any fairly normal 12 year old child.

review_title: Have you seen the movie that sucked? this was it.
review_detailed_main: This movie defies description, and all reasonable forms of logic. I can't imagine anything anything worse than this ever. Please spare your life. Don't waste it like I did and watch this movie. Seriously. It's a movie about Goblin town, and a family that goes on vacation on there. Seriously. It's awful.

review_title: Never Go To A Town Called Nilbog, It Obviously Means Goblin!

review_detailed_main: If your looking for a film that is so terribly made, so god-awful when it's trying to be serious that it makes you laugh until you cry and your stomach hurts, then look no further! This film puts a new low on low budget. I really wanted to give it zero stars, but IMDb.com requires at least one and I had to give it at least one for making me laugh the hardest i've laughed in a good long while. Now to get the story; the acting and film editing flaws are so bad they stand out like "Where's Waldo" on an empty beach. The "trolls" in it are actually goblins, (and they say this in the movie). The costumes on the dwarfs/children who play the goblins are basically brown sheets and rubber masks put over them. The acting speaks for itself and is one of the main reasons why it's so terrible/hilarious. The story line drifts away like a child with a.d.d. What we have here folks is a film that tried to be scary and ended up failing so miserably that I can't even begin to describe it's epic fail. Was there even a post-production in the making of this movie?

Troll 2 is an excellent film if you don't take it seriously from the start to finnish! I only hope that the director had that in mind when making it and not genuinly tried to make a scary horror film. the hero is a little boy who gets help off his dead grandfather in how to stop the "goblins" yes Troll isn't used once in this film entitled "Troll 2" If the people eat the troll food they turn into vegetables because the trolls are vegitarians agghhh!!!! The funniest bit has to be when the boy stops his family from eating the troll food by urinating on the food (don't ask me why?). Even the most faint hearted would not get scared of this film that calls itself a "horror". it does however make a really good comedy though so buy it, It's a cult classic!!!

review_title: Bad? Yes. But I have seen worse so not a 1......
review_detailed_main:
This movie IS bad, but it can't compare to the sheer lameness of Hobgoblins which it is currently tied with.

Plot: Stupid family goes to a town named "Nilbog" while the son tells them not to go since his dead grandpa told him it was an evil place.

I am sure you can figure out the rest, the fact that this movie has no trolls makes it even worse.

2 out of 10.

I bought a second hand copy of this because I liked Troll. I have never been able to watch it all the way through. You might enjoy it if you're a masochist, but even masochists get bored. Talk about lack of budget? The troll costumes in this look like they were made for a school play, in a third world country, by parents that weren't really interested.

I watched this about 10 years ago, and remember it being terrible. Unlike Troll 1, there were no trolls in this movie. Instead, the plot features a family going on vacation in the town of Nilbog. The little boy discovers by looking in a mirror that Nilbog is goblin spelled backwards! Some weird fairy or something helps him out or something and freezes time just before everyone is about to eat. I think the food was supposed to be magical or something. Anyway, the kid urinates all over the food on the table to stop them. I think that was the point that everyone watching decided it was time to go to sleep.

Cheesy movies can be fun, but Troll 2 is distilled pain. You will be scarred for life!

Goblins (not Troll 2) is an extremely poor, yet extremely entertaining film! I found myself chuckling away throughout most of it, and my friends seemed to thoroughly enjoy this rather terrible film too.

The characters are sort of there actually, and there is some development to them. But the story is so ludicrous and the costumes hilarious along with bad cinematography it can never be taken as a serious horror film.

1/10: As a film it's shocking, one of the worst ever. However, if you just want a laugh I would absolutely recommend this
Over rated as the worst movie of all time, it's bad. But there are worse.

review_title: Best worst movie because of the background story
review_detailed_main:
Worst movie I have ever seen, but once I learned the background story, I just had to go back and watch it again! The story makes it so much more fun to watch!

The Italian Director and his wife wanted to make a "serious" movie about the perils of vegetarianism because they were outraged that some of their friends had become vegetarians.

Filmed in Utah, the crew speaks only broken English at best, the only one who speaks English is Laura Gemser, a former porn star, who was tasked with extremely low budget costume design. So, the dialogue was translated from Italian into broken English and the cast, mostly Mormons who had never acted, were commanded to say their lines as written, even though they offered to correct the English.

This info is all over the Internet and on Wikipedia.

Believe me when I tell you that you have not lived until you see TROLL 2, a sequel in name only to that 1980s bizarro flick, TROLL. A family moves to the tiny town of Nilbo, only to be besieged by forest goblins who want them dead. Itis up to the young son and his dead grandpa to save the day. Shile the film is called TROLL 2, there's nary a troll in sight. The film's original title, GOBLINBS, is more like it. And check out the name of the town spelled backwards for further proof. A really bad movie. For those who were captivated by the low-budget Euro horror comedy, TROLL, a remake is coming in 2010 from the director of the original.

Seeing this movie left a truly remarkable impact on my life. The wonderful acting and realistic special effects almost made me believe that this movie was real, and left me thinking about how this could actually happen and pondering about how this truly might have occurred back then. By the end of the movie, there were tears in my eyes and I had sweat all of my clothes off. I couldn't believe that such a masterpiece could possibly be a work of mankind. Surely something as ethereal as this could only be created by a higher being, with more intellect than any human could only hope to dream of. Troll 2 is most definitely a work of art and nothing can quite compare to this holy masterpiece.

review_title: This is diabolical, but you'll love every minute.
review_detailed_main:
Wow. Where do I start with this film? The acting, the costumes, the dialogue, the camera work, the cast itself? It's all really, really dire. But here's the thing - it is so bad it's possibly the funniest film I've ever seen. The plot of the film is very weak. I've never seen Troll so I can't compare the two, but I'll be pretty sure it won't involve people turning into a cabbage.

Another thing to love about this film is the acting throughout. At school we put on a better acted performance. That was in the Nativity play when I was four. At least at that age we didn't know we were bad actors (I was one of the Three Wise Men, which is a vaguely ironic role for a four year old boy). These guys have no excuses. The daughter makes out that she's reading from cue cards all the time.

The best thing about the film is the costumes of the goblins themselves. Oh yeah, by the way, it's about goblins not trolls. Not one troll in the movie. If ever there was a case of false advertising, this'd be it. Not that I was particularly craving some troll action. Anyway, back to the costumes. Most of the goblins looks the same - paper bag skin and joke shop mask accessories but there is one which doesn't look like the rest and is possibly an extra from the Muppet Show. Just so you know which one I'm on about, it appears in the car on the journey to Nilbog.

Just to give you an idea of how bad this film is, here's a line from the father of the family: "I'm tightening my belt one loop so I don't feel hunger pains and your mother and sister will have to do the same." What? If I ever feel the nauseous pain of starvation, I'll remember to wear a belt.

The really surreal thing is that this film got an '18' rating over here in the UK. If I'm being honest, there's nothing particularly shocking or gory in this film. The special effects are so abysmal that you'd have to be really gullible to be lulled into thinking this is at all real. I think the age rating here actually suggests the combined I.Q. of the cast, crew and anyone else involved in making this film.

Seriously though, see this film. It's a must watch. I'm rating it not on how much I like it, but on how it ranks in film quality.

A child's imaginary (or is he?) friend is the ghost of his grandpa who warns him of the evils to come. When he tells his family they just tell him he needs to get over Grandpa's death and move on. But Grandpa's right on all counts, and all the ridiculousness he predicted unfolds in this cheap, trite, tired "Invasion of..." in this case "trolls", looking mostly paralyzed in grotesque reject costumes a Hallowe'en store sent back en masse and the producers got for pennies on the dollar.

Absolutely nothing to recommend.

This film is one of the strangest I've seen. Although clearly intended as a horror film, Troll 2 has retrospectively become a comedy due to its noticeably flaws. There are many causes of low quality in filmmaking, and failures in concepts, direction, acting, dialogue, and visual effects can each destroy a film. Troll 2 somehow seems to fail in every area of filmmaking. Firstly, the underlying plot line of vegetarian goblins luring tourists into a random agrarian community and then transforming them into plants for consumption is completely ludicrous. Secondly, the Italian production crew appears to have been morbidly inept; according to the cast, the director spoke little English, and yet refused to allow the actors to correct the glaring grammatical errors and oddly-worded phrases in the script. Thirdly, the majority of the actors in the film were inexperienced locals who had expected to be hired as extras, and the lack of talent is apparent on screen. In fact, the producers unhesitatingly cast a man who had escaped from a mental institution with a large drug cache. Finally, the visual effects are extremely sub-par, with the goblins portrayed as humans in laughably unrealistic rubber masks. As with other "so-bad-it's-good films" such as Tommy Wiseau's notorious 2003 film The Room, this movie is so irredeemably problematic that it is almost entertaining to watch.

this is the best, worst movie i have ever seen! with the amazing costumes on top of the extremely experienced and talented actors... this movie is irresistible! I just love how none of these actors have done no other movies!!! this is so amazingly bad it is not een funny. it is hypnotizing! i am so obsessed with this movie.. i have spread it on to other people. sorry that this little review has been so pointless....if you are looking for a good laugh than you should definitely see this movie.. it is enjoyable due to its terribleness! You just can't plan for this kind of humor! So yah. I hope you can see this if you haven't already! you will mopst definitely love it!

You just know when a family suddenly go away to town called Nilbog you're in for a treat. You also know when they're invited to eat some GREEN food and accept, you're dealing with cast members with the intelligence of Dumb & Dumber. This is great because you never know what's going to happen next.

Ed Wood would be proud.

Rating

1/10

review_title: (SPOILER ALERT!MASSIVE TROLLZ) A family vacations to a small town to get some quality family time only to be fighting for their lives from so homicidal vegetarian trolls.

review_detailed_main:
I recently watched this movie for the first time after reading on the internet that it's supposed to be the worst movie ever made. But I found it to be highly entertaining and enjoyable. It's an odd movie. Sure, it has its defects but that is part of its charm.

After seeing a movie that I like I usually do some research on it. I discovered that the director is an Italian. Claudio Fragasso, no less. Even before learning that though it struck me as an Italian film. It has an offbeat quality that seems more typical of European movies. It gives you that feeling that any absurd thing could happen from one scene to the next.

If you measure a film by how technically proficient it is then this might be the worst movie ever made. But if you measure a movie by how entertaining it is and how it makes you feel, then it's not that bad. I recommend it to anyone that likes offbeat movies.

review_title: Quite possibly the funniest movie ever
review_detailed_main: troll 2 was probably the funniest movie i have ever seen in my life. In order to fully enjoy this movie, you have to watch it as being an awfully horrible film but HILARIOUS! There was extremely bad acting and it is obvious that it was made on a very low budget which makes everything 5 times better. You can tell that the goblins ( hence the name troll 2) have cut outs in their masks for eyes. And the actors seem to overact or have the same expression on their faces. Troll 2 should definitely not be taken seriously. I thoroughly enjoyed how awful everything was portrayed and I totally recommend you watch Troll 2, just for the laughs.

review_title: Hilariously terrible trash; the Holy Grail of bad movies!
review_detailed_main: That this is without a doubt one of the worst films ever made is without question. However, TROLL 2 is also one of the funniest grade Z stink-fests ever made! The acting is one step BELOW your average high school play, the costumes, effects and script are laughable, and you can actually FEEL your IQ points slipping away with each passing second this brain-damaged atrocity grinds away in your VCR. I can't believe Columbia/TriStar paid money for this badly dubbed Italian atrocity, let alone dared to release it! It is interesting to note that the TROLLS in this film are identical to the TROLL weaponsmith in QUEST FOR THE MIGHTY SWORD, another Italian quickie that is also a parody/sequel to Joe D'Amato's mind-numbing ATOR series. At any rate, TROLL 2 is the Holy Grail of bad movies. Bravo!

review_title: The greatest movie I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing
a great movie even if the acting was bad
review_detailed_main: yes, awful acting. strange plot(but isnt strange unique?). people hated this movie. this flick was great. its very entertaining plus very funny w/ its bad effects. watch this movie and if you dont get some laughs outa it or at least some entertaingment, then let me know cause i dont know anyone who hasnt. people think the plot is dumb but its really creative if you think about it....who else would come up w/ something so bizarre like this? this one goes on the top 10 list. things to look for in it: mullets, cheesy lines, the MOST HARDCORE MUSIC EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!, plus some pretty funky lightening bolts. definately watchable....heck i've watched it more times than i can count.
