The acting is absolutely superb and the costuming rocks. This is definately a movie you want to watch with family and friends, even young children will love it. Creedence is the ultimate bad woman who seduces he victims (at times it got so hot that the kernels on the cob of corn pop into popcorn). Who hasn't had nightmares about those vegetarian man-eating trolls. This is the best movie ever!!!

review_title: Be honest, this is more entertaining than 3 hour Holly drama films
review_detailed_main:
A great movie, truly worth watching. Movies are supposed to entertain you, and this movie does that too well. You will laugh until you cry, and laugh some more.

Honestly, I would rather watch this movie and have a good time laughing than sit through a boring Hollywood drama movie that is supposed to be dark and deep (such as the movie Network, and The Conversation, movies I had to watch as part of college film class). This is not great filmmaking at all, but this movie really delivers on the entertainment value. This is really a funny movie, and will be remembered forever. Plus the writing is amazing, you will quote things in this movie for years to come.

10/10

review_title: Deborah Reed Is Unforgettable in Stunning Performance
review_detailed_main: Ten stars for Ms. Deborah Reed, who give the performance of a lifetime in this odd little horror film. Her work in this movie incorporates a subtle blend of horror, humor, pathos, and a burning sensuality. Some of her scenes are unforgettable but the popcorn scene certainly stands out as a profound expression of her talent and beauty. She brings depth and meaning to her character and sets the screen on fire whenever she appears. While Troll 2 is an unusually bad film, there is a very important reason that this is a motion picture not to be missed. That reason is Ms. Deborah Reed.

review_title: A true masterpiece of fantasy filmmaking
review_detailed_main: The moment I discovered Troll 2 I didn't really know what to expect but from the moment the video went on to the end credits I was enthralled by its amazing sense of invention.This was hardly your run of the mill bad horror film it was far better, it oozed greatness from its slimy Troll interior.I highly recommend it for a tongue in cheek rollercoaster ride of a movie.Troll 2 rent it, NOW!

You will laugh your ass off the entire runtime of this nonsensical journey. Cinema perfection pitch perfect acting all around beautiful score and cinematography. All aspects of this film are incompetent or just embarrassing I don't know how you screw up this badly with a movie.

review_title: The worst movie ever. therefore the best,
review_detailed_main:
YOU CANT P*SS ON HOSPITALITY BOY! this movie is for people who love so bad its good movies, brilliant s**t gold like the classic plan 9. this movie much like plan 9, becomes brilliant by failing on every level. fx, acting, script, directing, score. but the failure brings the most amazing and wonderful comedic lines ever. the best point of it is, everyone was actually trying. it is so sad to see such hacks think they are being so serious, but its also funny as hell. watch this movie with your friends or family, kidnap your neighbors and force them to watch it, either way you will get a kick out of it.

-10 / 10

this is comic gold.....

This movie is the definition of cheese. Thankfully it's the good kind. The movie delivers with the laughs. If your looking for a good time, look no further. Troll 2 is one of those movies, that goes beyond the normal kind of bad and becomes something watchable. I first saw this when I was a kid. I didn't think it was terrible back then. I thought it was a perfect good flick. Of course, I was just kid. My mind wasn't developed enough to know what a truly good/bad flick was. Now I know. This movie very much deserves it's reputation. How many cheesy flicks have their own documentary ? Not many , that's for sure. Like Rocky Horror , Troll 2 is more than just a movie, it's an experience. I've never been to one myself, but they seem like a lot of fun. To sum it all up, give troll 2 a chance, you won't regret it. There are worse movies out there, but they're the bad kind of bad, where as Troll 2 is the good kind of bad. Check it out.

review_title: The funniest peice of media to ever be produced
review_detailed_main: This move bad on every level but it's the funniest "move" I half ever watched and has the funniest sene in cinimatic history I wold highly recommend it to everyone
It is simply a masterpiece. If you have any humor in your soul there's no way you should not think this movie is the best thing to ever happen to film.

Me and my husband watch it EVERY NIGHT. The acting is superb, raw emotion will tug at your heart strings. The plot is extremely diverse and in depth, none will ever be able to top the excellency of this great film. The anticipation between the two films had me biting my nails for years. I swear Grandfather was real, was he actually a ghost? I just don't get it! I thought ghosts were transparent! The goblins all looked just as I would imagine them to be, I was scared to get my paper because I though my dwarf neighbor would attack me and the green goo emerge from my head. I am never turning down a meal again, as they say, "You can't p*** on hospitality!!" I will never view movies as I did before I ventured down the road of the Troll series.. I salute anyone involved in this movie. I am currently wiping tears off of my keyboard as I write this review. (That is a Weird Al cover of Teardrops On my Guitar)

review_title: Very bad, yet fun to watch
review_detailed_main:
This movie is a weird one. From a production point of view, it is extremely bad: the actors are bad, the costumes are ridiculous, the music is not that bad, but it doesn't quite fit the scenes, the "special effects" are even worse (when Grandpa Seth throws lightning at the priest, the scene cuts, you see a picture of a thunder strike with a terrible thunderstorm sound in the background, then you see the priest on fire, seriously?), etc.

As for the story, it is another dimension. The rules keep changing, but I think it is what made this movie fun to watch, combined with the other elements mentioned, it makes an extremely bad movie. I am still giving this a 5 out of 10 because it gave me a great laugh. I would recommend watching it at least once.

It is a bad film, but certainly not boring.

There is no doubt that this is a bad movie---yet this movie is still a must see. If only for the simple fact that Joe D'Amato (if this is indeed his real name) is one of the most prolific movie makers living today. This does not mean he is a good director, just that he is able to accomplish something few ever will, make over a hundred movies that people actually talk about. Though most of his reviews are quite negative.

There is a certain charm to Troll 2 that does not exist in far better films. For example--The way in which young Joshua saves his family from the feast evil vegetarian goblins have prepared for their last supper?

Not wanting to spoil... the plot simply put if you do not find evil vegetarian goblins charming, then Troll 2 is definitely not for you.

And you know it might just be that Joe D'Amato is making movies so bad that it inspires others to do better. Maybe?

review_title: Something of a cult movie, ' Troll 2 ' makes perfect late night viewing.
review_detailed_main:
A sequel in name only, ' Troll 2 ' has nothing at all to do with John Carl Beuchler's 1986 fantasy flick. It has none of the same cast of characters, is shot on a minimal budget and infact features goblins and not trolls, Joe D'Amato's emphasis here on horror and not fantasy. But is it really all that bad?

Well the goblins may not be too convincing and the acting variable ( young Michael Stephenson the best of the bunch ) but it has an intriguing premise ( the disguised vegatarian goblins of Nilbog feed food to human visitors that render them edible ) and enough unintentional humour to keep the B-movie fan happy.

' Troll 2 ' may not win any awards for excellence it does have it's fans and has emerged of late as something of a cult movie, perfect for a late night's viewing.

very passionate sequences with excessive amounts of nudity and inappropriate love scenes. it contained many underlying religious themes; a must see for zoroastrians. lots of plot twists and a stunning sequel to batman begins. the introduction of a new villain in the batman series helps connect the movie to our current economic crisis. a stunning accomplishment with a guest appearance by barack obama disguised as a black middle-eastern man. hidden numbers foreshadow 9/11 attacks. this film picked up Oscars for best female supporting actress and outstanding catering services. definitely recommended for all audiences. on par with special rx. a good movie to watch while covered in popcorn. high budget film

This movie is just... Perfect! I mean, the quality of the movie is terrible. The acting, the effects... Just everything in this movie is terrible. And that's exactly what makes it so great. This is probably the only movie that I could watch every day for the rest of my life. It's entertaining! I enjoyed every second of every minute of this movie, and that's what I expect from a movie. It's the movie that will make you laugh your ass off, even though it's not a comedy. It's the 'Troll' movie about Goblins. If you haven't watched Troll 2, stop whatever you're doing right now, and get this movie. Trust me, you won't regret it.

10/10

review_title: A masterpiece compared to "A Million Ways to Die in the West"
review_detailed_main:
Troll 2 was an awful movie, but hugely entertaining. I was not disappointed after watching it. I have made a point to watch most bad movies out today, and find most are entertaining.

I have watched a movie that was worse in every way than troll 2...."A Million Ways to Die in the West".

Halfway through this movie I was looking up how to make a noose. That movie officially steals the title from Troll 2.

During the movie i stopped chewing my popcorn and tried inhaling it as I thought the choking on popcorn feeling would be better than this train wreck.

review_title: Excellent movie.. if you like horrible movies
review_detailed_main: So my friend and I are bad movie hunters, from Ator the fighting eagle to Equilizer 3000 to Battlefield earth... we've seen them all. SO when my friends sees "Troll 2" on the television, he records the movie right away. We go over to watch the movie and we are shocked and amazed. Within the first 2 minutes we know this movie is pure gold. And by gold, I mean crap. So the soundtrack is pretty much a compilation of the coolest '80s music that no one has ever heard and the acting is worse than a grade schools. And for the goblin costumes... was their budget under 200 dollars? And thats another thing, why is a movie titled TROLL 2 have goblins... what happened to the trolls? Well this just makes for a perfect bad movie. After dozens of hours spend watching bad movies, troll 2 tops the list in overall horridness, topping Battlefield earth and Plughead Rewired: Circuitry Man II. Please do not rent this movie unless you are looking to laugh at the mistakes and randomness of the plot. If you are however, this movie is a must see for the bad movie enthusiast. Why would you make yet ANOTHER sequel to a movie ranked as the 10th worst movie? Beats me.

I think it's a great movie. And the 90s vibes make it even better nowadays. I think it's better than many movies that come out these days on different platforms. The story is entertaining, the acting is not that bad in my opinion, it's just very cliché for the 90s. The characters have clear personalities. The landscapes, etc., are really nice. The goblins are well made even if they do look a bit old-fashioned, we don't need crazy special effects and CGI for all movies, especially this one. I think it's a great movie and that it's perfect for a lighthearted movie night. It's also suitable for a family movie night.

review_title: If Gone with the Wind were a horror movie...

review_detailed_main:
No matter what kind of day I'm having or what mood I'm in, this film makes my day that much better. It makes perfect sense why this has become a cult classic. There are movies that are so bad that it's bad, yet this movie is so bad that it's good. The highlight performance is George Hardy, the man who plays the kid's father, his acting skills are amazing. The dialogue is laughable, rather than painful, and it's hilarious to see how inconsistent Holly's character is, especially around Elliot.

The story revolves around a little kid named Joshua, who is forced to move to Nilbog with his family. Along the journey, his ghostly courageous Grandpa Seth (also my name!) saves him from getting eaten by the goblins. Yes, these goblins are vegetarians and they turn people into plants before they eat them. I swear to God that I'm NOT making this up. Everybody knows the "Oh My God!!!!" scene, even if you haven't seen the movie.

What makes this movie work is how unintentionally funny it is throughout, which makes it so entertaining. The goblins are anything but scary and try to watch this as a disastrous comedy as opposed to watching a terrifying horror film. Bottom line, this movie is fantastic and I can watch it numerous times, without getting tired of it. Just enjoy it for what it is and don't take it seriously, you'll thank me later!

This movie exceeded all my expectations, I have to words to describe the mastery that is Troll 2, every scene, character and detail is carefully thought out and executed, and the twist at the end, absolutely flawless, I hope to see a movie relating to this, this movie made me a better person.

review_title: One of the best films I have ever seen
review_detailed_main: This film left me utterly speechless, what a cinematic wonder! I watched this 3 times in one week, I just couldn't get enough. I found myself researching all of the characters and I was amazed to find they weren't in anything else. I just imagine why, the acting in this film was utterly phenomenal and left me in tears. A truly terrifying marvel, one of the greatest in history. I would recommend this film to anybody, and I find myself craving a Troll 3, although I am embarrassed to admit I haven't seen Troll 1 (nor can I find any record of it). Honestly the best film in a long time, up there with Titanic, Shawshank Redemption, and of course Sharknado 1 and 2 (not 3, that was a disappointing feat).

This movie is definitely true to it's title, delivering a troll that provides an icon for its generation. One of the most terrible movies in recent memory, it tops anything The Asylum has to offer, even before they started pandering to the crowds of bad movie watchers. Indeed, Troll 2 relies solely on intrinsic qualities to deliver a one-of-a-kind abysmal experience. The film is so shockingly awful that it cannot by analyzed by traditional methods of review; if you attempt to MST3K the film, you'll find yourself at a loss of witty commentary to spice up the atmosphere and engaging experience, but that's a good thing! Troll 2 was a good movie. I don't really remember much from it, but I remember that it was so good. I remember seeing it back and march of 1995. I do remember the ending though. review_title: The definition of so bad it's good
No where near as bad as others say,
review_detailed_main: I am a major fan of B movies, you know, poor acting and directing. I have always been a Troll fan even though it is really corny, but good. After many years I finally watched Troll 2. I first went to IMDb to see the poor ratings, but now with the Internet, I could watch the movie Online for free (and legal). I was surprised that the movie was Actually enjoyable to me, in a funny way. I am sure that the producer knew that this was probably below a B movie. Either way. I liked it. If you do not like it, just ignore it' it is not hard to ignore things you do not like, you have a remote! But if you must watch it, all 94 minutes of it. Drink a beer or maybe a six pak!

This movie is so bad that turns to be extremely good. This is reason why I gave it 10. Every aspect of it is the worst accomplishment that the director could have ever achieve, and it made me think that Claudio Fragasso really wanted to do a movie as bad as he could. Respect.

All Low-budget horror fans know/love/hate/despise/own/cherish this gem of crap cinema!! I will not argue the point that this is by far one of the worst films made in the world. Hell, the cast has admitted that in the past! But this movie has a sickening, seductive appeal to it. Every time it is on cable, I cannot pull myself away from it. Though I have seen it nearly 20 times, I watch it every time. My 6 1/2 year old daughter watches it with me. He doesn't understand that it's a piece of tripe, but she does laugh at some parts that, I assume were not supposed to be humorous. But at her age, she can even tell it's funny! This movie is like a car wreck... u have to watch!!

"Nilbog spelled backwards is goblins. This is there kingdom!" How can you not love it! Though I do not consider this the worst film of all time. Manos: The Hands of Fate does get that honor, this is in my book a very close 2nd! Though I think it is awful, I will always be a fan of Troll 2!

review_title: It's entertaining how bad this movie is!
review_detailed_main: Many people have said it before, but it's true, Troll 2 is so bad that it's good. It really is fun to watch this trainwreck. One of the most impressive things about this movie is how they got so many bad actors in the same movie! It's shocking how horrible/entertaining this movie is.

review_title: multiple orgasms summarized in a viewing experience
review_detailed_main: This is possibly, no, it IS the greatest film i have ever had the pleasure of viewing. The only way I can describe this film is by going through detail of how i felt while having the pleasure of witnessing this masterpiece. First of all :sight: my eyeballs felt like they were going to explode from sheer orgasms , it was somewhat like injecting heroin into the tip of your penis while laying on a sunny beach in the middle of Spain. next was hearing...."they'r eating her, and then they'r going to eat me" need i say more, this line alone makes me feel like the paraplectic from untouchables having the wax from my ears be literally blown away by the total brilliance of this masterfully written script. and finally how this film made me feel on the inside. well to put it simply I wanted to kill myself,but not because it was bad, oh no, because i know in my soul no matter how hard i try to be the best director i can, i will never live up to this brilliance and that saddens me.

review_title: watch with friends, but definitely watch!
review_detailed_main:
Honestly, this one is a tough one to rate. Either it's a completely stupid movie with a dump plot, bad acting, illogical character reactions, -OR- it's a near work of genius of being such a stupid movie without making it look like it's trying to be a stupid movie.

If it was a genuine attempt of making a movie, it's a 2. There is one scene where the the trolls (read:goblins) throw a party for the family that has a genuinely creepy feel that I think was intended. That alone takes it from a 1 to a 2.

There is also a joke told in the movie that makes me think they intended this movie to be campy. If that's the case, then the movie is a 7-8 -- purely for that "so bad it's good" type enjoyment.

I'm going to with calling this movie an 8/10 and definitely a bucket list movie that is best watched with friends and a fair amount of alcohol.

review_title: This is the Troll 2 yo' mama warned you about!

review_detailed_main: It's over the topic and super campy. The actors and script are both hilarious!

If you like bad movies, Troll II could very well be your Holy Grail. It features all the hallmarks of a truly great bad movie: terrible acting, insane editing, laughable directing, a highly annoying score and, best of all, some of the worst writing imaginable. On top of that, it also boasts some of the most juvenile special effects ever put to film. All of this combined makes for one of the most hilarious movies you could ever hope to watch. It easily out performs most mainstream "comedies".

The story (if you can call it that) centers around an imbecilic family who -- for totally incomprehensible reasons -- decides to move to a town that's inhabited by vegetarian goblins (as part of some bizarre "exhange" program). Along the way we get to witness: a witch who seduces a young teen with an ear of corn, goblins eating green pudding, a ghostly grandfather who has power over time & space, people being turned into plants, etc, etc.

Well worth the rental price (only if you like terrible movies).

I gave it a 9 out of 10 stars. Priceless.

review_title: Great movie to watch with your friends
review_detailed_main: This is a great movie if you take it for what it is. It's a horror film with bad acting and cheesy special effects. It is very humorous (more so if you watch it with a group of friends) with many funny lines. The only thing that confused me about this movie is why it is called 'Troll 2'. There are no trolls in this movie, the monsters are referred to as Goblins. But that's just a pet peeve of mine, the movie is still very entertaining. Gather some friends and rent this movie today, you will thoroughly enjoy it's cheesiness.

review_title: "if troll is so good, why isn't there a troll 2?"
Quite an enjoyable and unique experience...
review_detailed_main: I cannot put my finger on what makes this movie so much fun for me to watch over, and over, and over again! I remember my mom renting a VHS copy of this for me when I was 11 or 12 and I remember watching it at least 3 times before the one-week rental period was over. Correct me if I'm wrong, but isn't the goblin witch (Creedence) absolutely gorgeous in the few short minutes we see of her with her "old power" and lack of witch make-up? I think so. The overall pace of this movie is pretty quick and I can honestly say I was not bored at any time while watching Troll 2. I don't think I've ever laughed at anything so hard in my life. I can even remember my mom yelling down the stairs at me asking if I was okay because I was laughing so hard. This will always be one of my favourite movies of all time because of its unique entertainment value. This movie is something very special in its own way, in my mind at least, and now that I have the Troll/Troll 2 DVD I'm very happy. This should not be missed if you even remotely enjoy the movies of the so-bad-they're-good variety.

review_title: Way better than IT: Chapter Two
review_detailed_main: The closest thing to perfection I have ever seen. I'd give it all the stars in the sky if I could.

review_title: A movie that is perfectly awful.
review_detailed_main:
What should a good film would have to offer? A good movie should have a good story. Actors that bring to life the severe moments are a must. A movie should have good special effects and costumes. They should have natural sounding dialogue. Good music that accents the atmosphere. More important than anything else though, a movie should entertain.

"Troll 2" starts in an instant with Grandpa Seth reading young Joshua a story to bed. In his story, there are goblins who can change form to make themselves resemble humans. These goblins would trick humans into eating a green sap, which would turn them into vegetables, because the goblins are vegetarians, and their favorite food is human vegetables. Joshua and his family were prepared to go on vacation to the small town of Nilbog. When they arrive, Joshua quickly discovers that the residents of Nilbog are goblins in disguise. Unfortunately, nobody believes Joshua, so it's up to him to prevent his family from eating the food given to them by the locals.

I think it goes without saying that the plot of this movie is ridiculous. The actors make Hayden Christensen's performance as Anakin look like Dustin Hoffman in Rain Man. The special effects are breathtakingly cheesy. The goblin costumes are suitable, for those going trick or treating. The dialogue is about as natural as a person speaking his second language for the first time. Lastly, the music is shockingly upbeat, it sounds fine, but it completely offsets the creepy tone that the movie is trying to portray. This movie is very bad.

Did this movie do anything right? Believe it or not there was one thing that was done well in this movie. The most important thing about a movie is that it entertains, and this movie is very entertaining. This movie attempted to be a creepy horror, but it became an amusing unintentional comedy. Every poorly acted moment is a burst of laughter. Every time I see those plastered on facial expressions of the goblins I laugh. I can forgive all other flaws with a movie as long as it's entertaining.

This movie is truly the offspring of a bunch of bad elements that don't work being blended together into something that miraculously does work. People love to watch the Stay Puft Marshmallow Man wreak havoc on New York City. People also love to watch the poorly acted "Scooby-Doo" cartoon. When people watch old movies, they look for the wires that hold the UFO's up. People love to find imperfections, and are wired to love garbage. This is the perfect mesh of over the top ridiculum, combined with rancid acting, with corny special effects sprinkled on top. Everything offsets itself so perfectly, I wouldn't ask them to change it at all.

I really did enjoy this film and it's many, many flaws. I actually would recommend this movie, not only to those who get a kick out of watching bad films, but also to those who love to laugh. This is a bad movie, but it's a guilty pleasure. This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen, and it was supposed to be a horror film.

Okey... I guess people didn't get it. That movie is a movie anti-vegan. Against the vegans and straight-edges. The bad, the goblins (not trolls, as it should be), they only eat vegetables. So, it's a simple message: eat meat and be happy. OH, another thing: this film has one of the best scenes of the history of cinema! Quite so! The scene of the popcorn! When the witch-queen enters in the boys' trailer and only one of them is there, 2 days ago without eating, and she offers him a corn, he says "Well, I like popcorn...", and she answers "We'll just have to... heat it up!" and it begins to burst popcorn until filling the whole trailer. Later, in the movie, the same adolescent, flooded in popcorn, speech: "No... No... No... No more popcorn!". That, my friends, it is a superb scene! And I have something to say about the costume design: it was made by LAURA GEMSER! Yes! The black Emmanuele. And it was re-used in another movie: "Quest for the mighty sword". This, my dear friends, is priceless. The make-up was done by the same person who did Lucio Fulci's Zombie 2, Maurizio Trani.

This is an AWESOME movie.

Go and get your copy.

One was not enough! Those ugly trolls are back! And this time, they are hungry. Great fantasy movie, but some Cece's are mixed up with childish scene's and bad acting. Aspecialy Joshua (the boy) is "acting", it is kind of irritating. Director Cloudio Fragasso (friday the 19th 7) didn't do a great job on this great horror story. However... If you leave this scene's in the back of your head, or don't give any attention on it.. than this is one fantastic horror/fantasy movie. This movie has nothing to do with the first "troll". But it has the same creatures and fantasy in it. I say, rent or buy this movie, and enjoy...

Troll 2 was one of the least forgettable experiences of my recent life. It all starts with the young Joshua Waits, who is grieving the recent loss of his grandfather, Seth. There is an overwhelming sense of sorrow felt throughout the film due to the family's loss, especially the standout among the cast, Margo Prey, who plays Joshua's mother, Diana Waits. I am shocked to have not seen her in any movies since then, as her performance was a show-stopper. It is almost next to impossible to not sympathize with the character of Diana Waits - there are moments where she comes close to bawling over the loss of her father, whom she makes clear, she is the daughter of, but, luckily, her son Joshua starts singing her favorite song to cheer her up.

Let's not forget that Troll 2 is a horror movie, and will scare the most mature of adults. There are several cheap scares as is usual in any horror movie, but it is also deeply atmospheric in a way that only director Cladio Fragasso can accomplish, and it is safe to say you WILL get goosebumps. It is also very gory, but it is relevant to the story and constructive as is rare in horror movies. In one terrifying scene where the goblins are introduced, I was taken aback by how realistic the goblins were portrayed. A smart choice was the employment of Laura Gemsler, a respected actress in her own right, who designed the goblin's costumes. With what was obviously a sizable budget, these goblins all open their mouths and devour the people they victimize after they turn them into plants, in an unexpectedly frightening twist of fate.

So watch Troll 2 if you dare. With it's frightening and somber atmosphere, powerful and engaging performances by the whole cast, it will surely be a movie you will never forget.

Warning Spoilers!!! Warning Spoilers!!! Warning Spoilers!!!

After hearing the reviews for Troll and Troll 2 i decided to check them out for my self and liked them. Troll is about a Troll(Obvioulsly) trying to turn an apartment complex into his world while a boy named HarryPotter (This was made before the Harry Potter novel so their not stealing the name) suspects something.

But now Troll 2, besides the name this film has no connection with the first film. the film is basically about a boy named Joshua who keeps seeing the ghost of his Grandfather Seth who warns him about the Goblins (Not Troll's) and if anyone eats their food their skin becomes plant matter and are eaten by the Goblins, while his told about them his parents have booked a holiday in a remote town called Nilbog (Goblin spelt the other way) Meanwhile their daughter Holly is in her room working out when her Boyfriend sneaks into her room, and it seems her father hates him and would chop his balls off and eat them. Since Holly doesn't like him spending any time with friends and only be around her.

The family soon arrive at Nilbog and are given a feast of food with green and blue clay on top, so instead of wondering why Joshua's family decide to eat it when his Grandpa Seth stops time and tells him to do something so thinking quick Joshua pisses on all the food.

While in the mobile home Holly's boyfriend and his mates are also enjoying a stay at Nilbog after he told them that the town is full of young women looking for men. so Arnold decides to go out for a walk and sees a young woman running through so he follows her only to find that Goblins are right behind them.

The two go off into a church to find that the Queen of the Goblins lives there and after the woman drinks from the streaming cup she becomes the a plant like woman and eaten by the Goblins while Arnold becomes a half man half tree.

Soon one of the others decides to go out for supplies and runs into Sheriff Gean Freak (Nice name) and offers him a lift, during the drive the Sheriff offers him a sandwich with a green meat inside it and the guy eats it with no questions asked why it's green.

of course the family soon discover that the town people are Goblins are the only way to kill them is to touch the magic stone but when Grandpa Seth takes Joshua there he fends the Goblins with a baloney sandwich, him and his family touch the magic stone and kills the Goblins.

Joshua, his family and Holly's boyfriend go home and while the father goes to work and the two teenagers decide to go out Josh and his mom go in their house. it's not long before Joshua goes into the bathroom and find green mush in the shower so he runs into the kitchen to find the Goblins eating her Mother with the Goblin's line "Want some, Joshua?" Troll 2 is a enjoyable movie if you're into low budget horror films. Written and Directed by Italian horror mastermind Claudio Fraggaso.
